jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Sales Enablement at Atlassian is a blend of art & science - the art of expanding the Atlassian 'no sales' philosophy of adopting a simplified experience with the customer, combined with the science of understanding how to build effective product enthusiasts out of every individual and role in our direct and channel sales organizations. Atlassian is looking for an Enablement specialist to onboard, enable, and train our customer-facing organizations who help Atlassian customers make informed decisions based on the capabilities of Atlassian's products. More About You For this role, we want someone who thinks strategically but executes with fine precision - part customer service specialist, part technologist, part program/launch owner, and part mentor. The job is not just about the technical bits (though that is meaningful) - but also about how to optimize the knowledge and skills of our field teams and to accelerate the customer product adoption cycle. The person in this role will be instrumental in leading and implementing learning programs, building e-Learnings and training sessions, and supporting other key strategic program initiatives with a strong focus on the development of our Sales organization. You are deeply passionate about learning and the chance to lead and deliver unique programs to support a rapidly growing and broadly distributed Sales organization. You will be on the front line working closely with Sales leaders and influencers, you are comfortable managing projects end-to-end, and you are excited to support the growth of the Sales Culture through highly visible programs. Role And Responsibilities Implement sales enablement strategy to support our enterprise selling motions and Enterprise Advocates Build and deliver enablement on sales methodology, product messaging, problems we solve for our customers through materials, tools, training sessions, etc. Partner with sales leadership, sales operations and product marketing to align training and enablement priorities with Atlassian's vision and strategic imperatives. Help facilitate collaboration between other sales teams - i.e. SEs, EDRs, & LAs Improve processes and document workflows - i.e. account planning, sales process documentation, sales methodology implementation Support onboarding of new team members Facilitate Coaching & Skills Development Help implement sales systems and process strategy - the day in the life story of tools and systems Learning and development strategy - help identify skills matrix and up-leveling of skills Contextualize Product & Marketing content for the team - What's in it for me? Why is this important to my role? Monitor performance metrics of enablement programs and sales success Create and evolve programs that shorten the ramp-up time to productivity Align with EA Leadership and Management on key priorities Skills And Experience Combination of 4 years of enterprise solutions selling, sales enablement, or sales training experience Experience establishing strong relationships with leadership teams Leverage change management best practices to ensure the successful adoption of strategic initiatives. Demonstrated ability to manage projects and programs involving cross-departmental contributors and partners Experience implementing enterprise sales methodologies & helping to drive good sales processes & hygiene Prior experience selling to the enterprise, preferable B2B SaaS Demonstrated interpersonal negotiation and resolution skills Proven ability to design and deliver sales training and development programs that scale and measure the results Experiencing using technology to build programs that scale. Experience working in an entrepreneurial, fast-changing environment that requires critical thinking, resourcefulness, results-oriented decision-making and commitment to excellence Strong sense of urgency and personal accountability, not afraid to get hands-on Exposure to using JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket and other Atlassian products is a strong positive Solid attention to detail and brand alignment Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. About Atlassian The world’s best teams work better together with Atlassian. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team . We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. To learn more about our culture and hiring process, explore our Candidate Resource Hub .

Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Our Channel Sales Team is comprised of people with backgrounds in enterprise partnerships, business development, and solution selling. We develop and support our solution partners to cultivate a diverse, well rounded partner ecosystem that can support the dynamic needs of Atlassian's business and customers. We're hiring a Partner Specialist, reporting to the Senior Manager, Channel Acceleration. We're seeking an experienced channel professional that knows how to onboard, develop, enable and manage our growing network of solution partners. We're looking for someone who knows how to build partner relationships, and motivate partners to acquire the necessary knowledge and skills to grow their Atlassian business. What you'll do Manage dozens of partners within one or more territories, as part of a broader global team Own and build partner relationships Onboard and orient partners with minimal ramp up time and maximum productivity Drive partners to achieve accreditations and certifications Drive partner engagement and partner program awareness Educate, equip and enable partners on the program benefits and resources available to them Ensure partners follow sales and marketing best practices Identify, plan with and develop growth partners Create marketing and business plans with target partners based on templated plans Assign new leads to partners with professional communications and follow up with customers to ensure their needs are being met Review situations from partners where they need assistance for technical and billing questions and escalate as needed Lead partner check ins and cadence calls Track partner compliance, metrics and performance Resolve partner accreditation & certification issues Support partner eLearning in the Atlassian Enablement Academy Your background You have experience onboarding and managing partners in the enterprise software industry At least two years experience in a channel development role with a proven ability to build rapport with partners You understand what it takes to enable and equip partners for success, and you're passionate about seeing partners succeed & realize the value proposition of our unique business model A drive to represent the Atlassian's Channel and advocate on behalf of our partners Strong interpersonal, teamwork and organizational skills Ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with partners Ability to adapt and excel in a fast pasted and constantly changing environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills, the ability to communicate eloquently with tact Our perks & benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. If you love working with new systems, technologies and working with multiple teams across an organization, then Atlassian has a superb opportunity for you. As a Workplace Technology Asset Manager, you will be responsible for the lifecycle of ~11,000 devices globally. You will regularly liaise with Technical Support Team Leads, with a focus on data accuracy and consistency across regions, making asset information accessible when and where it is needed. More About You We love people with a healthy balance of technical ability and a passion for customer service. You are analytical and have a background in IT and are familiar with the asset/inventory management systems and hardware used in corporate IT environments. You don't take things at face value because ‘that's the way they are done’, but rather seek to understand the reasons and then take steps to improve. You have an eye for process improvement, attention to detail and love brainstorming new ideas and solutions for continuous improvement. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Previous experience within an Asset Management Role (at least 12 months) ITIL v3 or 4 certified Excellent communication skills Experience in vendor relationship management Familiarity/experience with Asset/CI management systems Familiarity with Fixed Asset Registers and finance/tax terminologies used in the process Experience with onboarding and offboarding of customers in a remote/WFH environment It is great, but not required, if you have experience with: Experience with Atlassian software (JIra Service Management, Insight) Experience with Apple Business Manager Experience with various MDM solutions such as Jamf or Workspace One Experience working with a globally distributed team Experience in the Integration of two SaaS systems (such as integrating Jamf and Insight together) More About This Position Atlassian is full of awesome hard-working people making cool things for our customers. As the Asset Manager of global devices, you will be required to liaise with teams throughout the business such as the WPT leadership team, Finance, Account and Tax teams in order to streamline, enhance and provide improved strategies for the daily operational and strategic management of devices within the scope of the Workplace Technology Team. You will work closely with our Global Tech Support team to enhance and provide strategies employed in reporting of assets being utilized and maximizing value of said CI’s. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Associate Customer Success Intern, 2023 Summer U.S.
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian Customer Success Managers (CSMs) help customers realize the value in their Atlassian investment. They proactively engage with customers to achieve early and sustained outcomes by accelerating product adoption. This is achieved by helping customers apply standard methodologies at scale, expand their solution footprint, and become growing, long-term customers. You will report to the Manager, Customer Success and collaborate frequently with members across the company. CSMs work with all parts of Atlassian as the primary champion of the user's cause. Not eligible for Visa sponsorship. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN, or H-1B student graduates at this time. What You'll Do Learn the skills to become a product and use case specialist across multiple product and solution practice areas Identify main metrics for a customer's success and driving Atlassian value Develop an understanding of the customer journey from implementation to adoption and expansion Collaboration across teams to ensure customer satisfaction Learn how to remove hurdles and deliver value through proactive and programmatic customer engagement Your Background Currently enrolled in a 4 year degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship, graduating by June 2024 Pursuing a degree in Business, Communications, Management Information Systems, Marketing, or similar Experience working in a team environment Project collaboration experience Experience diagnosing customer needs and translating those needs into relevant solutions Able to commit to a 12 week full-time (40hrs/week) internship during Summer 2023 More About Our Team Our Customer Success Managers are a globally distributed team of Atlassian customer advocates who are passionate about promoting and accelerating customer success. As a part of the team, you'll engage with customers to deliver an impactful solution to their users. CSMs are the trusted contacts whom customers can rely on to help them get the most out of Atlassian products and attain their ideal solution for team collaboration. At Atlassian, you'll have an impact on millions of users, fast! We don't just want to know your opinions, we want to see your ideas in action. We hire great people and then trust them to be outstanding. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Your future team Join Atlassian to start your career with us to have impact on how millions of users collaborate and use software. The most amazing thinkers—like NASA rocket scientists and Tesla engineers—are coming to us for solutions. We're in the business of developing software to help teams everywhere get amazing ideas on the ground and into the world. Sound like an exciting place to start your career? Here you'll be encouraged to use your imagination and try new things. You'll be guided (as we are) by our core values, and you'll be supported by some of the best minds in tech. You will report to one of our analytics managers within our marketing organization. Not eligible for Visa sponsorship. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN, or H-1B student graduates at this time. What you'll do Work with partners to identify high impact opportunities for analytics, and align analytics & data science priorities with our partner's strategy Improve user journey and customer value by managing large volumes of data to understand insightful trends Guide the measurement culture and understand the impact of our partner's strategy; including designing and analyzing experiments and feature launches Envision, scope, and implement projects by collaborating with partners, customer research, data engineers and other data scientists Share your high-quality recommendations to multiple levels of leadership to guide important decisions and shape overall company strategies Foster a world-class analytics culture, leading by example, through education and creation of self-service tools, to make a lasting change in how your partners use data to make decisions Your background Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and graduating between December 2022 to June 2023 Experience with SQL and other programming languages Experience with dashboard tools like Tableau, Micro-strategy, PowerBI Can commit to a full-time (40hrs / week) Have a passion for Data Science, expressed by previous internships, work experience, projects, or publications Please note: At this time, this role is only open to entry-level candidates with less than a year of professional experience (this does not include internships/co-ops) It's great, but not required, if you Have experience with machine learning and predictive modeling Have a general understanding of supervised learning, optimization, and statistical analysis Can translate business problems into technical solutions Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Work with our team of machine learning scientists to deliver value through machine learning applications Build machine learning workflow platforms and libraries Work with large datasets of behavioral and textual data Research and implement appropriate machine learning algorithms and tools Have proficiency in Python AND Java, Kotlin, or Scala Have experience in one or more SQL languages such as PostgreSQL, Redshift, MySQL, etc. Have experience working with large datasets in the cloud As a Machine Learning Scientist you... Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Are you dedicated to extraordinary user experience, have awesome technical chops, love solving problems, and relish variety? If so, Atlassian has a phenomenal opportunity for you as part of our Associate Product Manager (APM) Program. This outstanding and "self-starter" opportunity as an APM will give your career in product management a head start with great support from an entrepreneurial team and experience in steering the direction of our products. You will gain experience in: conducting customer & partner interviews that translate insight into action, crafting product specs that meets our user and business needs, researching & communicating competitive analysis, and new market/product opportunities (among other projects). In this role, you'll have the opportunity to wear multiple hats while crafting creative solutions for our customer's greatest challenges. We promise you'll never be bored! To learn more about the APM program go to Associate Product Manager Program | Atlassian . Not eligible for Visa sponsorship. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN , or H-1B student graduates at this time. Please note: At this time, this role is only open to entry level candidates with less than a year of professional experience (this does not include internships/co-ops). On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Be currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters and graduating by June 2023 Have a passion for building and analyzing technology products, customer needs, and market dynamics Have an interest in translating customer insights into meaningful results for our engineering teams Be able to think from multiple perspectives, including our customers and development teams Deep understanding of the value of collaboration and teamwork More about the Associate Product Management (APM) Program Our APM opportunities range from 12 week summer internships to graduate opportunities for candidates who are starting out in their careers. Our APM grad program is crafted and designed to accelerate the growth of exceptionally creative problem solvers into the next generation of global leaders. Our APMs experience two, one-year long rotations with different Atlassian product teams. More About Our Team You'll be joining a team that is smart and very direct. We challenge each other constantly to improve our work, learn, and ask hard questions. We're dedicated to agile methodology and are big believers in 'lean' (which means we don't do documentation for documentation's sake). We know the importance of validating assumptions about users and use various types of testing to determine whether we're right (or wrong). Our bottom line is improving our user's experience—no matter what Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. This outstanding and "self-starter" opportunity as an APM will give your career in product management a head start with great support from an entrepreneurial team and experience in steering the direction of our products. You will gain experience in: conducting customer & partner interviews that translate insight into action, crafting product specs that meets our user and business needs, researching & communicating competitive analysis, and new market/product opportunities (among other projects). In this role, you'll have the opportunity to wear multiple hats while crafting creative solutions for our customer's greatest challenges. We promise you'll never be bored! To learn more about the APM program go to Associate Product Manager Program | Atlassian . Not eligible for Visa sponsorship. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN , or H-1B student graduates at this time. Please note: At this time, this role is only open to entry level candidates with less than a year of professional experience (this does not include internships/co-ops). On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Be currently enrolled in a Bachelors or Masters and graduating by June 2023 Have a passion for building and analyzing technology products, customer needs, and market dynamics Have an interest in translating customer insights into meaningful results for our engineering teams Be able to think from multiple perspectives, including our customers and development teams Deep understanding of the value of collaboration and teamwork More about the Associate Product Management (APM) Program Our APM opportunities range from 12 week summer internships to graduate opportunities for candidates who are starting out in their careers. Our APM grad program is crafted and designed to accelerate the growth of exceptionally creative problem solvers into the next generation of global leaders. Our APMs experience two, one-year long rotations with different Atlassian product teams. More About Our Team You'll be joining a team that is smart and very direct. We challenge each other constantly to improve our work, learn, and ask hard questions. We're dedicated to agile methodology and are big believers in 'lean' (which means we don't do documentation for documentation's sake). We know the importance of validating assumptions about users and use various types of testing to determine whether we're right (or wrong). Our bottom line is improving our user's experience—no matter what Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. About Atlassian The world’s best teams work better together with Atlassian. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Want to build the future of code collaboration at a company built by developers for developers? Does working on a project that serves millions of end users float your boat? Are you an experienced software developer who’s passionate about building, debugging, and optimizing SaaS software running at scale? Come join us at Atlassian and work on bitbucket.org , our source code hosting site! You will be working in a fast-paced SaaS environment where every line of code you write will be appreciated by a developer community of millions. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, monitoring, scaling and optimizing the code that powers Bitbucket. The company and our products are scaling rapidly and this is the team with the most to gain. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Leading the technical design and development of new software applications, features, and distributed services that support a high-scale web application Designing, building, and maintaining RESTful APIs Troubleshooting issues with existing architecture and code Experience with performance tuning, profiling and debugging applications and services serving millions of requests per day. Contributing to each step of the product development process, (ideation, implementation, and release) Programming in Java, Golang, or Python (experience with Django is a plus) Schema-based data storage (SQL) It's Great, But Not Required If You Have Agile development methodologies like XP and Scrum Operating systems (POSIX UNIX) Networking (IP, routing, RPC) Encryption and authentication protocols (OAuth, SSL) A solid understanding of distributed version control internals including data structures and experience running DVCS servers. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Atlassian is looking for an experienced Back End Software Engineer to join the Confluence Ecosystems team in Mountain View. You will have a direct impact to the customer experience through the design and implementation of new features and functionalities in Confluence. You'll work as part of a small but rapidly growing team delivering incredible, creative improvements our product. You'll collaborate with other Software Engineers to write the best code for the project and deliver amazing results that our users love. On your first day, we will expect you to have: Proficiency in Java programming and debugging Solid fundamental skills in data structures, algorithms and Service Oriented Architectures Strong engineering skills in building well-tested, reliable software components Proficiency in relational databases and handling data at scale Ability to work closely with support engineers on customer facing issues Experience crafting and implementing highly scalable and performant RESTful micro-services Knowledge of the principles to construct fault-tolerance, reliable and durable software systems Knowledge to evaluate trade-offs between correctness, robustness, performance, space and time Understanding of SaaS, PaaS, IaaS industry with hands-on experience with public cloud offerings (e.g., AWS, GAE, Azure) Bachelor or higher degree, or its equivalent, in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems Management or a closely related field of study. It's Awesome, But Not Required If You Have Spring, XML, OSGi, Shell scripting AWS experience preferred Experience with large-scale distributed systems Practical knowledge of agile software development methodologies (e.g., XP, scrum) Experience with continuous delivery and infrastructure as code Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is revolutionizing the software development industry and helping teams all around the world like Nasa, Nike, Pixar, and Tesla to advance humanity through the power of software & collaboration. We have over 180,000 customers worldwide, and the Enterprise Development Representatives (EDRs) help the largest of those accounts identify opportunities to grow their investments in Atlassian. This is a fully remote role. Our Enterprise Development Representatives partner with our Enterprise Advocates (Account Executives) to build and implement an effective sales pipeline strategy to drive the adoption of select products and services to our Enterprise customer base. At the same time, we want to ensure our EDRs operate with a sense of grace and professionalism that ensures a delightful customer experience. All of this is done in tight coordination with our Sales Operations & Marketing organizations. Enterprise Development Representatives are customer-focused and creative. They are able to think strategically and effectively adjust their approach to meet the needs of our customers. You need to have an understanding of the Enterprise Sales process & be able to thrive in Atlassian’s unique sales model. What You'll Do Partner with our Enterprise Advocates (Account Executives) to build and implement a consultative sales pipeline with our existing customer base Consult our Enterprise customers on the value and logistics of a Cloud migration Drive adoption of select new products in the ITSM and security space Manage first-touch sales communications to a book of accounts Your Background You have at least 1 year of experience in software sales and experience achieving targets in a lead-generation role You are fluent in Portuguese, including professional and technical vocabulary You are organized and love to Play, as a Team You are customer-focused, creative, an effective communicator in both written and verbal forms, and analytical You can effectively build a pipeline in coordination with our Enterprise Advocate and Enterprise Marketing teams. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. On the Atlassian Talent Acquisition team, we use a collaborative, data-driven approach to hiring, building strategic initiatives, and helping leadership hire the right people, at the right time. Our mission is to establish Talent Acquisition as a strategic competitive advantage for the Atlassian brand overall. The Atlassian team is growing at a record pace and this will be an exciting opportunity to create a real impact! You'll be pivotal to our team's success by managing the change impact of several key strategic projects across Talent Acquisition, within our Strategy and Craft Team. What you'll do" Lead the development and execution of change management strategies for global Talent Acquisition; balancing our long-term vision with immediate needs to ensure successful project delivery. Develop and deliver change plans and strategies to support the engagement of key stakeholders and the broader team. This may also include creating engaging written comms and elevating the visibility of change initiatives and progress. Develop and drive training plans to support our teams to embed important changes across the team. Create and nurture strong relationships with important partners across the TA team and People function, ensuring that their challenges, opportunities, and feedback are incorporated into how we roll out the change. Ensure change-related risk (people, operations, organizational) is within desired levels and that risks are managed according to agreed risk frameworks by managing and leading the identification. Drive continuous improvement of our change management practices; identify areas for opportunity and support the growth of change leaders within our teams. Coach members of the Talent Acquisition organization around change management. Your Background Worked in a change or transformation capacity – preferably within Talent Acquisition, Human Resources, or People Operations in a multi-geo, large-scaling environment. Knowledge of and experience implementing a variety of change management approaches and frameworks to apply structure to rolling out transformation programs. Worked collaboratively with leadership, influencing to guide not just tactical execution but also larger strategy. You have proven experience delivering change programs with partners across time zones and countries globally. A strategic mindset, recognizing the importance of long-term goals, while balancing the delivery of short-term, tactical requirements. Strong communication, in both written and verbal forms to bring others along on the change journey. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Shape large-scale projects across multiple teams while maintaining alignment with all stakeholders, ensure the program is built to specifications, and measure outcomes. These projects may include instructor-led courses, webinars, eLearnings, Q&A and AMA sessions. Contribute ideas on the development of partner program frameworks that best promote Atlassian's GSI strategy Create meaningful enablement metrics and targets that reflect a growing capability in all areas in the channel partner ecosystem and show the results of our efforts Your background 3+ years project management experience 2+ years enablement/adult learning theory application Enjoy solving problems and managing input from multiple sources; provide potential solutions when there is uncertainty and facilitate decision-making when there is not always a process, system or solution in place Experience collaborating across internal teams and geographies Independent work energizes you Global mindset and the ability to view learning programs at scale Thrive in a fast-paced environment with a experience with solving problems while being resourceful Experience with adult learning theories and instructional methodologies Experience with Intellum Experience working with Global Partners (it's a plus if you work with GSIs) in a XaaS environment and understanding the consultative conversations taking place Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Your Future Team This role is an individual contributor, with a proven track record of driving complex Enablement projects. You will work as part of the Atlassian Channel Enablement team to scope, develop and drive large-scale, comprehensive global partner training and accreditations to support Atlassian products and solutions while maintaining alignment with all stakeholders to ensure the program is built to specifications. You will play an important in delivery of key initiatives, including things like project plan administration, resource management and change management. You will be wearing multiple hats as you manage programs through their lifecycle, and the hats may change from project to project - flexibility and adaptability are key in this fast paced environment. You thrive in an environment where priorities and objectives only inspire you to find creative, informed, and innovative learning solutions to business problems. You Must Love Own your own projects and strategy and blazing new trails Manage multiple, ongoing enablement projects What You'll Do Ensure the Partner community is aware of and prepared for product, feature, pricing and tooling changes mandated by the company. Project manage enablement aspects of launches and ensure all stakeholders are aware of deliverables, and timelines. Establish strong trusted partnerships with cross-functional teams (Partner Success, Partner Programs, Channel Operations, Product Marketing, CSI, Marketplace, and Learning Design) to create and launch quality, purpose-built enablement content and partner resources. Coach stakeholders on enablement best practices; including how to provide necessary inputs for creating an enablement strategy (ie business outcomes, learning objectives) to identify the right goals. Contribute ideas on the development of partner program frameworks, policies, processes and tools that best drive Atlassian's Channel strategy. Create sustainable self-enablement for partners today and be excited to create and evolve high-touch enablement programs for strategic partners in the future. Create meaningful enablement metrics and targets that reflect a growing capability in all areas in the channel partner ecosystem and show the results of our efforts Support the creation of standardized metrics and evaluation processes across learning programs to ensure data driven approach when evaluating and addressing learning needs. Your Background Minimum 3 years of experience in a Program Management or Project Management role, with experience leading Enterprise-level projects. Enablement or Learning and Development background including deep understanding of adult learning theories and instructional methodologies. Understanding of change management processes and best practices, including external and internal audiences. Ability to solve problems and manage input from multiple stakeholders; provide potential solutions when there is uncertainty and facilitate decision-making when there is not always a process, system or solution in place. Experience collaborating with our teams and partners across different departments and geographies. Global mindset and the ability to view learning programs at scale. Qualifications Atlassian is a dynamic, fast-paced company, so adaptability and flexibility are a must. Demonstrated ability to build trusted relationships across diverse range of stakeholders and to work across boundaries to deliver results. Metrics-driven. You use data to frame, inform and guide the prioritization and decision making process, to manage the health of your programs through delivery, and to assess the success and impact once you are done. An ability to think strategically but dive into details when needed. Strong influencing skills. As an individual contributor, you will rely on lots of other people to help define the plan and get it executed. Excellent communication skills and executive presence. Successful experience working with Global Partners in a XaaS environment and understanding the consultative conversations taking place. jobTitle: Channel Enablement Sr. Salesforce Engineer - Sales Technology
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Sales Technology is a passionate team of engineers working diligently to solve a variety of customer-centric problems and challenges. We unleash the potential of other Atlassians working closely with Sales , Partner & Marketing Operations team. As a team, we build intelligent sales and support systems, analytics, and smart tools which leverage a diverse landscape of Atlassian services such as RPA, Salesforce-slack integration etc As a Sr. Salesforce developer, you will provide your expertise to other Atlassians, design/implement Salesforce solutions, and implement integrations with Salesforce by leveraging MuleSoft and micro-services. This role presents an excellent opportunity for the right individual to play a vital role in helping build Partner Experiences. A strong knowledge/background in Channel Enablement and track record of success in the defining solutions of enterprise-scale is essential. Key Responsibilities Include, But Not Limited To Be a trusted technology partner in driving alignment to the company’s cross-channel vision and strategy, supporting Channel KPIs and delivering the highest value capabilities. Drive, develop and maintain numerous project deliverables that support the program throughout the change management cycle, including launch timelines, training delivery and adoption. Drive standardization, process consistency, and data quality across business processes. Build and maintain effective working relationships with SalesTech Product Management team and business stakeholders. Lead, guide, and support team members, and help streamline work processes to improve efficiency and consistency What Skills You Will Need 7-10 years of solution, design and development experience in building solutions on Experience Cloud/SF Partner Community. Minimum 5 year Experience working with Salesforce Lightning experience, creating custom lightning components in aura and LWC frameworks, working with SLDS and JavaScript. Experience integrating Partner tools such as Vartopia, Qollabi etc with Salesforce CRM. Full life cycle experience in solution definition and development and apex/unit testing of the Salesforce application. Deployment experience using ANT and SFDX. Migration tools/changeset/vscode/workbench for salesforce will be preferred. Analysis skills to understand the Business Problem and propose the best technical solution. Enterprise implementations of complex SFDC applications, with reports, workflow, working with several SFDC objects. Expertise in Apex, Visual force, Web Services, SOQL, SOSL, AJAX, XML, JavaScript and HTML. Develop and maintain Visualforce, Force.com pages, and integration to other third-party solutions. Maintain multiple user roles, security, profiles, workflow rules, and flows etc. Strong technical and virtual collaboration skills are a must. Salesforce Admin and Platform Developer I or Experience Cloud Consultant certifications. Working knowledge of GIT Version control with Bitbucket/Github/Gitlab and deployment pipelines. Good to Have (Optional) Working knowledge of agile is a plus. Experience working on Integrations with Mulesoft/Workato. Experience working with Marketo/Marketing Cloud Core Java knowledge will be added advantage. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Do you enjoy working with customers to help them transition to new products and lead organizational change? Are you confident on the phone, experienced in presenting with a technical audience and determined in helping the customer overcome obstacles? If so, then this could be exactly what you're looking for! We are searching for Cloud Migrations Managers (CMMs) that will be at the forefront of helping our enterprise customers learn about migration options and optimally plan and execute on migrating their Atlassian software instance from their On-Premise environment to the Atlassian Cloud. The CMMs wear many hats and are committed to helping large customers migrate with ease. They help coordinate internal and external partners, work as consultants with customers from technical admins to executives, facilitate building strong project plans and drive customer accountability. In addition, they’ll also serve as the voice of the customer internally and issues/drive insights that will craft product strategy and improve our customer success processes. Common Activities That a Cloud Migrations Manager Will Conduct Research and qualify inbound customers to ensure they are "migration ready" based on their license profile and shared information Conduct discovery during the customer migration process to assess and understand their use case, migration needs and any potential roadblocks to migrating Advise customers on how to plan/prepare for migrations from On-Premise to Cloud Ensure customers partner with Technical Support for troubleshooting and to assist with the data migrations Liaise with multiple cross-functional teams, including but not limited to Customer Success Managers, Enterprise Advocates and Loyalty Advocates, Technical Support, Customer Programs, and Product Communicate customer trends and feedback to internal teams to drive improvements to documentation, tooling, product and process; and platform Develop strategic recommendations for how to improve the migration experience for our customers On the first day, Do you enjoy working with customers to help them transition to new products and lead organizational change? Are you confident on the phone, experienced in presenting with a technical audience and determined in helping the customer overcome obstacles? If so, then this could be exactly what you're looking for! We are searching for Cloud Migrations Managers (CMMs) that will be at the forefront of helping our enterprise customers learn about migration options and optimally plan and execute on migrating their Atlassian software instance from their On-Premise environment to the Atlassian Cloud. The CMMs wear many hats and are committed to helping large customers migrate with ease. They help coordinate internal and external partners, work as consultants with customers from technical admins to executives, facilitate building strong project plans and drive customer accountability. In addition, they’ll also serve as the voice of the customer internally and issues/drive insights that will craft product strategy and improve our customer success processes. Common Activities That a Cloud Migrations Manager Will Conduct Research and qualify inbound customers to ensure they are "migration ready" based on their license profile and shared information Conduct discovery during the customer migration process to assess and understand their use case, migration needs and any potential roadblocks to migrating Advise customers on how to plan/prepare for migrations from On-Premise to Cloud Ensure customers partner with Technical Support for troubleshooting and to assist with the data migrations Liaise with multiple cross-functional teams, including Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Collaboration/AV Solutions Specialist Are you interested in developing and implementing collaboration strategy to enable more than 9000 Atlassian’s around the globe to do the best work of their lives, regardless of their location? Get on board as a Collaboration/AV Solutions Specialist based in the Bay Area! As part of the Workplace Technology Collaboration Team, you’ll be contributing to our global collaboration strategy, evaluating and implementing the latest available technologies to ensure Atlassian remains a leader as we continue to adopt new tools and practices to facilitate remote and hybrid work. You’ll creatively guide, implement and supervise AV technology deployments for our US and European offices and help solve technical problems, small and large. You will also be involved implementing new software, creating documentation, training staff, project managing tasks, and working closely with vendors to get the most out of our investments. You will be the in-region go-to person for our all of our collaboration and AV solutions, and be strongly invested in ensuring local staff have great experiences with all we offer. A typical work week might include: evaluating a new online collaboration solution, helping a business unit design a remote off-site experience, evaluating new video conferencing solutions, working with an AV integrator to specify the equipment needed for a new office fit out or refurb, meeting with a vendor for a roadmap or business review, reporting on project progress, assisting with executive setups, supporting on-site technology experiments or doing a deep dive into a new online collaboration app or smart building technology. You'll bring your local industry knowledge to find improvement opportunities, participate in developing global AV standards, bills of materials, and help build robust and innovative collaboration capabilities that scale and operate efficiently. You will be involved in comparing, recommending, selecting and overseeing AV Vendors in the US and European regions. One thing we promise: you’ll never be bored. More About You The right person for this job remains cool under pressure, managing constantly changing demands and priorities in a rapidly growing and changing organization. You're experienced with AV solutions but curious and enthusiastic about new technologies, self-motivated, manage your time well in all contexts, and know when to ask for direction. You actively seek to develop yourself and define your role. You are engaged in your working relationships, provide and receive feedback graciously, are experienced working with a globally distributed team, and training/mentoring of local support staff. You search for opportunities to innovate and keep Atlassian on the bleeding edge. Responsibilities And What You'll Be Working On Multiple concurrent projects across Atlassian’s global offices including new spaces, office reconfigurations/AV hardware refreshes (e.g Neat, Crestron/QSC/Logitech/Shure). Implementing and managing collaboration solutions (e.g. Zoom, Loom, Miro, AppSpace, Seenspire, Krisp etc) AV system upgrades, implementation and support escalations Designing and delivering or facilitating end user training Live streaming tools for internal events (e.g. town halls, team socials) Interest in studio setups, everything from small 1p recording booths, to larger podcast/video broadcast studios Working closely with other technology teams to integrate platforms with network, SSO and other services Things we expect you to arrive with on Day 1: 6+ years working in IT in a large organization, ideally with most of that focussed on Workplace Technologies Solid understanding of video conferencing technologies including Zoom, Zoom Rooms, training rooms, town hall spaces, and other audio/visual solutions A keen interest in workplace collaboration tools and services Experience with IT/AV fit out of new or refreshed office spaces Project coordination experience Continuous improvement focus and high level support escalation Education and training for admin, support staff and end-users Vendor selection and relationship management (software and hardware) Strong awareness of security practices and precautions Documentation skills Evaluating vendors' technical documentation and aligning with business goals A self-starter able to work independently but comfortable working in a remote team environment An enthusiastic, technically proficient operator with a thirst for knowledge and innovation. A track record of delivering world-class customer experiences Ability to work with a global, remote and hybrid workforce Whilst you will have a great deal of flexibility to work from anywhere, there will be regular occasions where a physical presence is needed in various office locations, primarily San Francisco and Mountain View (on a weekly basis) with occasional visits to US east coast, Texas, and potentially Amsterdam and Sydney Things that would be great but we already have or you can grow into: Experience evaluating, designing and deploying collaboration solutions (e.g. virtual white boarding and other asynchronous work-enabling technologies) Familiarity with Atlassian tools like Jira and Confluence Experience with smart building technologies Experience with digital signage technologies Experience with major/large-scale projects, and multiple concurrent projects would be well regarded. Familiarity with video and audio recording studios Knowledge of ITSM framework and its application in a Workplace Technology environment. Familiarity with network infrastructure services as they relate to collaboration solutions and end user requirements CTS or CTS-D certification More About Our Team As a member of the Workplace Collaboration Team, you will be part of a globally distributed team focused on delivering, maintaining and supporting an exceptional workplace experience. Your immediate colleagues are based on Sydney but you will be working daily with multiple technical teams and project disciplines, including; evaluating and experimenting with innovations in the collaboration landscape, ensuring optimization of deployed technology including new features and services. You will work with the team to design, deliver and support innovative best of breed solutions. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. We’re looking for a talented commercial transactions attorney to join our Commercial Legal team! As a member of this team, you will draft and negotiate a variety of agreements with Atlassian’s enterprise customers. This is a great opportunity to join a growing legal team and support strategic transactions for Atlassian. This position is preferably based in the Austin area, however, in line with our TEAM Anywhere policy, we are open to hiring the right candidate anywhere in the United States. In This Role, You’ll Get To Become a member of our growing team of individuals in our Legal team supporting Atlassian’s commercial team. Provide pragmatic, business-minded guidance on contract-related issues. We’re not looking for academic analysis! Partner with our Sales team, as well as our Privacy, Trust, Finance, and Product teams, to drive customer deals to execution and design scalable processes for implementation. Negotiate enterprise cloud and license agreements for Atlassian’s products and services. Develop support materials and provide trainings to educate our sales teams on contract terms and other legal issues. Assist with special projects as needed, including projects focused on improving legal processes. More About You You take ownership, roll up your sleeves, and get things done. You build relationships with business stakeholders to strengthen the connection between our team and the business. You bring empathy and understanding to your conversations with customers, seeking to find a path forward that balances company risk and customer needs. You enjoy getting deals done, while managing customer risk. You effectively navigate a decentralized and complex organization spread across the globe. You have a strong understanding of software technology and cloud services, associated business models, and technology industry trends. You think creatively beyond the “legal” box to generate possible solutions and options for the business, clearly articulating risk-based recommendations. You effectively communicate with the business and customers to help them understand and follow the rules and parameters imposed by laws. On your first day, we’ll expect you to have: Qualification to practice law in your local jurisdiction. 5+ years of experience handing contract negotiations. Experience negotiating outbound SaaS contracts is a must. Ability to handle data protection topics and revenue recognition issues in connection with commercial contracts. Passion for understanding our customers, products, culture, and business model. Excellent judgment and strong communication skills. Ability to handle competing priorities in a dynamic environment. Willingness to handle new areas of responsibility. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Atlassian is looking for a Communications Manager with an entrepreneur's mindset to be the voice of the Customer Success & Innovation organization (CSI). You will build strategic communications that raise awareness about what we're doing and the impact that we're having, increase acceptance of and excitement for our work, and can make complex topics understandable. To be successful, you will liaise across multiple departments and with CSI's senior management to build and implement communication plans that manage the flow of news and information. Through a series of written and visual narratives, video and live events, you will determine how best to creatively bring stories to life on the most effective channels. As a Communications Manager, you will report directly to the Chief of Staff of Customer Success & Innovation (CSI). What You'll Do Develop a communications program end-to-end globally that has clear goals and metrics Write and edit internal communications and Leadership messages across mediums and formats (blogs, presentations, talking points, Slack messages, emails, newsletters, infographics, podcasts, and videos) Ensure company news and key programs are cascaded through appropriate teams in the CSI organization Partner closely with teams to stay in the know and to implement integrated communication strategies Support communications content and planning during complex, and ambiguous situations Use project management skills to develop and implement processes, efficiencies, and guidelines Your Background You have a minimum of 8 years of communications experience with enterprise technology You have excellent writing, communication, and presentation skills You excel as an executor, bringing your skills including communications planning, writing, storytelling, research and audience insight to help build comprehensive communication strategies that work You have experience influencing others and getting people on board with an idea or direction You're comfortable working through ambiguity, and proactively breaking through potential obstacles and challenges You're experienced in various internal communications channels including digital tools (intranets, web initiatives, social media, etc.) You have creative chops, good-enough-to-be-dangerous skills for digital content content creation and basic graphic design You understand and digest the needs of the business and senior stakeholders while having the gravitas to advise and provide counsel on the best way to communicate information BA or BS required, preferably with a background in Communications, Journalism, English or related degree Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. What You'll Do Lead community strategy focused on member and partner engagement within the community Build multi-channel community programs designed to foster knowledge exchange, connection, and brand love Proactively identify and recommend new and innovative ways to engage with and grow our community Work with the product marketing, customer success, and channel teams to create powerful programs that meet our target audience where they are Program manage a multi-faceted approach across go-to-market (brand, product marketing, customer success, channel ecosystem, and more) Create engaging experiences where members and partners want to engage, participate, and grow their presence in the community Communicate with cross-functional teams, senior-level business executives, customers, and partners, generating awareness and buy-in Project manage the tactical elements of the go-to-market strategy to ensure timely and optimized delivery Partner with and influence teams across the go-to-market organization to implement a cohesive community engagement strategy that supports their goals Your Background 7+ years in community or customer engagement roles Strong cross-functional, project management experience including planning, scheduling, monitoring and stakeholder reporting Demonstrated experience in leading key projects, including strategic customer programs from inception to successful roll-out and beyond Strong documentation, communication, and presentation skills Experience with analytics and understanding of metrics and KPIs (as defined) Ability to gather and analyze data to understand the pros and cons of different decisions and options Facilitation skills in leading and planning meetings, reviews, and retrospectives. Strong program and project management skills Experience with various social media platforms and propagating messages via online communities Experience working/building relationships with cross-functional teams with ease, delivering impact consistently, and influencing teams towards achieving goals Natural empathy for and understanding of customers' needs Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Your future team Atlassian is looking for Content Design Interns to join our growing Design teams in Australia, India and the US. Join Atlassian as an intern and spend your time having an impact on how millions of users collaborate and use software. The most amazing thinkers—like NASA rocket scientists and Tesla engineers—are coming to us for solutions. We're in the business of developing software to help teams everywhere get amazing ideas on the ground and into the world. As a Content Designer, you'll be empowered to experiment with a variety of approaches to information in the UI, documentation, supporting materials, and anywhere else our customers engage with content. You'll work with content designers, product designers, developers, product managers, marketers, and support engineers to ensure that the stories we tell are consistent and create a great experience for our customers. As a Content Design Intern, you'll gain the experience needed in the Agile software development process, Atlassian tools, user research, content strategy, and team collaboration to kickstart your career. You'll join a team that is smart and very direct. We challenge each other to improve our work, learn, and ask hard questions. We're dedicated to Agile methodology and are big believers in 'lean' (which means we don't do documentation for documentation's sake). We know the importance of validating assumptions about users and use several types of testing to figure out whether we're right (or wrong). Our bottom line is improving our user's experience—no matter what. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN, or H-1B student graduates at this time. What you'll do Gain valuable exposure to the design and product development process. Be mentored by our experienced designers in shaping your internship outcomes. Experience Atlassian's culture through our many companywide and cross-regional programs. Your background Be able to commit to a full-time (40hrs / week) internship from May 2023 until August 2023 or June 2023 until September 2023 Be currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelors or Masters program Spring/Summer 2024 Experience with user-focused design Demonstrate the ability to plan while juggling multiple simultaneous projects Experience collaborating with team members, like engineers, product managers and other designers Joy for writing and editing high-quality content (such as articles, blogs, or websites) Demonstrate vigorous writing standards (including grammar, style, and voice and tone) Experience with creatively explaining complex topics to a variety of audiences Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Your future team Atlassian is looking for Content Design Interns to join our growing Design teams in Australia, India and the US. Join Atlassian as an intern and spend your time having an impact on how millions of users collaborate and use software. The most amazing thinkers—like NASA rocket scientists and Tesla engineers—are coming to us for solutions. We're in the business of developing software to help teams everywhere get amazing ideas on the ground and into the world. As a Content Designer, you'll be empowered to experiment with a variety of approaches to information in the UI, documentation, supporting materials, and anywhere else our customers engage with content. You'll work with content designers, product designers, developers, product managers, marketers, and support engineers to ensure that the stories we tell are consistent and create a great experience for our customers. As a Content Design Intern, you'll gain the experience needed in the Agile software development process, Atlassian tools, user research, content strategy, and team collaboration to kickstart your career. You'll join a team that is smart and very direct. We challenge each other to improve our work, learn, and ask hard questions. We're dedicated to Agile methodology and are big believers in 'lean' (which means we don't do documentation for documentation's sake). We know the importance of validating assumptions about users and use several types of testing to figure out whether we're right (or wrong). Our bottom line is improving our user's experience—no matter what. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN, or H-1B student graduates at this time. What you'll do Gain valuable exposure to the design and product development process. Be mentored by our experienced designers in shaping your internship outcomes. Experience Atlassian's culture through our many companywide and cross-regional programs. Your background Be able to commit to a full-time (40hrs / week) internship from May 2023 until August 2023 or June 2023 until September 2023 Be currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelors or Masters program Spring/Summer 2024 Experience with user-focused design Demonstrate the ability to plan while juggling multiple simultaneous projects Experience collaborating with team members, like engineers, product managers and other designers Joy for writing and editing high-quality content (such as articles, blogs, or websites) Demonstrate vigorous writing standards (including grammar, style, and voice and tone) Experience with creatively explaining complex topics to a variety of audiences Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Your future team Have you ever found yourself rewriting onboarding tours, in-app tips, or product tutorials in your head? Do you consider information to be a powerful and essential element of a user's experience?If so, an internship with Atlassian's Design team might be for you! Atlassian is looking for Content Design Interns to join our growing Design teams in Australia, India and the US. Join Atlassian as an intern and spend your internship having an impact on how millions of users collaborate and use software. The most amazing thinkers—like NASA rocket scientists and Tesla engineers—are coming to us for solutions. We're in the business of developing software to help teams everywhere get amazing ideas on the ground and into the world. Sound like an exciting place to start your career? As a Content Designer, you'll be empowered to experiment with a variety of approaches to information in the UI, documentation, supporting materials, and anywhere else our customers engage with content. You'll work with content designers, product designers, developers, product managers, marketers, and support engineers to ensure that the stories we tell are consistent and create a great experience for our customers. As a Content Design Intern, you'll gain the experience needed in the Agile software development process, Atlassian tools, user research, content strategy, and team collaboration to kickstart your career. Please note: At this time, this role is only open to entry level candidates with less than a year of professional experience (this does not include internships/co-ops) Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN, or H-1B student graduates at this time. What you'll do Work on a variety of design challenges where you will be involved in the end-to-end design process, including early-stage research and brainstorming, implementation and iteration. You'll take on complex concepts and communicate value in a compelling way. Take ownership of creating beautiful content and smooth user experiences for our products used by millions of users worldwide. Gain valuable exposure to the design and product development process as you concept and design powerful experiences. Be a trusted design partner amongst peers of product managers and engineers who will look to you to guide them in creating harmonious user experiences and content. Your background Be currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelors program, graduating by Spring/Summer 2024 Passion for user-focused design Demonstrate the ability to plan while juggling multiple simultaneous projects Passion for collaborating with cross-functional team members, like engineers, product managers and designers Joy for writing and editing high-quality content (such as articles, blogs, or websites) Ability to follow writing standards (including grammar, style, and voice and tone) A knack for creatively explaining complex topics to a variety of audiences Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. This is an incredible opportunity for you to serve as a trusted advisor to Atlassian’s executives, board, and Legal team and to have a front-row seat to Atlassian’s continued growth. Are you an attorney who is excited to work on cutting-edge corporate, securities, and governance issues for a rapidly growing international company? If so, read on! More About The Role Atlassian is looking to grow its Corporate Legal team. This key hire will touch all things corporate, securities and governance. Grow your skills and experience alongside Atlassian’s rocketship. You’ll play an integral role in Atlassian’s SEC reporting, equity and debt capital markets transactions, venture investments, corporate governance, and other key strategic transactions. This is a rare and tremendous opportunity to own and grow your career in a dynamic and values-oriented environment. Matters You’ll Take On Take ownership and accountability for key projects and decisions and see them through — doing the legwork to make sure that the appropriate stakeholders are engaged and providing rigorous follow-through and iteration Assist on cross-functional company projects related to governance, subsidiary maintenance, compliance, equity plan operations, and treasury support Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Finance, Tax, Stock Administration, Accounting, Total Rewards, Communications, Corporate Development, Product, and Engineering to manage corporate transactions and initiatives Support compliance and certification activities relating to various corporate policies, including Code of Conduct, Insider Trading, Whistleblower, and Anti-Corruption Assist with SEC reporting and securities compliance matters, including support in connection with the preparation of periodic reports, proxy statements, Section 16 reports, and registration statements Assist with M&A, venture investments, equity and debt financings, and other strategic transactions Support corporate governance matters, including meetings of our Board, its committees, and our shareholders Stay current on corporate governance trends and best practices and SEC and Nasdaq developments, including research or benchmarking projects On the first day, you’ll be expected to have: JD and admission to one state bar 3-6 years relevant experience practicing corporate and securities law at a major law firm (and ideally, in-house) Highly collaborative, intellectually curious, and a great sense of humor Comfortable navigating complicated and nuanced issues Detail-oriented with excellent legal judgment, strong organizational skills, and proven ability to deliver creative, thoughtful, and business-oriented results Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, including the ability to connect with, and gain the respect of, stakeholders at all levels, including our executive team Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. The Corporate Security team at Atlassian seeks to enable foundational teams such as IT, Business Systems, Finance, Legal, People, and Customer Support, to have the ability to execute their initiatives without compromising security. In order to do this, CorpSec engineers are security all-rounders who are able to consider risk, make tradeoffs and implement effective security controls across Atlassian while working closely with these teams. We're a distributed team across the US and Australia who work closely together to help protect Atlassian data, whether that's implementing strong authentication, rolling out NGAV + EDR, building zero trust networks or helping secure our people automation systems. As part of the focus on learning at Atlassian, you'll be able to spend up to 20% of your time on independent research during our monthly innovation weeks. In This Role, You'll Get To Work directly with foundational teams to improve Atlassian's SaaS / IaaS / PaaS systems; Work on large-scale infrastructure projects involving workstations, networks and cloud technologies; Perform threat modeling exercises with business partners to identify risks in corporate systems; Develop security policies, communicate change, and drive security from remediation to completion from end to end; Perform vendor risk assessment for third-party solutions that address security threats; Lead big organizational and technical change; and Do exciting, diverse technical work, your way. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Experience working in cyber security (or a strong background in IT with a deep interest in security); An ability to reason about security decisions; Experience in infrastructure security with a focus on operating systems, networks, vendor and/or application security; Proficiency in at least one programming language (e.g. Python, Golang, Java, etc.); and Strong collaboration and interpersonal skills. It's Great, But Not Required, If You Have Experience working with corporate IT departments such as network engineering, robotic process automation, people operations or other related functions; Previously worked with a large variety of SaaS tools (Salesforce, Workday, Jira, etc); Experience in a large-scale cloud business; or The ability to thrive in a remote working environment. More About You We're looking for individuals who can adapt quickly, be flexible and enjoy working in a variety of areas. To be successful, you must thrive on autonomy and open work, while being passionate at what you do. More About Our Team Atlassian Security is a team based across the globe with 150+ engineers all around the world including Australia, USA and the Netherlands. We are responsible for building and managing security services to ensure that Atlassian's products are among the most trustworthy in the industry. This includes managing the security development lifecycle, coordinating detection, assessment and response to security incidents, and providing architectural and process guidance for all of the teams across Atlassian. We are a highly motivated, collaborative, creative team that isn't afraid of moving quickly and that is widely respected within Atlassian and across the broader security industry. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more.
