Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Do you love solving problems with numbers? Do you want to play a meaningful role in the benefits we provide to our employees? Are you looking to make a big impact, partner with world-class talent and take your career to the next level? Our Financial Planning & Analysis team (FP&A) is looking for a FP&A Manager who is the finance business partner for our global Total Rewards team. In this role you will work with the Total Rewards team to develop a benefits strategy, model potential benefits we provide and recommend an approach that meets employee needs and our financial goals. In This Role, You'll Get To Influence Total Rewards leadership team on our long-term strategy Partner closely with the Total Rewards leadership team to model potential benefits scenarios and provide recommendations on which employee benefits to provide Implement an annual benefits program review as part of our long-range financial plan Build relationships with internal partners such as FP&A leaders, Payroll team and accounting team to facilitate collaboration across teams on benefit related matters Model annual and multi-year compensation and benefits forecasts Implement and manages fringe recharge back to departments On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Qualitative: Strong influencing and communication skills Strategic thinker with strong analytical skills Curious, self-starter, eager to improve the status quo Quantitative: 7+ years finance experience 2+ years experience working on benefits forecasting Experience working in a fast growing company Strong analytical skills Proficiency using Excel Experience with Anaplan is a plus Experience in investment banking is a plus Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Finance, Accounting, Economics) More About Our Team Atlassian has a business model, with a focus on growth and profitability, that is rare among its growth technology peers. We also have an analytics DNA that runs deep through the company's core. FP&A is a highly visible team in the organization at the intersection of both these focus areas. The FP&A team is a talented and collaborative team with a unique mix of technology industry, consulting and financial services background. Our responsibilities include facilitating planning, providing insight into business performance, supporting strategic decision making and helping predict the future of the business. We encourage decision-making at every level and highly value an open-minded approach and organizational transparency. We work closely with business leaders across all areas of the business to support the Company’s continued growth. You'll join an extraordinary team that is passionate about Atlassian, its products, and its customers Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Atlassian is looking for a motivated, thoughtful web developer to join the Community team, part of the Marketing Technology group, on our mission to build a dynamic social platform for our massive customer base. Newly launched in April 2017, the Atlassian Community serves as the central hub for support, discussion, and idea exchange for millions of Atlassian end users, solution partners, Marketplace vendors, user group leaders, and others — and we're just getting started. As a member of our growing team, you will Work closely with our product manager, community manager, designers, and developers to scope, build, and ship new features on community.atlassian.com Become a technical authority in our base platform (Lithium) and extend its functionality with new front-end code and service integrations written on AWS infrastructure Expand the capacity and efficiency of our community manager and community support engineers by building and deploying custom internal tools Run experiments, improve behavioral and operational data instrumentation, and help enable decisions based on trusted metrics Familiarize yourself with the diverse range of Community use cases and develop a deep understanding of our user base You might be a good fit if You have 2+ years of experience as a web developer or front-end engineer You write elegant, responsive, cross-browser compliant HTML & Sass You've contributed to and managed shared codebases using Git You're familiar with React, jQuery, vanilla JS, Node.js , and tools like Grunt or Gulp You know your way around enterprise CMSs, online community platforms, or comparable systems You consider yourself a strong, open communicator with unflinching attention to detail You love participating in online communities yourself Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Full Stack Software Engineer, Product Messaging
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is looking for an experienced software engineer to join our Messaging & Targeting team. In our team, you’ll be tasked with building extensible data platforms that provide business stakeholders with audience building, targeting and personalization capabilities. We are looking for developers who love frameworks, tools and technologies to solve thorny business problems by partnering with engineering teams and building platform features. Qualifications MS/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related subject. 4+ years of experience in designing and building a production-level data or web application. Experience in building frontend and backend web applications from the ground up using modern technologies – from gathering requirements, design, build, deploy, and ownership. Good experience with Java, Spring, Hibernate, Rest APIs, AWS, Docker, SQL, Microservices Front-end development experience with expert knowledge of technologies like HTML, CSS, Javascript, AJAX, ReactJS, Angular, etc. Strong quality mindset and proven experience with testing practices and philosophy. Excellent troubleshooting, debugging, problem-solving, and analytical skills. Strong leadership skills to plan and work towards the team’s long term goals and roadmaps Preferred Experience with a scripting language such as Python/Shell in a Linux environment. Knowledge of continuous integration and deployment tools (e.g. Git, Maven, Gradle, Bamboo, Jenkins) Ability to explain and present details to both technical and business audiences. Proven ability to drive cross-team technical discussions and decision making. Experience working with data management and MarTech platforms A strong DevOps background More About Our Team The team you’re going to join is spread across Bay Area & Bengaluru. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. We are looking for a passionate Data Governance leader who is full of ideas to make valuable contributions to a high growth, innovative software company! As the newly established Global Head of Data Governance reporting to our Chief Trust Officer, you will build and lead a Data Governance team to work with business and technology managers, and subject matter experts, coordinating and driving efforts related to data management and governance. The Global Head of Data Governance will be tasked with developing, communicating, and executing the data governance strategy to continually align the use of data with Atlassian's business objectives. They will oversee the execution of Atlassian's Data Governance programs, consult on data governance related issues for new initiatives, products, and services, and partner with the business to provide effective data related education and policy updates. Having the ability to collaborate with and influence various global teams with some level of ambiguity and uncertainty is a must. What You'll Do Deliver on Atlassian's aspiration of creating an industry leading data governance function, able to deftly balance business opportunity with strong, flexible controls and policies. Establish and lead the strategy, direction, objectives, and operations for the global Data Governance organization. Lead the innovation and governance of the organization's data governance operational and strategic risks within the current environment Examine trends, develop insights, and collaborate on solutions to sustain and strengthen the control environment Review current capacity, capability, and target operating model Implement industry leading controls and associated procedures for across the global enterprise and our SaaS environment / cloud products Drive effective teamwork, communication, collaboration, and commitment across multiple groups with multiple priorities Drive data governance culture, specifically influence self-identification and disclosure of control self-assurance gaps Maintain strong engagement across multiple stakeholders, collaborate with key senior business partners and stay abreast on risk, control agendas Your Background 10+ years of experience within Data Governance, Technology Risk Management, Compliance, Information Security or Internal Auditing First-hand understanding of the Data Governance needs of a complex, large-scale B2B SaaS business, including integrating continuous control monitoring Experience managing a global team of 10+ technical professionals Experience with control and risk frameworks, performing compliance and risk assessments, designing controls and overseeing mitigation projects Good verbal and written communication skills, especially communicating across all levels and cross functional teams Experience presenting balanced risk perspectives and interacting with senior executives Your future team Data Governance is currently a federated capability that spans the Atlassian business and technology teams globally. We are looking to build a central team that will develop global governance capability across all of Atlassian's infrastructure and product development teams, developing a comprehensive, unified approach to data governance. This team will work with virtually every team within the organization - Trust (we are part of it), Security, Privacy, Legal, Marketing, Finance, Customer Support, all product groups, People, the executive team, etc. We also collaborate with business partners, vendors, consultants and customers. jobTitle: Global Head of Migration Support Services
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. In Atlassian's Customer Support Services (CSS) department, it is our mission to provide world class, creative, and scalable support to meet the needs and exceed the expectations of our customers. Do you want to be part of a team who is leading the charge towards our #1 company objective to shift our customers to the cloud - to have a chance to bring migration strategy affecting millions of users around the world? Atlassian is looking for a Head of CSS Migrations. You'll be part of the support services leadership team that ensures our customers not only see but believe that moving to Cloud gives you the best of Atlassian: increased speed, enhanced security, easier management, and more reliability. As the migrations leader, you'll shape how all things migration contribute to increased success, impact, and delight for our customers making the Server to Cloud journey with us. You will report into our Head of CSS Enterprise. In This Role, You'll Get To Be the 'go to' partner for the CSS and GTM Leaders while leading and growing a global team who support our customers migration from Server to Cloud Define and lead the migration experience for our customers by advancing tooling, standards, and operations Cultivate close partnerships with a broad range of product and engineering leaders Anticipate the evolution of Cloud Migrations and requirements that customers may have as they are on this journey Present strategy, important insights, achievements, and quarterly progress updates to CSS executive leadership, your Cloud Enterprise peers, and your broader CSS team. Play a crucial role in Atlassian's cloud migration strategy improving the experience, scaling the team, creating/improving tools and processes Advise other partners (Product, Engineering, Support & Success leaders) who have a hand in driving the migration experience and strategy for Atlassian customers You will create an environment built on trust where you are seen as the migrations expert and advisor to customers and Atlassian team members alike On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have At least 15 years of experience leading a global technical team (support, services, and/or success) at an Enterprise SaaS based tech company You excel in helping to unblock team members while helping them grow in their careers Hiring experience, resource planning expertise, and proven success in implementation of professional development programs growing exceptional leaders and individual contributors Experience with private and public cloud architectures, versed in pros/cons of running applications in the cloud and migration considerations Demonstrated experience building a customer-centric culture that advocates for the customer's needs Design and implement strategy for a multi-function and multi-geo team Exceptional behavioral assessment capability and the ability to teach this to others A strong learning orientation and examples of high rates of professional growth More About Our Team The team is filled with technical experts and customer champions who are excited to be at the forefront of Atlassian's strategy to migrate customers to the cloud. We love working with our customers, learning the ways in which they are using our products, and digging into the unique challenges that they face daily. We encourage boldness- being a disruptor, not being deterred by tough problems, and ensuring everyone has a voice. A successful day on the team is defined by leaning into complex problems, developing creative solutions to overcome them, and learning along the way. We think and act according to our Atlassian values and hold our teammates accountable for doing so as well. We are not afraid to ask for help and we are delighted when given the opportunity to lend a helping hand ourselves. We are open, filled with varied backgrounds and talents, respectful, focused, located around the globe, and is all about providing legendary service to our customers. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Global Lead, Cloud Channel Business Development
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. At Atlassian, we are on a mission to help our customers compete and win in the modern, digital economy. We have built a multi-billion-dollar, fast-growing software business with over 200,000 paying customers, and millions of users around the globe. Many of these organizations acquire Atlassian tools through our global network of partners, who provide a diverse range of enterprise solutions. We are looking for an experienced senior strategic channel leader for an important role within our channel business development team. You will create & oversee execution of the Channel Cloud Migration plans. By taking a macro view you will establish a plan to achieve acceleration of Cloud adoption & help drive Cloud Migrations through the Atlassian partner community. You will play an important part in ensuring the success of partners both existing and new, in one of the most important priorities for Atlassian. What You'll Do Lead the strategy for growing Atlassian's Cloud Migration plans through the partner eco-system. Pilot and test new ideas for speeding up Cloud adoption by customers through the Partner eco-system Be the face of our Cloud Migration opportunity, consulting our important partners’ senior leadership on achieving success Working with our partner recruitment team, identifying target partners to help grow our Cloud Migration eco-system Partner with our marketing team to drive co-marketing efforts, training, and ensuring partners are working with our sales teams Collaborate with a global channel team of Partner Managers to ensure successful outcomes for Cloud Migration Assess channel coverage, partner capacity and recruitment requirements - across a range of different partnership models Own budget responsibility for Cloud Migration programs Partner with Enterprise Sales on optimizing the co-selling motion and building a pipeline Collaborate across Atlassian to build and deliver a coordinated enablement model & align with the channel organization to achieve results You will focus and lead channel projects, but also keep an eye on the business as a whole You bring a record of meeting performance metrics - both sales and non-revenue targets Your Background You have 10+ years of experience in SaaS companies and complimentary experience working with Partners. Understand the dynamics of moving large number of customers to adopt new products and technologies Strong Go-To-Market experience in matrix organizations working with a diverse set of stakeholders. Experience with what it takes for a partner to help deliver services Experience working with channel program teams, channel marketing and sales teams It would be great if you also bring consulting experience from a premier firm. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. We are seeking a dynamic FP&A manager to help shape and drive forward the vision of one of the fastest growing companies in the market. You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, look to solve challenging problems and are motivated to implement innovative ways to do things better. You'll thrive if you are highly organized, driven, a self-starter, analytical and have a strong attention to detail. This role will report to the Head of FP&A GTM and will primarily support the Sales function. In the GTM Finance team, you will play a key role in the budgeting/forecasting process, sales capacity planning, business performance reporting, monthly close process, operational improvements, and ad-hoc support on strategic projects. In This Role, You'll Get To Own all of FP&A’s support for the global sales team including budgeting and financial forecasting process Establish a new sales capacity planning framework with the Sales Operations team and forecasting commissions Prepare monthly and quarterly management reporting – analyzing financial results, distilling/synthesizing key trends, and communicating business insights to global sales leadership team Lead the month-end close efforts for Sales including reviewing accruals and presenting monthly variance analyses Assess and reflect current quarter performance through the monthly outlook process and work closely with Corporate FP&A to provide commentary for senior leadership Proactively highlight opportunities for process improvements and provide ad-hoc guidance to business partners with questions on accounting treatment and budgeting/forecasting process Partnering with Sales Analytics team on establishing a framework for measuring and tracking ROI of key investments On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Qualitative: Curiosity to learn and take initiative to solve problems independently Ability to prioritize objectives in a fast-paced environment to ensure key deliverables are met in a timely manner Demonstrate attention to detail and follow-through Team player who can also self-initiate Possess a strong work ethic with a “get-it-done” attitude Strong critical thinking, organizational, and collaboration skills Strong communication and personal skills, with the ability to be personable but also persistent Efficient with managing tasks that require collaboration with stakeholders in different time zones Comfort with challenging leaders to drive return on investment and operational improvements Quantitative: Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Finance, Accounting, Economics) Minimum 4 years of Finance or Accounting work experience including planning and budgeting processes, financial forecasting, interpreting and reporting business performance results Advanced proficiency in financial modelling Strong technical fundamentals such as spreadsheets (e.g., Google Sheets, MS Excel) and exposure to planning tools (Anaplan) and data/finance systems (Netsuite) Technology or Software / SaaS industry experience Knowledge of BI tools and technologies (e.g. Tableau) Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Finance, Accounting, Economics), MBA and/or CPA is a plus Nice-to-haves Exposure to procurement platform (Coupa), workforce planning (e.g., Workday), and BI tools/dashboards (e.g., Tableau) Experience in Technology or Software / SaaS industry Experience working with Sales and/or Marketing functions Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. The Confluence Cloud team at Atlassian is changing the way companies collaborate and share information. Confluence has 75k+ customers and more than half of Fortune 100 companies use Confluence to connect people with the content they need. Join us as we unleash the power of teams all over the globe. The Confluence Creation team manages the very core part of the Confluence user experience so that all users can create compelling content using building blocks such as text, images, and data. This team brings capabilities to experienced creators and works to ensure it is easy for new creators to get started quickly. We are hiring a Group Product Manager to lead the Confluence creation team and coach and grow a team of PMs. You will be responsible for setting and delivering on strategic priorities and results that are aligned with our user needs and help Confluence grow. Creation is at the heart of the value Confluence brings to individual users and organizations so you'll have very high visibility and strategic importance to the future of Confluence. Atlassian is on the cutting edge of modern product craft, and is still led by the two original founders who relentlessly pursue the vision to unleash the potential in every team. You'll be joining a product-led company where product managers set strategy and lead teams towards big goals. In This Role You Will Lead the vision, strategy and execution for the Confluence Creation group Mentor and inspire a growing team of experienced and junior Product Managers Identify new strategic opportunities for improving the creator experience Work directly with design, engineering, research and marketing counterparts to ship high quality, valuable, and loved products Be a subject matter expert within Atlassian on Confluence creation Build relationships between the Confluence creator group and partner teams across Atlassian Deeply understand our customers so you can advocate for them and their content creation needs Make a large impact across our product family and influence millions of users and thousands of customers for decades to come Report to the lead of the Confluence Content Engagement group On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 6+ years of experience in a product management role (ideally at a product-led SaaS company) Experience growing teams with complex and dependent projects in a multi-year mission Experience mentoring and/or managing other product managers Clarity of vision for your product that provides the team with direction and inspiration Experience running experiments and context switching from talking about the big picture all the way down to implementation details A history of working with engineering and design teams to produce an outstanding customer experience Technical know-how to partner with engineering to work on the roadmap you define Experience nailing hard problems and imparting that knowledge to your PM teams with frameworks and stories A track record of encouraging your teams to build great products with a constant desire to understand, question, and improve the experiences for users Comfort presenting a compelling narrative to large audiences and groups of executives Excitement about working on one of the largest and fastest growing products within Atlassian Strong opinions, but enjoy being challenged to think about a problem from a different angle Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Head of Content Marketing, Work Management
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Work Management is one of three market focal points for Atlassian, alongside DevOps and IT Service Management. We are looking for a visionary content marketing leader to impact our category presence, customer acquisition, and integrated efforts spanning multiple go-to-market teams. You will own content strategy and execution across the work management market, and shape the portfolio of investments to drive Atlassian’s next chapter of growth. The product suite for Work Management includes Trello, Confluence, Atlas, and Jira Work Management. As the Head of Content Marketing for Work Management, you will be responsible for developing and implementing the overall content strategy based on our market goals and objectives. This includes establishing a predictable, efficient, and scalable model for organic and paid customer acquisition as Atlassian goes wall-to-wall with its solution across business teams. Additionally, the future of work presents a tremendous opportunity in developing a market-leading perspective to help guide the evolution of global teams. You’ll be a leading force in developing thought leadership to make this happen. You will join Atlassian’s Work Management marketing leadership team, and collaborate closely with teams across product, marketing, and sales. As a part of the leadership team, you’ll bring big, bold, and different ideas to the table. You’ll be passionate about building the scope and impact of content marketing. And you’re just as interested in growing and investing in the careers of others as you are your own. Success Includes Growing organic and paid customer acquisition by impacting awareness, conversion, and retention Evolving Atlassian’s work management category leadership to drive the next stage of growth Building meaningful engagement strategies to connect with business teams throughout their buyer journeys Establishing a content marketing foundation that can 10x in scale within an accelerated timeframe Creating strong strategic partnerships with an amazing group of cross-functional partners Head Of Content Marketing Responsibilities This role will own the content strategy, initiatives, and outcomes with a north star of growing the work management business. Develop and execute a comprehensive content marketing strategy that drives key metrics across the user lifecycle from awareness, to acquisition, activation and retention. Create and manage a team editorial calendar for content planning and production, and perform regular audits for content gap analysis Align content market efforts with powerful integrated marketing campaigns to drive customer growth and wall-to-wall adoption of Atlassian’s products Oversee a wide-spanning range of content including articles, guides, customer stories, newsletters, and community posts to target segments of knowledge workers and business teams Recruit, enable, and activate leaders within the organization and across the broader Atlassian community to share and produce content, representing the Work Management market Leverage our marketing analytics and SEO teams to make data-driven decisions about current and future approaches that will best serve to address our audience's pain points Deliver detailed content marketing analysis that includes meaningful and actionable insights around how content is driving customer adoption and success Head Of Content Marketing Requirements 10+ years of experience in full stack content marketing 5+ years of experience in a content marketing / integrated marketing leadership role Proven experience defining categories and building audiences through business-impacting content marketing Demonstrable impact in scaling content marketing functions and acquisition engines in prior experiences Ability to balance the art of storytelling with the science of data analysis Leadership-level expertise within SEO and digital engagement Channels Extensive experience with agency management and partnerships Experience building testing and optimization systems and processes to drive engagement Experience in SaaS and B2B a huge plus Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Job Description Atlassian is looking for an Engineering Leader to join Data Engineering and Applications team and build data products and applications that power critical business decisions across the organization and inform the product strategy. This leader will be responsible for leading more than one Data engineering team. We are looking for a forward-thinking, structured problem solver, technical specialist, and talented leader passionate about building systems at scale. You will lead a world-class data engineering practice, shape up technical strategy and data architecture, and develop data products to enable reporting, analytics, data science, machine learning, and AI workloads. As the data domain specialist, you will partner with a cross-functional team of IT, data platform, product engineering, analytics teams, and data scientists to support various initiatives. Requirements may be vague, but the iterations will be rapid, and you must take thoughtful and calculated risks. You are interested in reporting platforms and data visualization. Collaborate with legal, compliance, and internal audit to understand audit, compliance, and legal requirements and ensure data products and services are developed in compliance with policies. More About You You are passionate about technology and data and understand the power of data to influence the future of companies like Atlassian. You thrive on developing phenomenal data products using modern data architecture, engineering practices, and tools to process store, and expose governed and trusted datasets and metrics. You are well-versed in data-driven and data-informed product development and comfortable with the nuts and bolts of software engineering, data engineering, and basic data science. You have excellent business engagement skills and thrive on building strong partnerships and working relationships with business and analytics leaders at all levels. You have a strong sense of fiscal discipline, manage tight budgets, and drive cost efficiency. You are an experienced leader with extensive experience managing managers and a strong record of attracting and growing data talent through hiring, coaching, mentoring, and hands-on career development. You foster an inclusive environment where all points of view are welcomed and encouraged. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 15+ years of experience in building and managing the data warehouse, data pipelines, and data products 10+ years of experience leading data engineering teams, experience managing managers of managers, and a track record of scaling organizations with over 75 engineers across geographies Strong business acumen with an understanding of business drivers and of how to drive value using data across the organization Demonstrated experience in developing strong business relationships and trust with senior business leaders across different functions. Prior experience partnering with Analytics and with Data Science teams 10+ Years of experience in delivering data and analytics solutions for various domains like Go To Market, Customer support, Finance, People, Commerce, and Engineering Solid understanding and experience building Microservices and RESTful APIs Experience implementing DevOps best practices within the data platform, including solutions for CI/CD, data observability, monitoring, and lineage Experience with BI tools like Tableau, Amplitude, and Redash. You will have strong empathy and a bias for action. Proven experience hiring and mentoring high-caliber engineers with diverse technical strengths and backgrounds. High-energy self-starter with a passion for data and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. Exceptional communication skills and can translate technical concepts into easy-to-understand language for business partners. A graduate degree in Computer Science or a similar subject area It's Great But Not Required If You Have Experience working for SAAS companies Experience with Machine Learning Committed code to open source projects Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Are you a strategic design leader who can bring teams together to solve complex problems and get stuff done with an eye for quality? If so, we have a unique opportunity for you to work as a senior design leader on one of the most fundamental aspects of Atlassian's business. We are looking for a Head of Design in the San Francisco Bay Area to lead our newly formed Demand Experience Design team. This organization consists of multiple teams across North America, Australia, and India, and is currently experiencing a very steep growth curve across all functions. Atlassian's digital e-commerce platform consists of these areas: our unified e-commerce store for 1st and 2nd party products, our growth teams, a newly forming team to explore machine learning driven experiences, and our Community and learning experiences team. The team builds tools and experiences for our customers to learn about, try and buy our products and those built by our partners, and engage with Atlassian in our Community. As the Head of Experience Design, you will lead experience design managers, product designers, and content designers, to shape a world-class e-Commerce experience. You will partner on an ongoing basis with the Demand leadership squad to establish the team's vision and strategy and guide the orgs in delivering our company OKRs. You will also drive the teams to create a seamless end to end journey for our customers, asserting and measuring experience quality in concert with our CXO. As a senior design leader of a major Atlassian platform area, you will work across a vast network of product and service teams to understand their needs and ensure our solutions scale, innovate, and delight our customers. You will also work closely together with specialized services that are aimed at our relationship with our internal and external partners and strike the right balance to ensure their business success while enabling them to provide our product customers with the best ongoing customer experiences. As a member of our platform design leadership team, you will work with other design managers, lead designers, and other stakeholders to set the experience vision for the entire digital e-commerce platform. You will also be responsible for the craft quality of the shipped experiences in your area and grow the level of experience design craft in the team. Leading this space means you get to maintain, improve, and innovate for over 250,000 customers in 190 countries. Your work will directly impact tens of thousands of customers and millions of users! You also help thousands of businesses who have been building their success on the Atlassian platform to succeed. You'll Have The Opportunity To Work within an R&D leadership team to shape the ways customers learn about, decide, and purchase products on the Atlassian platform Drive the customer experience strategies to impact the Atlassian e-commerce experience now and our future vision Provide cross-craft teams with the coaching, direction, leadership, and support vital to envision and ship specific projects with a user focus effectively Lead and inspire a high-performing team of experience design managers and their reports across North America, Australia, and India. With a passion for developing others, you'll coach and inspire your team towards success and cohesion Bring your experience of customer-centric experience design thinking and practices to our teams Establish and maintain a high-quality bar for shipped experiences with your team To Be Successful Here, You Bring the previous experience of having led customer experience strategy with teams at scale Embrace the technical nature of shaping a technical platform and customer experience, not shying away from complex details where they matter Have experience leading customer experiences with enterprise-level scale and delivering value to multiple, interlinked audiences Have a track record of planning and then driving business unit direction autonomously as a hands-on designer, then subsequently as a manager, and manager of managers Show great facilitation skills and a track record of collaborating with other functions, like Engineering, Product Management, Analytics, and Sales and Marketing, and Customer Success teams Communicate clearly and have a high degree of influence with all kinds of internal partners, including senior leadership Are passionate about the craft of customer experience and bring a breadth of skills to Atlassian Have the passion and ability to step into the customer's shoes to ensure customer centricity We'd Love For You To Have a deep understanding of the powers and unique challenges of a platform approach Have experience of enabling audiences with tools and frameworks Have an understanding of the need to strike a balance to nurture a healthy e-commerce ecosystem Have experience improving and sustaining design rituals at the org level Have proven experience developing and maintaining healthy, productive teams Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Head of M&A Finance and Corporate Reporting
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is hiring a Head of M&A Finance and Corporate Reporting within the FP&A organization. In this role, you will lead both the M&A finance and Corporate reporting teams and serve as an advisor to our business leaders on M&A and company financial performance. This role will report to the Head of Corporate Finance. On the M&A finance side, you will partner with our Corporate Development team and business leaders on strategies to continue to delight Atlassian customers with awesome products and technology. You will drive a consistent financial approach to evaluating potential M&A targets, including a quantitative and qualitative approaches to account for various types of risk. You will play a critical role in business case development, financial due-diligence, and post-acquisition integration. Lastly, you will continue to develop, shape and elevate the M&A finance team. On the Corporate reporting side, you will provide timely and insightful recommendations to our leaders on company financial performance and support strategic decisions. You will help further develop and sharpen our analytics on SaaS unit economics to evaluate business efficiencies to drive investment decisions. This is a highly visible role in the organization with close partnership with senior leaders across the company. M&A Finance Partner closely with Corporate Development and Product teams to accelerate Atlassian's business objectives through strategic M&A Build detailed financial models / projections with a deep understanding of the Target businesses and its underlying metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs). Also serve as an advisor to the business on the deals Plan and execute financial due diligence analysis, including, but not limited to, quality of earnings, net working capital, indebtedness, revenue retention, and run-rate financial performance, as well as directing third-party vendors Interface directly with Founders and senior leaders from Target companies to understand the trends and drivers of the business Drive integration plans from inception to completion, ensuring all work-stream deliverables are completed on time and with quality Mentor, develop, and further elevate M&A finance team Corporate Reporting Provide business insight on company financial performance to senior leaders, including quarter end packets to prepare CFO for board meeting and earnings Evolve SaaS unit economics to evaluate business efficiencies to drive investments Enhance free cash flow and balance sheet forecasts Work closely with the broader finance teams such as: Investor Relations on company financial performance and earnings; Total Rewards on annual compensation adjustments, bonus and equity plan, and share count and dilution forecasts; Accounting and Tax on non-standard transactions and tax planning; Treasury on FX hedges and investment income forecast Coach and develop reporting team On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 8+ years of financial / analytical role in tech, consulting, or investment banking with 3+ years of M&A experience, 5+ years of people management. Experience in SaaS preferred Strong analytic / critical thinking, business partnership, communication, and cross functional collaboration skills Hands-on and strong financial modeling skills in Excel / Google Sheets Strong understanding of GAAP accounting principles and financial statements Ability to draw upon insights and tell a compelling story involving business metrics to help influence key decisions Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field (Finance, Accounting, Economics), MBA and/or CFA is a plus More About Our Team Atlassian has a business model, with a focus on growth and profitability, that is rare among its growth technology peers. We also have an analytics DNA that runs deep through the company's core. FP&A is a highly visible team in the organization at the intersection of both these focus areas. The FP&A team is a hardworking and collaborative team with an unusual mix of technology industry, consulting and financial services background. Our responsibilities include facilitating planning, providing insight into business performance, supporting strategic decision-making and helping predict the future of the business. We encourage decision-making at every level and highly value an open-minded approach and organizational transparency. We work closely with business leaders across all areas of the business to support the Company’s continued growth. You'll join an extraordinary team that is passionate about Atlassian, its products, and its customers. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is revolutionizing the software development industry and helping teams all around the world like NASA, Tesla, Daimler, and Amadeus to advance humanity through the power of software & collaboration. We're looking for a dynamic sales leader to further develop and lead our Enterprise Advocate organization in the Americas region. With over 200,000 customers worldwide, our global Enterprise Advocate team engages Atlassian's largest customers, representing Atlassian's enterprise product portfolio, including JIRA, Confluence, Jira Service Management, and Jira Align. Our non-traditional sales org is responsible for the expansion of enterprise products into the above-mentioned customers. As a second-line sales leader, you'll continue to develop a comprehensive sales and account engagement strategy that prioritizes important performance measures for your team of four front-line Sales Managers—achieving sales OKR's and revenue targets. You will compile and review quantitative sales data and react to changing trends or new competitive threats and opportunities. Success will be dependent on your ability to work in close coordination with our Sales Operations team, our Marketing and Channel sales organizations (including external Solutions Partners), and other important partners across Atlassian's management team. You will report to the Head of Strategic Advocates in the Americas. We are looking for someone who leads, collaborates, and inspires teams inside and outside of our direct sales organization. You must be achievement orientated and have an ability to collaborate with Atlassian Solution Partners, cross functional business partners, and of course, customers. Atlassian is a TEAM first organization, and you must be someone who can contribute in an environment that prides itself on its open, honest, and supportive culture. You have 5-7 years of sales management experience with experience developing sales organizations in the Americas. Before anything else, you are someone who wants to challenge the traditional sales model and improve sales processes in a supportive, transparent environment. Running the same play that worked at your prior company is most likely not going to work at Atlassian. You will play an important part in helping us build the next generation of our enterprise business model. What we're looking for: 5-7 years of sales management experience in a B2B sales environment Experience leading sales teams of around 20 people Experience managing and developing front-line Sales Managers Experience developing go-to-market strategies and corporate sales plans Experience working with a channel sales organization Experience leading strategic customer relationships and sales opportunities (e.g. 6-figure transactions w/ existing accounts) Experience coaching individual contributor and manager performance against well defined expectations Experience leading across a variety of teams, including SalesOps, Enablement, SEs, Renewals, and XDRs Experience using a modern CRM to develop team performance metrics Experience hiring and onboarding sales representatives and sales managers Experience building territories in the Americas market In-depth knowledge of local (AMER) markets Background in meeting performance targets Preferred Experience: Experience selling complex SaaS solutions to Dev/IT/Agile audiences Experience in a "non-traditional" sales environment (i.e. uniquely customer-centric, collaborative, account-based selling methods) Keen understanding of the value behind migrating from on-prem/server/perpetual licensing to a cloud-based SaaS platform Experience working within both startup and mature corporate environments Familiarity with Atlassian's industry-leading ecosystem and flywheel expansion growth model The Enterprise Advocacy team was established in the summer of 2014 to help support customers who want to scale their investment in Atlassian. The team is comprised of Enterprise Advocates specializing in Atlassian's suite of Enterprise products and services. Those on the team have a collective experience in Sales and Management roles in both well-established Fortune 500 companies as well as exciting startups. We share a desire to achieve our goals, but above all, we believe in the Atlassian values and want to use them as our compass in always refining and optimizing our non-traditional sales model, one that redefines how software is sold in the Enterprise! jobTitle: Head of Partner Solutions Strategy, Agile at Scale
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. With a sufficient timezone overlap with the team, we're able to hire eligible candidates for this role from USA and Canada. If this sparks your interest, apply today and chat with our friendly recruitment team further. At Atlassian, we are on a mission to help our customers compete and win in the modern, digital economy. We have built a multi-billion-dollar, fast-growing software business with over 200,000 paying customers and millions of users around the globe. Many of these organizations acquire Atlassian tools through our global network of partners, who find a diverse range of enterprise solutions - such as those powered by our Jira Align product, which helps customers scale agile to the enterprise. We are looking for an experienced Sr. Manager, Partner Solutions Strategy for a necessary role within our Partner Solutions Acceleration team. You will lead the global team and guide our Global Agile at Scale Partner Solutions strategy, capability, and channel development. You will have ownership of enablement and capability building of the Global Agile at Scale partner eco-system. By taking a global macro view, you will establish a plan to guide partner enablement, and guide expansion of the partner community. You will collaborate with the Channel Business Development and Partner Managers, Marketing, Sales, Solution Engineers/Architects and play a necessary part in a global team dedicated to ensuring the success of partners in one of our fastest growing segments. There is simply not a more exciting and impactful Agile at Scale practice building opportunity anywhere. Is this the opportunity for you? In This Role, You'll Get To Manage a team of Regional Agile at Scale Partner Solution Strategists. Establish a global capability and enablement strategy in collaboration with Regional Partner Solution Strategists, Customer Advisory, Channel, Sales and Marketing teams to grow and accelerate our Agile at Scale partner eco-system. Provide guidance and work with Atlassian partners to create packaged Agile at Scale implementation services, solutions and GTM strategy based on Jira and Jira Align. Conduct Jira and Jira Align capability and enablement workshops with partners. Lead global channel efforts focused on Agile at Scale Solution market success. Assess channel coverage, partner capacity, and recruitment requirements for the Agile at Scale Partner eco-system, across a range of different partnership models. Partner with Enterprise Sales to educate them on partner capabilities and improve the co-selling motion. Align and collaborate with your team in the Customer Success, Channel, and Sales organizations to improve results. Collaborate across Atlassian to build and deliver a coordinated enablement model. More About You You will have 10+ years of product, consulting and sales experience within Agile at Scale, Agile/Digital Transformation, and other enterprise solutions. A history of working in a matrix organization where internal/external bridge-building and partnering is an essential quality. Good to have experience working with Partners. Excellent business insights! Understanding of how to position and sell value, calculate return on investment, and consultative selling. Mastered executive communication, but also feel comfortable conducting workshops and working with technology teams. While proficient and confident, you remain coachable and aim to be the very best. Your ego is in-check. You will focus and guide Agile at Scale channel and experience plans, but also keep an eye on the business as a whole. You bring a record of meeting performance metrics - both sales and non-revenue targets. Accountability. We have goals and need you to accomplish to "get stuff done". According to Atlassian policy, you must be fully vaccinated and submit proof of their vaccinated status to assume this role, subject to legal exemptions. You must provide proof of their vaccinated status within 30 days of their start date. Please reach out to your recruiter if you have questions about this requirement or if you'd like to submit a request for an exemption before the start of your employment. About The Team The Partner Solutions Acceleration Team is part of the Customer Success & Innovation (CSI) team with the objective of accelerating Channel by allowing and collaborating with partners to build, market, and sell our market-leading Scaled Agile and DevOps, Work Management, and ITSM solutions. This is a specialist team with deep industry and technology solutions expertise, and is responsible for channel-driven business. We are doubling down on building this team as a compliment to our Channel Organization - all in cooperation with our uniquely-powerful, low-friction flywheel that adds thousands of new customers per quarter! Above all, we believe in the Atlassian values and use them as our compass in always refining and ensuring our Channel model, one that is redefining how channel can help and accelerate our customers adoption through solutions-based approach using our software. jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, our products help teams all over the planet advance humanity through the power of software. Atlassian’s mission is to help fuel the potential of every team! The Atlassian Security Team's purpose is to build trust. We seek to lead our peers in cloud and product security, meet all customer requirements and exceed requirements for industry security standards and certifications. Do you believe an organization should be open and transparent about its programs, processes, and metrics? We do. This is why we share our journey and encourage other cloud providers to do the same. We are looking for a leader that can help grow and lead our security team for years to come, while working in concert with the broader Trust Organization and all of Atlassian. About The Role Collaborating with the Chief Information Security Officer, the Director/Head of Threat Detection and Response and SOC, will lead a distributed team of over 70+ security engineers and analyst. The Security Intelligence program includes Threat Detection & Engineering, Security Incident Response, Security Operation/SIRT, Threat Intelligence and Forensics. You'll build relationships across our company with teams including Engineering, Product, Communications and PR, Legal, and Finance. You'll be part of senior security leadership for Atlassian. A Successful Candidate Will Provide strategic direction, set objectives and structure and resource the organization and the work in a way that improves the impact of the team and provides a paved path to a leadership position among SaaS providers. Report updates on programs, roadmaps and OKRs with proper metrics, and present to CISO and Exec team. Proved ability to build high performing teams. Hire and retain top talent, managers and individual contributors, across various programs. Hold high bar but still meet our aggressive hiring goals. The team is expected to double in the next 2-3 years. Grow the Security Programs and Capabilities to an industry-leading position, finding opportunities to improve our existing approach and helping to guide the team to unlock that potential. Handle cyber risk management and cyber intelligence - to understand developing security threats in the industry and evaluating the potential impact to our customers and our business. Drive teams to conduct high quality incident response process, drive timely remediation and communicate with internal and external collaborators during incidents. Follow up incidents with comprehensive postmortems and drive improvements across various teams involved. Lead security program planning and implementation - Evaluating, crafting, procuring, and rolling out security technology and programs, and making sure we are deploying the best of breed solutions that are crafted to exceed the high expectations set by our customers. Builds Trust internally, being the voice of Security inside and outside of Atlassian. They will also adopt Atlassian’s commitment to openness, enabling the company to talk openly about our approach to security. Over the next few years, this leader will advance Atlassian’s goal to be a recognized leader SIRT, Threat detection & response. Collaborate with other security teams like Product Security, Corp Sec, Infrastructure security, and more. Also coordinates cross-functional responses to security issues and incidents Enable governance and partner with our Risk and Compliance team, as well as internal and external auditors and regulators to ensure Atlassian’s security meets a wide range of industry compliance and legal requirements. (SOC2, ISO, FedRAMP, HIPAA, etc.) What We Are Looking For At least 10+ years of multifaceted security leadership and management experience in a technology-centric company, including experience leading security teams of 50+ engineers and analysts in a globally distributed organization that services dozens of partners. Diverse experience working at technology companies across different type of businesses and across various stages of the growth private/public. Experience working at larger SaaS companies is highly desired. Prior to taking on Management roles, candidate has hands on experience designing and deploying security controls across all security intelligence functions like threat detection, response and Operations as an Individual Contributor. Knowledge or hands on experience with other domains of security like access management, data protection, vulnerability management, application security, network security, preventive, detective and offensive security solutions is a plus. Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills; ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization; this includes both written and verbal communications and drive multi-functional alignment and action. jobTitle: Head of Strategic Engagement Management - AMER
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. The Atlassian Advisory Services team is a globally distributed team of Atlassian solutions advisors who are passionate about creating customer success. Advisory Services team members engage with enterprise organizations with some of the most complex business challenges and help them deliver a delightful solution to their users. We provide teams of trusted advisors helping orchestrate successful outcomes with customers to help them get the most out of their Atlassian investment and unlock their ideal solution for team collaboration. At Atlassian, you'll have an impact on millions of users, fast! We don't just want to know your opinions, we want to see your ideas in action. We hire great people and then trust them to be great. We're hiring a Head of Strategic Engagement Management, reporting to the Head of Advisory Services for the Americas, to own and orchestrate the strategy and operations of our Atlassian Advisory Services Strategic Engagement Management team. Strategic Engagement Managers (SEMs) are experienced relationship managers responsible for building responsible for owning and up-leveling the client's services engagement experience within Advisory Services. Strategic Engagement Managers help orchestrate our teams inside and outside of Atlassian, as well as identify additional opportunities to position Service offerings from Advisory Services and our Channel partners. Within Advisory Services, you will work alongside the Head of Solution Delivery and our Services Solutions Advocates team within your region and you will also collaborate with Advisory Services leaders across the globe. Across Atlassian, you will partner with our Go-To-Market leadership to identify and amplify opportunities to accelerate client growth with products and Advisory Services. Additionally, you will also own collection and analysis of customer health across engagements, highlighting actionable trends that impact growth and/or customer satisfaction. You lead with empathy and are motivated by your team's success. You are a life-long learner and you look at failure as a necessary step in the journey towards knowledge/skill acquisition. People describe you as someone who can set the right direction and expectations across time zones and cultures, and have the right balance of identifying new ways of building business and solving risks to current execution and scale. You are experienced and experienced at working with decision-makers across functional groups and with executive leadership within enterprise-sized customer organizations and you're able to coach others to establish the right strategy for unlocking opportunities within a portfolio of customer accounts. You understand the process by which software is defined, built, and deployed and you have working knowledge of ITSM, Enterprise Agility, and DevOps. You are familiar with Atlassian's product offerings and how they help accelerate customer value realization. What You'll Do Lead strategy and operations for the Advisory Services Strategic Engagement Management team Establish measures, gather, and analyze customer and engagement health for regional engagements Staff, onboard, and skill-up new managers Support the demand pipeline by partnering with Services Solutions Advocates Lead strategy for staffing (forecast, process) for SEM within region Managing the quality of relationship management for your team's engagements Work with Atlassian Solution Partners & Services Solutions Advocates to identify Advisory Services and partner co-delivery opportunities Engage with strategic accounts to build partnerships Serve as a leadership escalation point of contact within region Drive and contribute to strategic Advisory Services initiatives Collaborate with regional team leads and CSI Leadership to prioritize investments Collaborate and plan with GTM leadership On your first day, we'll expect you to have: 5+ years of experience in the CSI organization at Atlassian OR 10+ years managing a professional services delivery team 10 or more years of consultative and/or engagement management experience Passion for mentoring, coaching, and developing others Typically up to 30% including some international travel may be required. Your background 15+ years of experience with SaaS companies 10+ years enterprise engagement management experience Customer discovery/interview skills Strong coaching skills Change management and solution rollout/adoption experience Comfortable speaking and influencing senior leadership inside at Atlassian and with clients Experience identifying and explaining themes from customer data Experience helping an organization adopt an Atlassian product or similar product Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. jobTitle: Head of UX Research, Platform and Data
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Your Future Team Are you a senior research leader who is, love the research craft, and can bring bring teams together to solve complex problems and drive an evidence driven customer focus? If so, we're looking for you to lead one of the fastest growing and business critical teams in Atlassian. Reporting to the Global Head of Research, you will lead our Transformations, Operations and Platform (TOP) research organization which consists of four areas, including Platform, Data, Enterprise and Economy teams. You will be an important member of one of the most senior leadership squads in our company and be crucial to informing and influencing strategy for important business areas. With the leadership squad you will share responsibility for the strategy, success and team health of our teams in the TOP organization. The work of your team will impact over 180,000 customers and millions of users in 190 countries who are trying to unleash the potential of their teams through better tooling, practices and processes. Our research team is a passionate team of mixed methods researchers, spread across the globe. We work together to improve our craft as researchers and our ability to support Atlassian to build better experiences for our customers and users. What you'll do Manage four Senior Research Managers and support them to ensure the impact and health of their fast growing teams. Ensure healthy scaling of our fast growing team through development of management and leadership capacity, organisational design, hiring an inclusive team, mentoring and developing research talent, modeling great craft practices. Partner with a leadership team across product management, design, data science, data science, marketing and engineering to provide research and insights that influence strategy, design and roadmap priorities and direction. Use your storytelling skills to energize people around delighting customers through great user experiences and ensure successful implementation through influence and hands-on leadership. Contribute to the development of a creative research practice across Atlassian as a member of our Global Research Leadership Team. Your background Experience helping shape strategy and priorities for executive leadership teams at a company strategy level. Experience influencing and shaping executive strategies with research and insight. 5+ years experience hiring and managing senior research managers, building and scaling a team of 25+ researchers. 5+ years of hands-on experience designing and conducting high-quality user research (qualitative and quantitative) that has had an impact. Examples of research communication that influences and inspires change. You know how to advocate for research and researchers; you rely on qualitative and quantitative data to create ways of reinforcing your team's insights so they resonate and are impactful across diverse audiences, you work in an open and collaborative way. It would be nice if you had, but we appreciate you popping your hat in the ring: Postgraduate qualifications are a bonus, particularly in the areas of psychology, anthropology, sociology, human factors or a related subject area. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Your future team Atlassian uses a decentralised incident management practice. Major Incidents are managed by Major Incident Managers across each engineering team in Atlassian following a YBIYRI (You Build It, You Run It) mentality. Working closely with the Incident Management automation team, Incident Process Owner and PIR Owner, you will be leading the operational aspect of the incident management and PIR processes. You will identify key areas to improve these, assist with our training programs and education, and help drive initiatives and improvements to make our practices more robust, efficient and simple. This is an exciting opportunity to be on the cutting edge of service management practices within a rapidly growing, large organisation where you will be able to help shape the future of reliability for our internal and external customers. What you'll do Specifically we would like you to help with some of these BAU initiatives such as - Help other teams with Incident and Postmortem quality uplift Help run complicated multiteam postmortums Provide support to team to understand the Incident and postmortem process Help onboard new Atlassian acquisitions in understanding our incident and postmortem processes Help rollout reliability initiatives revolving around incident and postmortem response Help teams run incident simulations, walk-throughs and wargames Develop and deliver training initiatives Your background Demonstrated experience with Incident Management within a cloud environment at scale - preferably both as an Engineer and as an Incident Manager Experience in major incidents - preferably wide scale, high impact Sev 1 and 0 (defcon) responses Experience in root cause analysis and post-mortems Experience driving large-scale process improvements across areas of an organisation Experience in low-level analysis and audit work to drive governance and metrics - the 'unglamorous' work that allows larger initiatives to flourish On-call experience We'd be super excited if you have any of the following Experience in incident wargaming or incident simulation such as the wheel of misfortune Experience preparing high-quality video training. Basic SQL or coding skills to attain data for metric reporting High-level technical understanding of networking and Linux/Unix based operating systems - docker, Kubernetes, AWS, APIs etc Past experiencing in reading code or scripts (being technical always helps in incident resolution) Operations background (eg at some point working in NOC, as a sysadmin etc.) Experience in delivering training or education to groups and individuals Soft skills in partner/relationship management to influence stakeholders On Call We are looking at creating a follow the sun specialized incident management team that caters for incidents that - Are laterally impacting covering many teams and departments within the organisation. Do not have a direct engineering team to manage them Weekends - on call roughly once every seven to eight weeks. We're looking for a Lead Content Designer to join our Work Management, Solution Experience team and help deliver on our mission of empowering diverse teams to work differently, together. We believe teams should never compromise on the best tool for the job. We support this belief by helping customers cut down on the collaborative friction that comes with an increase in tool adoption and data sprawl. Our team creates solutions to help customers onboard, adopt and administer practices and tools for distributed ways of working. Your future team As a Lead Content Designer for our Solution Experience team, you'll work with teams across our portfolio of Work Management products, including Confluence and Trello, and collaborate with our Platform and Customer Success teams to deliver cohesive end-to-end customer experiences. You'll be part of a growing and thriving Atlassian Customer Experience team, committed to putting our customers first. What you'll do Partner closely with product design leadership and other cross-functional stakeholders to identify, prioritize, and develop plans to address content experience challenges; Lead strategic initiatives (determining needs, objectives, approaches, and evaluation criteria) that aim to deliver better experiences for our customers and help achieve business goals; Collaborate with other content design leads to standardize content experiences and methodologies across product content design teams; Define and share best practices for content delivery, maintenance, and governance; Mentor and develop the craft of product content designers across Work Management; Work autonomously on the end-to-end experience for our Work Management solution experiences; Collaborate with some of the industry's smartest (and nicest) people across our Engineering, Product, Marketing, Research, Data Science, Customer Success, and other teams; and, Be a true champion for our users by living one of our core company values ("Don't F the Customer"). Your background 9+ years of professional content design experience, backed by high-quality writing, content strategy, go-to-market strategy, and communication skills; Experience driving growth experimentation for enterprise software; Strong facilitation and collaboration skills: you can demonstrate the ability to work with multiple teams, solicit and summarize feedback, and facilitate design discussions; Openness to the iterative content design process – always showing work in progress, validating with customers and data, iterating, shipping, and learning; and, Experience conducting and applying customer research, including design thinking and conceptual modeling. More About Our Team Content Designers at Atlassian look at the way we communicate with our customers as an end-to-end journey. We consider content to be a powerful and essential part of that journey. Our content designers work collaboratively across Atlassian to champion our design language , tell consistent stories, and craft great customer experiences. Read more at Designing Atlassian .
