What you'll do Partner closely with product design leadership and other cross-functional stakeholders to identify, prioritize, and develop plans to address content experience challenges; Lead strategic initiatives (determining needs, objectives, approaches, and evaluation criteria) that aim to deliver better experiences for our customers and help achieve business goals; Collaborate with other content design leads to standardize content experiences and methodologies across product content design teams; Define and share best practices for content delivery, maintenance, and governance; Mentor and develop the craft of product content designers across Work Management; Work autonomously on the end-to-end experience for our Work Management solution experiences; Collaborate with some of the industry's smartest (and nicest) people across our Engineering, Product, Marketing, Research, Data Science, Customer Success, and other teams; and, Be a true champion for our users by living one of our core company values ("Don't F the Customer"). Your background 9+ years of professional content design experience, backed by high-quality writing, content strategy, go-to-market strategy, and communication skills; Experience driving growth experimentation for enterprise software; Strong facilitation and collaboration skills: you can demonstrate the ability to work with multiple teams, solicit and summarize feedback, and facilitate design discussions; Openness to the iterative content design process – always showing work in progress, validating with customers and data, iterating, shipping, and learning; and, Experience conducting and applying customer research, including design thinking and conceptual modeling. More About Our Team Content Designers at Atlassian look at the way we communicate with our customers as an end-to-end journey. We consider content to be a powerful and essential part of that journey. Our content designers work collaboratively across Atlassian to champion our design language , tell consistent stories, and craft great customer experiences. Read more at Designing Atlassian . Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is growing faster than ever and has an opportunity for a Design Technologist to join our design operations team, Design Hub. The Design Hub team is a cross-disciplinary design operations team focused on enabling more effective designers and a more efficient Experience Design org. We own the operationalizing, optimizing, and scaling of design by designing practices, systems, and tools that drive operational and craft excellence. Reporting to the Head of Design Ops, this person will contribute to critical CX initiatives for the Design Hub team, focused on developing tooling that help bring efficiencies to design activities as well as enable the effectiveness and value of Atlassian designers and design teams at scale. Does this sound fun to you? You might just be the person we're looking for. In This Role, You Will Own, augment, and build the tools our designers use—we're not afraid to build new tools, dogfood our own products, or explore the newest technologies to make our work better and more collaborative. Work to make designers’ lives simpler, more efficient, and more productive by building custom tooling and apps, developing instrumented quality scorecards, and identifying opportunities for innovation and efficiency improvements. Work with Design Hub teammates to better understand what gaps exist in internal process, knowledge, or tooling across our design teams Build tools that make prototyping within the Experience Design organization easier and more tightly To be successful in this role, you… …have a high bar and an eye for good design—you care about the details, love working with designs and designers, and are unafraid to contribute constructive, thoughtful feedback on work. …are organized, proactive, and thrive in the details–even as you work in a fast-paced, sometimes ambiguous environment. You think strategically, recognize the importance of long-term goals, have vision, and are committed to success. …are an excellent communicator who knows how to connect with people all over the globe at various levels of seniority, and you're comfortable calling "BS" if you see it - even with execs. …seek out opportunities to improve and optimize - constantly searching for new knowledge (and new ideas!) and you’re willing to learn and try better ways of working. …are a systems thinker who always has a line of sight to the big picture. You’re constantly seeking to connect the dots and solve for root problems, not just immediate symptoms. In Terms Of Experience, This Means 5+ years of experience as a Design Technologist, UX Developer, or similar role. Deep knowledge of a wide range of front-end programming “dialects” for web and mobile experiences (Angular, Flutter, React, ReactNative, or similar frameworks, to name a few) You are comfortable leading programs of work, managing stakeholder expectations and dependencies. Several years of senior-level experience writing HTML, JavaScript and CSS applications and fluency with modern frameworks and libraries such as React and NodeJS A portfolio of professional creative work that demonstrates intuitive front end user interfaces A portfolio of work that demonstrates experience/expertise in one or more of the following: Supporting implementation of a Design (Language) System for a multi-product portfolio. Prototyping in Figma and/or Proto.io Multi-platform UI testing systems (BrowserStack, HeadSpin, etc.) Designing/coding for Accessibility (WCAG 2.1) Designing/coding for multiple languages and locales (i18n/l10n standards) Analytics tools (e.g., Firebase Analytics, Pendo, Google Optimize, etc.) CI/CD tooling and processes (e.g., BItbucket Pipelines, Gitlab). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian's mission "to unleash the potential of every team" is the guiding light behind what we do. We have developed well-known products such as Jira, Confluence, and Trello that fit into the fabric of teamwork across different types of teams and the processes to help every team succeed. Atlassian helps teams everywhere change the world. Our products are revolutionizing the software industry, and helping teams collaborate and create the magic that provides their best work. Think NASA launching the Rover on Mars or Cochlear gifting those born deaf with the ability to hear, your work directly impacts the products they use to promote humanity. Role In this role as a Lead Principal Architect, you will be working across the Team Data organization which serves the following mission-critical functions for the whole company Analytical Data Platform which includes data lake, data ingestion/modeling/transformation tooling and frameworks as well as the query layer Platforms for specific use cases: Machine Learning & AI, Measurement & Experimentation Data Engineering Our Customer Data Offering Atlassian Analytics. On your first day, we’ll expect you to have: Strong technical expertise and 10+ years experience in designing/building data-intensive applications. Fluency in the current landscape (SQL, NoSQL, NewSQL, big data, ML, Streaming, ETL) Passion for software engineering excellence (design principles and patterns, unit testing, performance engineering, best practices for security and privacy etc) Passion and aptitude for recognizing, raising, and reconciling gaps and redundant efforts across organizations Excellent collaboration, communication and leadership skills. Ability to get engineers to follow their lead as well as mentor/coach High level of energy and a desire to thrive in a large, fast-paced organization; ability to balance multiple projects under pressure It’s Great, But Not Required If You Have In-depth knowledge of AWS storage and data offerings is super useful for this role but not necessary 10+ years of industry experience Experience in ML and Big Data Previous experience having led teams thru arduous decomposition and architecture programs Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Your future team We are the developers, designers, content designers, researchers and product managers behind Atlassian's mission to ensure that the design system is the cornerstone of crafting quality interfaces at scale. Our work enables teams to create simple, intuitive, beautiful and harmonious experiences from our self service guidelines, reusable components and platform capabilities. Our design language allows designers and developers to craft experiences efficiently and our customers to use familiar components across every product touchpoint. You will be the lead designer helping us to establish our accessibility roadmap, strategy and partner with your cross-functional peers to design elegant solutions which enables our Design System to be WCAG2.1 compliant. What you'll do Report to our Senior Design Manager for Accessibility as part of the Atlassian Design System team and work closely with the centralised Atlassian Accessibility Team Design and deliver beautiful solutions which supports our design system UI Foundations, components and service experience of using the Atlassian Design System from an accessibility point of view Lead, inspire and help to establish our US-based Design Systems team through your ability to drive design programs and building strategic partnerships with company leaders Mentor, coach and share your design system mastery with other product designers on the team to grow the team forwards Partner with Engineering and Product leaders to evolve the Atlassian Design System and provide digital Accessibility at scale Collaborate with partners across the company to identify additional Design System investments to enhance the creation of Accessible experiences Manage projects that you lead and ensure outcomes are also achieved through others in your team. Your background 8+ years experience of design experience and has been in a lead role Experience in having worked in or closely with a Design System Designing for inclusive and accessible experiences is your area of expertise Knowledge of Accessibility requirements (e.g., Web Content Accessibility Guidelines, WCAG) Experience working with people with disabilities and knowledge of Assistive Technologies on desktop and mobile platforms Experience in implementing Accessibility in UI components, including interoperability with Assistive Technologies Facilitation and collaboration skills: you can demonstrate the ability to work with multiple teams, solicit and summarise feedback, and facilitate design discussions Background in visual design, digital design, front end development, systems design, enterprise design of large-scale where a design system has been applied UX/product design experience, designing complex or enterprise-level software Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. We're on a mission to help users to stay informed and contribute to their work from any device. We build Confluence's native app experiences on iOS and Android platforms. We're looking for a lead product designer to join our Confluence mobile team to help us build a delightful Confluence mobile experience. Your future team As a Lead product designer for our Confluence mobile team, you'll work closely with cross-functional partners to keep our users engaged with our mobile products. You'll also collaborate with other Confluence teams and our platform teams to build holistic cross-platform product experiences that highlight and leverage unique mobile capabilities. You'll report to a mobile design manager. What you'll do Craft the future of Confluence on iOS and Android Partner with cross-functional teams to understand our users and their needs–whether through user research, experimentation, workshopping, or sketching/visualization Collaborate with other Confluence teams to map essential customer journeys across the web and mobile and identify areas to improve our mobile experience using unique mobile capabilities Help develop design craft by mentoring other designers and raising the quality bar Revamp Confluence mobile design system Be a true mobile champion to broader teams Your background 8+ years of professional UX or digital product design experience Demonstrated expert-level knowledge in both iOS and Android platforms In-depth familiarity with the latest trends in mobile app user experience Excellent visual design skills and a demonstrated mastery of typography, color, and layout Experienced iterative design process – always sketching, showing work in progress, validating with customers and data, iterating, shipping, and learning Experienced collaborating with teams to deliver high-quality designs to customers Working knowledge of accessibility on mobile Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is searching for a Lead Researcher to join our growing team of research experts. Atlassian's mission is to unleash the potential of teams all over the world. You will have the opportunity to define and conduct research that not only informs our ultimate mission, but that also feeds the design, strategy and development of our products. You'll be joining a smart and passionate team of mixed methods researchers, spread across the globe and you will report into a Research Manager. We work together to continuously improve our craft as researchers and our ability to support Atlassian to build better experiences for our customers and users. What You'll Do You will have the opportunity to make impact on a huge scale: we're searching for someone to help us identify and understand the questions we need to answer to move product strategy and execution forward. Your insights and discoveries will help inform not only our company strategy, but also our product experiences and long-term roadmaps. You will partner with key stakeholders across product management, design, marketing, analytics, and engineering to influence product design and direction. You will conduct end- to-end research using a variety of methodologies, to help us better understand our users (current and future), their needs and the opportunity this uncovers for our products. You'll be empowered to work with autonomy and creativity every step of the way, working with stakeholders to determine where the greatest impact can be made, and to triage research requests. As a lead researcher you will provide craft thought leadership, modeling high quality craft practices and contributing to the development of a strong and innovative research practice across Atlassian. Your Background 7+ years of hands-on experience designing and conducting user research that has had an impact. We expect to hear stories of how your research influenced product roadmaps and informed design decisions. Experience with a variety of qualitative and quantitative research techniques (remote and in-person), along with the knowledge of when, why and how to apply them. We value your ability to be creative when thinking about the research problem you're trying to solve, and your ability to bring your team along on the journey of your discoveries. Communication skills that influence and inspire change. You know how to analyze qualitative data, synthesize into a coherent and truthful story, and how to create effective ways of sharing your insights so they resonate and are impactful across diverse audiences, including senior leadership. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Join Atlassian as an intern and spend your summer with us having impact on how millions of users collaborate and use software. The most amazing thinkers—like NASA rocket scientists and Tesla engineers—are coming to us for solutions. You will report to a manager in the Core Machine Learning team within the broader Analytics group. The team is tasked to pursue business opportunities that can produce revenue or MAU improvements. The team works multi-functionally across the organization, using insights generated by marketing and product analytics that can be scaled or automated to create value. The team focuses on growth and on velocity between brainstorming and initial output. Apply for our Summer 2023 intern program and start an awesome career! Not eligible for Visa sponsorship. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN, or H-1B students at this time. Your Background Must be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship, graduating by June 2024 Be able to commit to a full-time (40hrs / week) 12-week internship You MUST choose which machine learning role you would like to be considered for from the options below. As a Machine Learning Engineer Intern you... Help research, build, and implement machine learning pipeline tools, platforms, and algorithms Collaborate with our team of machine learning scientists to build production machine learning solutions Work with large datasets of behavioral and textual data Have experience with Python AND Java, Kotlin, or Scala Have experience in one or more SQL languages such as PostgreSQL, Redshift, MySQL, etc. As a Machine Learning Scientist Intern you... Focus on ML applications and ideas for content recommendation, personalization, and insight generation Can build machine learning and predictive models Can translate business problems into technical solutions Have experience writing software with minimal bugs in Python, Scala, or Spark Have experience with SQL (Bonus!) Your future team We're looking for a Data leader with business instincts, management experience, analytics mastery, and experienced in improving data science efficiency. Someone who is passionate about applying these skills to lead data quality, reduce the need for data scientists to perform data engineering tasks, working across the organization to create the proper data layer to increase data science productivity. What you'll do Draw on your expertise in understanding software development lifecycle and developer productivity to think about what are data and insights features that we should ship to our customers to influence the way they work Partner with the data engineering and platform teams to identify, and support short, medium and long-term portfolio of projects that improves data assets used across data science. Envision, scope, and lead projects by collaborating with partners, software and data engineering leaders, and data scientists. Guide the creation of tools that allow a centralized data framework that improves the efficiency, quality and capabilities of all data analysts and scientists. Oversee business case development, data requirement gathering (including metrics and definitions agreement), establishing acceptance criteria, QAing, and testing for new transformational data products from start to finish to ensure everything is implemented and validated. Work across marketing and product to develop monitoring and action plans across the data quality lifecycle (instrumentation → transformation → data/metrics/segments) Lead, coach, and build the data quality team within the Data Science team Collaborate with the Business Intelligence team to define and achieve standard segment and metric definitions and governance. Contribute into overall Data Science team OKRs Be part of building an outstanding analytics culture at Atlassian. Leading by example, through education and creation of self-service tools, to make a lasting change in how data is used to make decisions Guide demos sessions and education roll out for new data products and features to ensure adoption and usage Your background 3+ years of data science, analytics and/or data engineering leadership experience Experience working with software and data engineering teams, an understanding of the software development lifecycle, what drives software team to succeed and exposure to typical software engineering tools (e.g. Jira, SCM, CI/CD systems). Expertise in data modeling, (e.g. SQL, Python), knowledge of cloud data environments (e.g. AWS), and experience with data ETLs and UAT processes An Agile development mindset, appreciating the benefit of constant iteration and improvement. A very high bar for output quality, while balancing "having something now" vs. "perfection in the future" Experience applying your analytics skills to identify and lead projects that have had impact on strategic and product roadmap decisions A very high bar for output quality; with experience coaching teams to balance thoughtfulness, perfection and speed Expertise in SQL and proficiency in another data science programming language (e.g Python, R) Proficiency in at least one visualization tool (e.g. Tableau, R-Shiny, dash, Microstrategy) Comfort explaining complex concepts to diverse audiences (such as Product Managers, Designers, Engineers), and creating compelling stories Project management and prioritization experience; preferably with Data Engineering, Product Management, and Software Engineering teams A degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, econometrics) Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is hiring for our corporate finance team. You will be part of a team that acts as the “glue” across Finance to drive Atlassian’s continued success, and who are responsible for strategic, annual and quarterly operating planning for the entire company. You will work across our product groups and the Finance organization to drive the growth of our business. You will provide insightful recommendations to the Executive Team in support of our most strategic decisions and resource allocations. This is a highly visible role in the organization with close partnership with senior business leaders across the company. The role is ideally suited if you are a passionate professional interested in developing an intimate understanding of the Atlassian business. What You'll Be Doing As a Corporate FP&A Manager, you will lead the short-term planning function within Corporate FP&A, partnering with and providing direction to the broader FP&A team and senior business leaders. Your experience across both revenue and expenses, and thorough knowledge of the P&L, will enable you to guide the broader FP&A team to achieve our financial performance goals including operating margin targets. Your exceptional written communication will produce high quality materials for consideration by finance leadership and senior management to make company level decisions. This is backed by your well-honed presentation abilities, which allow you to convey complex issues concisely. Your expertise in financial modeling, strong analytical background, and thorough understanding of the Atlassian business will provide decision support to senior leaders across standard planning horizons and special projects. Your ability to build strong relationships, establish trust with business partners, and co-ordinate activities across teams will enable finance to operate efficiently and deliver outcomes in a timely fashion. Your enthusiasm for efficiency will drive you to improve existing processes and introduce changes that enable the team to scale. You will report to the Corporate Planning Manager, and also coach and develop junior team members. You will have a deep understanding of and influence the key drivers of the Atlassian organization. You will also work closely with the broader finance teams (IR, Controllership, Treasury etc), program management and strategy teams. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 5+ years of experience in a financial/analytical role in tech, consulting, or investment banking. Extensive experience with Corporate FPA and managing/tracking business metrics. Hands-on and strong financial modeling skills in Excel/Google Sheets. Strong written and verbal communication skills to explain financial data to non-finance partners. Excellent organization skills and experience managing projects with a wide range of stakeholders. Ability to draw upon insights and tell a compelling story involving business metrics to help influence key decisions. A curiosity to learn and take initiative to tackle problems independently. Strong critical thinking, organizational, interpersonal, communication and cross functional collaboration skills. It's Great, But Not Required Of You Have Technology or Software / SaaS industry experience Hold a degree in Business, Economics or Finance Exposure to working with planning tools (e.g., Anaplan) Knowledge of BI tools and technologies (e.g. Tableau) More About Our Benefit Whether you work in an office or a distributed team, Atlassian is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year for your favorite cause, an annual allowance to support your learning & growth, unique ShipIt days, a company paid trip after five years and lots more. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is looking for a Solutions Engineering Manager passionate about leading a team of ITSM Solutions Engineers (SEs), who play a crucial role in Atlassian enterprise sales. This team connects customer needs with service management solutions powered by Jira Service Management. You'll report to the Head of the Americas SE team and work directly with the enterprise sales leadership and channel partners to grow the sales pipeline and help the team strategize on how to navigate sales cycles, provide compelling value-based solution demonstrations, support guided product evaluations (PoV), and close business. This may be your dream job if you're a top-performing enterprise Solutions Engineering Manager who's passionate about teams and customers. What You'll Do Manage a team of pre-sales Solutions Engineers who work closely with our Jira Service Management enterprise overlay sales team. Guide your team to demonstrate the value of the Atlassian platform and products to customers, discover customers' business and technical needs, and deliver value-focused presentations and demonstrations. Establish strong relationships with customers and partners and internal in sales leadership, product management, and teams across the customer success organization. Create strategies that allow our Solution Engineering team to scale, accelerate deal cycles and validate Jira Service Management for technical teams. Partner with teams across Atlassian (sales, marketing, channel, technical account managers, customer success managers, etc.) to drive customer success with positive outcomes that lead to successful adoption of Jira Service Management. Work with product management to improve Atlassian's product line and provide customer feedback. Coach team members according to the demands of the business and according to their individual career goals. We're looking for a dynamic team member who will both teach and learn from all of us on the Solutions Engineering team. On paper, you have 5+ years of experience interacting with enterprise customers in a pre-sales or consulting leadership capacity. More importantly, you motivate your team and can interpret complex problem statements, boil them down into simple solutions, and collaborate with prospects, channel partners, the Atlassian sales team, and the SE team to deliver winning solutions. You're equally comfortable in both a business and technical context, interacting with executives or talking shop with strong technical audiences. You love to learn, tolerate failure, and are passionate about making clients successful. Familiarity with Atlassian products is a strong plus but not required. You understand the process by which software gets defined, built, and deployed, and you have experience or familiarity with the ITSM, Agile, and DevOps solution spaces. As a bonus, you can wow us with your vision for how these solution spaces come together and how practice frameworks like ITIL 4 and DevOps are helping transform organizations. Still reading? You'll be working alongside a globally distributed SE team, speaking with Global 2000 companies every day, and collaborating closely with our sales teams to provide an Enterprise grade experience to our customers. We're a get s#$% done global team, built on Atlassian's core values. If this mirrors how you want to work, then we are excited to have you join the team and help our company grow and change for the better. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. The migrations team provides end-to-end support for customers with their migration to the cloud. Helping with everything from planning, testing, and the move to production in the cloud. The migrations team helps to create a richer and smoother migration process than if done alone. The content team sits between two worlds: process and technical. Bouncing between the two worlds based on project priority and urgency, we work with a global team of Cloud Migrations Managers (CMMs) and Migration Support Engineers (MSEs) to provide end-to-end support for the move to the cloud. As we build a content program we're making data-driven decisions on how we curate content, where we focus content development efforts, and cleanup efforts. Not eligible for Visa sponsorship. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN, or H-1B student graduates at this time. You will join a team that helps our company meet our goals through independent reviews and assessments of operational risks. You will build valuable relationships across departments and design practical and thoughtful recommendations as process owners remediate findings and implement new processes. You will be part of a dynamic team that collaborates with all parts of our business, examining business processes and internal controls with an eye for improving efficiency and compliance. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN, or H-1B student graduates at this time. Your background You love working in a fast-growing ever-evolving environment You have a desire to guide and facilitate impact, and demonstrate vitality with projects big and small You enjoy collaborating with wide variety of partners to identify and address risks You are someone who excels in a fun and dynamic team, with plenty of opportunities to learn and develop You understand finance, accounting, auditing, financial systems, and technology Be part of a finance, accounting, or information systems degree program and graduating in the Spring/Summer of 2024 Be able to commit to at least a 12 week full-time (40hrs/week) internship during Summer 2023 Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. The Atlassian Marketplace is one of the largest B2B app stores globally and has exceeded $2B in lifetime sales since launching in 2012. As Partner Communications Manager, you will report to the leader of Marketplace Operations and be responsible for defining the communication channels and quality of communications sent by Atlassian to our Marketplace Partners, Atlassian developers, and Platform Partners. Partner communications play a vital role in engaging with and enabling Atlassian technology partners and are a critical driver of positive Partner sentiment. This role is within the global Marketplace Partnerships organization and will be highly cross-functional with teams across Atlassian's global footprint, including but not limited to: Developer Experience, Channels, Product and Engineering teams, Customer Experience (CX), Analytics, Enablement, Sales and Marketing teams, Corporate Communications. What you'll do Own and drive the editorial process for partner and developer communications, including ideation, drafting, distribution, promotion, and measurement. Write and develop content to reinforce our strategy and key programs to demonstrate how Atlassian builds with partners and developers in mind. Drive enhancements to our primary communication channels and categories of communications (operational, technical, business) Create, ghostwrite, and publish content across mediums and formats (blogs, presentations, digital signage, talking points, Slack messages, emails, newsletters, infographics, podcasts, and videos). Build relationships with key internal business stakeholders and executives to identify and leverage trends and topics that should be shared with our partners and developers. Partner closely with content, communication, enablement, partner management, and support teams and cross-functional team members to deliver integrated partner communication strategies. Manage the intake and prioritization process for the function's projects, initiatives, and programs. Drive measurement, dashboard, and analytics for the function. Use project management skills to develop and implement processes, efficiencies, playbooks, and guidelines. Work closely with contractors and agency partners On the first day, we'd love you to hav Your background 5 or more years of experience in channel or technology partner programs and/or communications. We will consider transferrable skills, too. Proven experience in communications with technology partners and developers of enterprise technology brands. Ability to build and be responsible for communications programs with little oversight. Strong empathy, appreciation for, and understanding of partner and developer experience. Strong writing skills and ability to develop messaging platforms, pitches, and calls to action. Drive alignment across teams and functions with effective comms, building an understanding of the why and what for our partner and developer initiatives. A knack for knowing what will interest partners and developers and how to shape messaging for different audiences. High-energy with the ability work cross-functionally and prioritize high-profile projects, plus balance urgent inbound requests with ease. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Partner Development Manager, Field Team Acceleration
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. As a Partner Development Manager for Field Acceleration you will set the direction for how we develop partners globally by creating, implementing, and validating our motions to achieve growth by way of partner account managers. In this global role you'll focus on partners across the Atlassian ecosystem by helping to ensure our field team is equipped and enabled to be strategic business advisors to our partners. You'll set the direction and drive initiatives that develop partners and their relationship with their account managers. You will work with partners and internal stakeholders to identify needs, share partner feedback throughout the company, prioritize project roadmaps, and drive action plans to accelerate partners' growth. This is a cross-functional role working with the global channel, enablement, sales, solutions engineering, services, product, and sales operations organizations across Atlassian. More About You You are highly motivated to lead initiatives and projects that accelerate partner growth. You have supported a channel sales organization with business cases and analytics to implement a data-driven strategy. You have identified partner needs and opportunities within a channel organization. You have implemented solutions and tools to help partners prosper. You get things done efficiently while always mindful of the larger strategy . You are a master communicator who is comfortable engaging with executives. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and are an excellent TEAM player. Your Future Team You will report to the Sr. Manager, Partner Development and works with teams and leadership across Atlassian. The Partner Development team is a fun and high-energy group tasked with activating partners (Solution Partners, Integrators, Aggregators, Services Partners, Technology Partners & Resellers) to be Atlassian's 'force multiplier'. Working with over 700 global channel partners we must ensure our programs support a variety of businesses. We are a critical part of Atlassian's broader enterprise group, which has a unique approach to delivering value to our customers. What you'll do Further develop the Partner Business Planning program and drive iterative improvements Ensure partner account managers have a robust set of tools to increase partner business Develop and maintain internal channel team enablement Guide cross functional teams to deliver informative data and dashboards that bring insight into partner performance Illustrate progress and expose gaps through dashboards, reports, and charts Mange 2-3 external agency relationships Partner with geo-focused acceleration managers to build and report on field team productivity initiatives Responsible for a recurring read-out of state of field team productivity by geo Contribute to larger internal initiatives Your background BA/BS degree in Business, Finance, Marketing or equivalent experience 5+ years in a channel role at a SaaS company Extensive experience working directly with VARs/SIs/professional services organizations A strong understanding of solution partner business models and the role partners play to solution, sell and service software products Working knowledge of sales cycles and motions The ability to work cross functionally like a pro and build relationships The ability to design and execute an array of programs and projects, message them and drive adoption Working knowledge of collaboration tools Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Your future team Atlassian’s Channel community is growing and we are looking for amazing TEAM members to help us take our Channel Program to the next level. In this role, you will be responsible for building, launching and management of industry-specific programs as part of the Atlassian solution partner program. These programs are responsible for identifying areas of opportunity and optimizing programs to enable Partner success when positioning, selling and servicing Atlassian products and solutions to industry vertical customers. This individual will be responsible for working with business segments, regional field organizations, and our Partners to evolve our industry vertical programs to motive and excite our industry partner channel experts. The Industry Verticals Partner Programs Manager would build, launch and manage requirements and benefits for the program and initiatives to accelerate Atlassian adoption in key industry verticals with our partners. What you'll do Develop and implement a channel program framework that supports Atlassian industry vertical businesses worldwide Drive the design and implementation of channel partner programs or initiatives Atlassian needs to implement to accelerate Atlassian adoption in key industry verticals. Collect and manage feedback from channel partners and internal teams on the programs and effectively implement a roadmap of changes to support Atlassian's objectives for industry verticals Lead cross-functional teams to ensure the planning and execution of program launches and ongoing operations of programs are running as expected. Create internal and external program documents to clearly identify the benefits, terms and conditions, rules of engagement, and marketing that support programs globally. Manage the launch, communication, and change management for channel programs. Establish key results to measure the success of channel programs. Collaborate with marketing, sales, channel managers, operations, finance, and technical teams at all levels within the company to help identify, design, and implement business processes necessary to implement a successful industry verticals partner program. Your background 6+ years of related channel programs or channel marketing/sales experience with industry vertical market expertise in either Public Sector, Healthcare/Life Sciences, Financial Services, etc. BA/BS degree in Marketing, Business, Finance or equivalent experience preferred. A solid understanding of Channel Partner business models and what roles Partners can play to help solution, sell, and add services with software and SaaS products. Proven leadership in a global software or cloud organization. The ability to plan, design, and execute a portfolio of programs for external Channel Partners using requirements and rewards to drive a motivational behavior aligned to Atlassian's Channel strategy. Excellent communication, organizational, financial/analytical and interpersonal skills working with executive leadership internally and with channel partners. The role requires a proven track record in messaging/positioning, program management, and broad execution capabilities. A requirement is to motivate, leverage, and manage internal teams on a project basis in order to accomplish the program strategy. Experience driving business plans, financial models, and data & analytics to justify programs and roadmap. Partner communications experience through partner portals, social, email, etc. A desire to communicate through dashboards, reports, and charts to communicate and inform your team on progress of initiatives. A track record of success leading channel programs and teams, but also are open to learning how to be successful in Atlassian’s unique business model. This position is within the Global Channels organization reporting to the Head of Global Partner Programs Strategy and will work closely with various teams across Atlassian. The channel team is a fun and high-energy group tasked to build programs to attract, activate, and go-to-market with partners (Solution Partners, Integrators, Aggregators, Services Partners, Technology Partners & Resellers) representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. Working with over 700 global channel partners we must ensure our programs support a variety of businesses. We are a critical part of Atlassian's broader field operations group, which has a unique approach to delivering value to our customers. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Are you passionate about collaborating with others, and helping teams work together more effectively? Atlassian partners with the top technology companies to improve teamwork through rich, integrated partnerships. The Atlassian Marketplace is one of the largest B2B app stores globally and has exceeded $2B in lifetime sales since launching in 2012. You'll join our Partnerships Growth team. This team works to grow our partnerships and integrations between Atlassian products and important services such as AWS, Slack, Zoom, Google, Microsoft, and some of our new Partners. You'll play an important role in Atlassian's future success. As the Partner Success Manager, you will report to the Head of Partner Growth and you will develop the roadmap of programs and guides to accelerate the growth of Atlassian Marketplace and Platform Partners. You will collaborate with Marketing, Product Management, Strategy teams, R&D, IT, Sales, Finance, and Legal teams across the Americas, Asia Pacific, and Europe to support a global community of Atlassian Partners. What You'll Do Platform partner onboarding and success: Collaborate with teams across the Partnerships business to define how we should prioritize and onboard new Platform Partners, and ensure they achieve commercial success with Atlassian. Improve our partner marketing operations: Collaborate with Partner Marketing teams to develop a world class-campaign operations approach, responsible for driving new growth with some of our most strategic partners. Playbook creation and evolution: Develop repeatable processes and playbooks to help our teams' efficiency and allow us to support and help more partners find success with Atlassian. Dashboard / information sharing: Develop dashboards (working with our Data Science teams) and other information sharing opportunities to ensure teams' success in meeting defined goals. Identify gaps in our tools to support partners: Building out the framework for how our partners engage with Atlassian (e.g. SFDC, Partner portal, dashboards, etc.) and the work involved to ensure partners have access to those tools. Prepare regular reports of progress and forecasts to all partners and internal teams. Summarize feedback from partners to identify process gaps and optimization opportunities. Be the voice of the partner to our teams — translate their needs and advocate on their behalf. Pitch in however you can when needed. We're a lean team; when things break you'll be an important player in diagnosis, resolution, and long-term solution creation. Your Background 3+ years of related SaaS partnerships, projects and operations experience. 8+ years total work experience. Experience in Business Operations, Consulting, Project Management, or similar. Set direction with partners, align work efforts, and ensure outstanding execution. You engage with the Partner community, ranging from people who execute processes daily to executive management. Strong written and verbal, in-person and remote skills. An understanding of solution design. You aim to keep processes as simple as possible while delivering our goals and keeping long-term scalability in mind. Scaled a team's operations through the use of business cases, documented operating procedures, and automation. Comfort with accountability and moving fast. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Role In this role as a Principal Enterprise Architect, you will be working across the Data and Cloud Infrastructure (DCI) organization which serves the following mission-critical functions for the whole company Core Infrastructure served as PaaS on top of AWS (Compute, Network, Storage) Development Lifecycle tooling and frameworks: from local dev to CI/CD to production deployments Production Management tooling, including Observability, Incident Management etc Production engineering in the form of dedicated SRE as well as CRE Analytical Data Platform which includes data lake, data ingestion/modeling/transformation tooling and frameworks as well as the query layer Platforms for specific use cases: Machine Learning & AI, Measurement & Experimentation, Metrics Dashboards and Insights (Reliability, Cost of Capacity, S&C, Developer Productivity scorecards) As an architect of a large organization, you will be providing strategic guidance to various DCI domain areas and driving improvements across all our pillars: Developer Velocity, Reliability & Performance, Efficiency, Data Operability & Enablement. In This Role, You’ll Be Responsible For defining multi-region story container deployment/orchestration & routing evolution, service portability and workload placement rules etc. driving Infrastructure security & compliance Evolving Atlassian's outage mitigation and root causing practices, anomaly detection and fault tolerance aids to the industry-leading standards On your first day, we’ll expect you to have: Strong technical expertise and 15+ years of experience in designing/building Compute & Network PaaS solutions, preferably on top of cloud IaaSFluency in the current service mesh, container orchestration, observability landscape Passion for software engineering excellence (design principles and patterns, unit testing, fault tolerance practices, performance engineering, best practices for security and privacy etc) Passion and aptitude for recognizing, raising, and reconciling gaps and redundant efforts across organizations Excellent collaboration, communication and leadership skills. Ability to get engineers to follow their lead as well as mentor/coach High level of energy and a desire to thrive in a large, fast-paced organization; ability to balance multiple projects under pressure It’s Great, But Not Required If You Have In-depth knowledge of AWS account management, networking, container orchestration, fault tolerance tools etc is super useful for this role but not necessary 10+ years of industry experience Experience building service mesh, container orchestration and observability solutions is a plus Neutral to startup experience - all depends on the personality Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Principal Backend Software Engineer, Event Platform
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. To help our teams work together effectively, this role requires you to be able to work a schedule that is centered around the Pacific Timezone (PST). The Event Platform team is an important part of Atlassian's success. We are the 4th most used service at Atlassian and we're on the mission to address all streaming (pub-sub) needs at Atlassian. We are a team that is passionate about technology but also knows when to take a break from work! Team lunches and social events together are a regular thing among the team versus a once in awhile activity. We embody the Atlassian values : growing and adapting to new technical challenges that might come up, asking hard questions when things don't go well and learning from our mistakes, and challenging each other to constantly improve our work. What You'll Do Build services from the ground up - from gathering requirements to operations Design reliable low latency platform services Work on projects that impact multiple teams and require working with departments outside of engineering Set engineering standards Mentor and lead other engineers Become known as a subject matter expert across the company concerning Event Platform Be involved with daily tasks (EG coding) as much as those that span multi-quarter or multi-year Lead operational and on-call fires when they occur Your Background 10 or more years of experience building backend systems Bachelor's degree with a preference for Computer Science degree Expertise in any modern object-oriented programming language (e.g., Java, Scala, Python, Javascript, etc.) Built scalable and performant RESTful micro-services on-top of a public cloud (AWS is ideal) Knowledge of continuous delivery and infrastructure as code Experience in operations and being on-call Familiar with agile software development methodologies (e.g., XP, scrum) Participated in company wide or industry events as a speaker Worked with partners in non-engineering functions to lead customer success Defined OKRs in connection to company plans Planned and estimated scope for multi-quarter technical projects Established architectural designs that impact and span multiple systems Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Principal Backend Software Engineer, Event Platform
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. To help our teams work together effectively, this role requires you to be able to work a schedule that is centered around the Pacific Timezone (PST). The Event Platform team is an important part of Atlassian's success. We are the 4th most used service at Atlassian and we're on the mission to address all streaming (pub-sub) needs at Atlassian. We are a team that is passionate about technology but also knows when to take a break from work! Team lunches and social events together are a regular thing among the team versus a once in awhile activity. We embody the Atlassian values : growing and adapting to new technical challenges that might come up, asking hard questions when things don't go well and learning from our mistakes, and challenging each other to constantly improve our work. What You'll Do Build services from the ground up - from gathering requirements to operations Design reliable low latency platform services Work on projects that impact multiple teams and require working with departments outside of engineering Set engineering standards Mentor and lead other engineers Become known as a subject matter expert across the company concerning Event Platform Be involved with daily tasks (EG coding) as much as those that span multi-quarter or multi-year Lead operational and on-call fires when they occur Your Background 10 or more years of experience building backend systems Bachelor's degree with a preference for Computer Science degree Expertise in any modern object-oriented programming language (e.g., Java, Scala, Python, Javascript, etc.) Built scalable and performant RESTful micro-services on-top of a public cloud (AWS is ideal) Knowledge of continuous delivery and infrastructure as code Experience in operations and being on-call Familiar with agile software development methodologies (e.g., XP, scrum) Participated in company wide or industry events as a speaker Worked with partners in non-engineering functions to lead customer success Defined OKRs in connection to company plans Planned and estimated scope for multi-quarter technical projects Established architectural designs that impact and span multiple systems Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. We're looking for our next amazing Business Objective Manager [BOM] to help us achieve scalable transformation for our Customer Support Services [CSS] organization. As part of the CSS Business Transformation Team, the BOM is critical for us to deliver scale to our business through our tooling. We need someone who is BOLD and wants to make a real difference. Are you passionate about strategic problem solving and driving a cross-functional team to deliver success? Then we need you! In this role, you'll be responsible for driving strategic thinking across the tooling portfolio to elevate and improve the scale of our global support operations business. You'll work closely with business analysts, program managers, operation managers, and developers in a cross-functional team. Your role will be to drive the strategy towards a measurable goal, helping the team to have a clear picture of where we are and where we are going. You will drive strategic results for key Atlassian business needs and be able to see a tangible impact on our internal and external customers upon successful completion. More About You You value high-quality work with attention to detail and have a track record of delivering both. You combine curiosity, judgment, humility, and drive, and like asking "why" to unravel a seemingly complex problem and get to the root cause. You engender a collaborative environment where teams work together to solve problems with a positive outlook. When you encounter a problem, you come up with multiple solutions, weigh the tradeoffs and efforts, identify the best path forward, and exercise good judgment to drive ahead. You have experience in organizational change and turning information and questions into action. You're effectively interacting with people across all levels of an organization and can field questions during a presentation like a pro. You learn quickly to be impactful in new areas to keep pace with our rapid growth and evolution. You can take an ambiguous assignment and deliver value quickly. You employ multiple tools, methods, and techniques to get things done. What You Are Accountable For Define tooling objectives and key results. Develop investment strategies to scale our tooling ecosystem. Build a 1-3 year roadmap that supports us successfully meeting the fiscal year key result expectations. Conduct regular portfolio reviews with key stakeholders and leadership. Advise the program management team on the right solutions for the right results. Drive our tooling strategy to new levels by continuous ideation and process improvement. Interface with other teams at Atlassian who are leading changes in the business, with the intent of understanding how our CSS organization should incorporate or influence. Influence our CSS leadership team with strategic initiatives informed by both internal and external inputs. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 10+ years of relevant professional experience in product management, strategy management, program management or business analysis. Experience building a program from scratch, developing a strategy informed by research. Demonstrated ability to move ideas into concrete tactics, including anticipating challenges and helping programs get unblocked. It's great, but not required, to have experience working in a dynamic software company with operations and support teams located in different geographies. More About Our Team We are a growing operations enablement team located in multiple regions across the globe. We challenge each other constantly to improve our work and ask hard questions. We're direct, focused, and demand excellence, but there's laughter in every meeting because we thoroughly enjoy the work we do and the impact it has. We're constantly growing, learning, adapting, and trying new approaches. BBQ, tacos, and coffee are a few of our favorite things! Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Atlassian is looking for a PrincipalData Engineer to join our Customer Success and Support (CSS) Data Engineering team and build world-class data solutions and applications that power crucial decisions throughout the organization. We are looking for someone who is passionate about building data services that scale. On your first day, we'll expect you to have BS/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Management, or other technical fields, and 15 or more years of data engineering experience Experience leading ambiguous and complex data engineering projects. High proficiency in technical skills such as SQL, ETL, and Scripting/Programming to solve a wide array of data challenges Experience working with varied forms of data infrastructure, including relational databases (e.g. SQL), Spark, and column stores (e.g. Redshift) Experience building scalable data pipelines using Spark using Airflow scheduler/executor framework or similar scheduling tools. Experience working in a technical environment with the latest technologies like AWS data services (Redshift, Athena, EMR) or similar Apache projects (Spark, Flink, Hive, or Kafka). Understanding of Data Engineering tools/frameworks and standards to improve the productivity and quality of output for Data Engineers across the team. Industry experience working with large-scale, high-performance data processing systems (batch and streaming) with a "Streaming First" mindset to drive Atlassian's business growth and improve the product experience. We'd be super excited if you have Built and designed Kappa or Lambda architecture data platforms and services. Experience implementing Master Data Management (MDM) solutions. Built pipelines using Databricks and is well versed with their APIs. Above all else, as a Principal Data Engineer, you will own large programs end to end, driving architectural decisions, and incorporating business and technology strategies. You will mentor junior members of the team and help onboard and grow the team. Your Future Team Data is a BIG deal at Atlassian. We ingest over 180 billion events each month into our analytics platform and we have dozens of teams across the company driving their decisions and guiding their operations based on the data and services we provide. The data engineering team manages several data models and data pipelines across Atlassian, including finance, growth, product analysis, customer support, sales, and marketing. You'll join a team that is smart and very direct. We ask hard questions and challenge each other to constantly improve our work. As a Principal Data Engineer, you will directly report to the Data Engineering Manager who manages CSS Data Engineering. You will apply your technical expertise to build analytical data models that support a broad range of analytical requirements across the company. You will help optimize the data pipelines/infrastructure with the goal of providing data with quality and trust. As the data domain expert, you will partner with our technology teams, analytical teams, and data scientists across several projects. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Your future team Atlassian is looking for experienced architects and principal engineers to join our Enterprise team. This role involves the design, implementation, and operations of the services to strengthen the enterprise readiness of our cloud. Be a part of a dynamic team that delivers incredible, creative improvements to our products. As part of this role you will work on Policy Platform comprised of people with backgrounds in delivering high quality products such as other architects, product managers and multiple engineering teams. We make platform for policies to accomplish unified controls framework which will Atlassian achieve multiple compliances and give our customer more controls. What you'll do Architecting, designing and building large-scale distributed systems. Work with managers to define overall team's strategic vision and architecture, such as incubation roadmap and technology solution. Build MVP to demonstrate technology in action. Determine how to best deploy and operationalized selected technologies at scale. Work with cross functional teams to deploy solutions and bring stakeholders up to speed. Create comprehensive onboarding documents and tools for onboarding internal engineering teams on policy platform. Mentor more senior engineers. Your background 10+ years of experience in building software with at least 4+ years of experience in creating and implementing high throughout micro-services. Designed wide-scale distributed systems. Bachelor's degree in Engineering, computer science or equivalent. Fluency in any modern object-oriented programming language (e.g., Java, Scala, Python, Go, etc.) and in architecture patterns for distributed systems. Broad knowledge and understanding of SaaS, PaaS, IaaS with hands-on experience of one or more public cloud offerings (AWS, GAE, Oracle, Azure) Experience working with cloud-scale messaging, streaming, or storage systems. It's great, but not required if you have Understanding of regulated industries and compliance requirements of HIPPA and FedRAMP. Experience in enterprise security and identity management. Experience with Open Policy Agent. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. With the 2019 Federal Cloud Computing Strategy accelerating the adoption of the cloud in Federal agencies and Atlassian being a cloud-first company, we want all of our cloud products to meet the requirements of the public sector and all regulated industry customers. As we continue to embark on this journey, we are seeking passionate and innovative engineers to join the Enterprise Trust Foundations: Regulated Industries team and help us realize this vision. Your role in this team would be to understand our SaaS platform from every angle and redesign & develop our architecture to achieve and maintain compliance requirements globally. In This Role, You'll Get To Build solutions to achieve and maintain compliance standards such as SOC2, HIPAA, FedRAMP, C5, etc. across the Atlassian SaaS platform Be the authoritative source to the rest of Atlassian Engineering on compliance technical requirements Partner with several stakeholders across Atlassian, including product and infrastructure engineering, product security, risk and compliance, and other go-to-market functions Regularly tackle the largest and most complex problems on the team, from technical design to launch Determine plans of attack on large projects Be a champion across the team for continually raising the technical bar and evangelizing a high technical standard Transfer your depth of knowledge and share best engineering practices to improve engineering excellence Mentor more junior members On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 8+ years of experience building software, with at least 2+ years of experience in crafting and implementing high-performance RESTful micro-services. 5+ years experience with Amazon Web Services (or any other public cloud). Experience with implementing compliance requirements in a modern SaaS environment. Expertise in FedRAMP, NIST 800-53 compliance frameworks is strongly preferred. Fluency in modern object-oriented programming language(s) such as Java, Kotlin, etc. Solid understanding of designing and building distributed systems. Experience with leading projects which cut across multiple teams. Hands-on experience with CI/CD and deploying services to a production environment. Broad knowledge and understanding of SaaS, PaaS, and IaaS with hands-on experience with AWS. A real passion for and experience with cross-team collaboration with strong interpersonal skills. Experience in operational requirements and common challenges of cloud-based systems. Adept at working with minimal guidance and working with remote teams (peers, or customers). Experience working with agile software development methodologies (e.g., XP, scrum). Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent. It's Great, But Not Required If You Have Expertise in HIPAA, C5, and other compliance and regulatory frameworks Bitbucket, Bamboo, and Spinnaker experience Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Principal Partner Solutions Strategist - Cloud Migrations
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Your future team At Atlassian, we are on a mission to help our customers compete and win in the modern, digital economy. We have built a multi-billion-dollar, fast-growing software business with over 200,000 paying customers, and millions of users around the globe. Cloud Migrations is Atlassian's top goal. We are committed to helping our valuable customers complete the migrations of the Atlassian products from on-premise environment to Atlassian Cloud. These are complex projects that need discovery, planning, preparation, and testing before taking up the production migrations. Our Partners help our customers move to Cloud. We are looking for an experienced Principal Partner Solutions Strategist - Cloud Migrations for an important role within our Partner Solutions Acceleration team. You will guide our Global Cloud Migrations Partner Solutions strategy, capability and channel development. By taking a global macro view, you will establish a plan to guide partner capability, and lead expansion of the partner community. You will collaborate with the Cloud migration managers, Channel business development and Partner managers, Marketing, Sales, Technical Architects and play an important part in a global team dedicated to ensuring the success of partners in their Cloud migration practice. There is simply not a more exciting and impactful cloud migration practice building opportunity anywhere. Is this the opportunity for you? What you'll do Establish a global capability and enablement strategy in collaboration with Regional Solution Strategists, Customer support, Customer Advisory, Channel, Programs Sales and Marketing team to grow and accelerate cloud migration capability in our partner eco-system. Provide guidance and work with Atlassian partners to create packaged implementation Cloud migration. services, solutions and GTM strategy. Conduct Cloud migration capability and enablement workshops with partners. Lead Global channel efforts focused on Cloud migration market success. Assess channel coverage, partner capacity and recruitment requirements for Cloud migrations across a range of different partnership models. Partner with Enterprise Sales on educating them on partner capabilities and optimizing the co-selling motion. Align and collaborate with team members in the Customer Support, Customer Success, Channel and Sales organization to achieve results. Collaborate across Atlassian to build and deliver a coordinated capability model. Your background You will have 10+ years of product, consulting and sales experience within Digital Transformation and Cloud migrations engagements. A history of working in matrix organization where internal/external bridge-building and partnering is an essential quality. Good to have experience working with Partners. Excellent business insight with outcome-driven approach! Understanding of how to position and sell value, calculate return on investment, and consultative selling. Feel comfortable conducting workshops and working with technology teams. While proficient, you strive to be the very best. Your ego is fully in-check. You will focus and guide Cloud migrations channel and experienced programs, but also keep an eye on the business as a whole. You bring a record of meeting performance metrics - both sales and non-revenue targets. An extreme sense of responsibility and accountability. We have goals and need you to help us accomplish them. According to Atlassian policy, you must be fully vaccinated and submit proof of their vaccinated status to assume this role, subject to legal exemptions. You must provide proof of their vaccinated status within 30 days of their start date. Please reach out to your recruiter if you have questions about this requirement or if you'd like to submit a request for an exemption before the start of your employment. About The Team The Partner Solutions Acceleration Team is part of the Customer Success & Innovation (CSI) team with the objective of accelerating Channel by enabling and collaborating with partners to build, market, sell and implement our market leading Scaled agile and Devops, workplace management and ITSM solutions. This is a specialist team with deep industry and technology solutions expertise, and are responsible for Channel driven specialist business. We are doubling down on building out this high-impact team as a compliment to our Channel Organisation - all in synergy with our uniquely-powerful, low-friction flywheel that adds thousands of new customers per quarter! Above all, we believe in the Atlassian values and use them as our compass in constantly refining and enabling our Channel model, one that is redefining how channel can help and accelerate our customers adoption through solutions based approach using our software. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Your future team The Enterprise Trust team helps our largest and most complex customers confidently adopt Atlassian by building the Enterprise-grade platform which underpins all of Atlassian's products. We're hiring a Principal Product Manager, reporting to the Senior Group Product Manager, Enterprise Trust Foundations. You are an experienced Product Manager with a strong technical background in building SaaS (Software as a Service) for businesses. What you'll do Develop the vision, strategy and roadmap for how we protect customers' most precious data Own the scope, rollout and roadmap for our in-development Bring Your Own Key (BYOK) encryption capability across Atlassian's customers, dozens of products, thousands of micro-services Work across the strategy, security, compliance, cloud infrastructure and product teams and with dedicated engineering teams, program management and designers Collaborate with our ecosystem team to enable encryption in the marketplace apps our customers rely on. Deeply understand the encryption/ data protection landscape Your background 7+ years as a Product Manager or in an equivalent leadership position Strong technical background, comfortable understanding/ sparring/ challenging technical approaches with experienced architects and senior engineering leadership, as well as with customers Worked on B2B SaaS - ideally in a role connected with security, compliance, encryption Experience building product for large, complex enterprises, balancing competing needs across customers Worked in a platform company, on platform initiatives, ideally in a shared tenant cloud environment A proven track record for defining, building and delivering high impact products that create real business and customer value in fast-growth or large-scale companies Strong influencing skills that help you to communicate and manage relationships across the organization - from customers, developers, to senior executives. Able to understand sophisticated problems. You gather, prioritize and translate customer and business requirements into successful product strategies Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more.
