jobTitle: Principal Site Reliability Engineer, Production Engineering
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. We are looking for a reliability expert who is passionate about scaling Cloud services to join our growing MTV office. An ideal candidate is someone who is eager to learn new things, aware of current industry trends (particularly those related to reliability) and who loves to share their knowledge with others. Someone who thrives on working with a diverse set of partners, who can articulate the business impact of a problem and can also dive deep into the technical solution. We'd love it if you brought a deep understanding of modern Cloud infrastructure, programming expertise, operational experience and a desire to change the status quo. We'll support you with robust backend systems, mature processes, and a motivated team with a strong desire to not f*** the customer. We're looking for an engineer who can analyze and help improve our services and processes to get us to an even higher level of reliability, performance, scalability, and cost efficiency. You'll achieve this by crossing team and functional boundaries to advocate for reliability methodologies and will work with a variety of platform, product and SRE teams to both build reliability into our platform and drive adoption of those practices into our products. In other words, you'll be the driving force for change! This is an amazing opportunity for you to impact a broad number of Atlassian teams and services. If you crave variety, love building relationships with people and have a burning desire to make a difference, then this is the role for you! On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Expertise with software development in languages like Java, Go and Python. Strong organizational and interpersonal skills, with experience developing and instilling a culture of operational maturity. Experience driving large, complex, cross-organizational initiatives from inception to completion. Hands on experience with public cloud offerings (AWS components like EC2, CloudFormation, IAM, RDS, S3, DynamoDB, Kinesis - or equivalents, e.g. in GCP) Experience operating high-availability, fault-tolerant, scalable, distributed software in production: building monitoring into your code, tweaking dashboards, defining alerts, writing run books, etc... It would be great, but not mandatory, if you had: An ability and desire to mentor and coach engineers. Working knowledge of datastores (RDBMS, time-series-database, NoSql, search, analytics). Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Atlassian is looking for an experienced Principal Software Engineer to join our Technology Innovation team. This is a role for developers who have a thirst for trying out new technologies, programming languages, frameworks and applications and working on greenfield project to solve interesting problems. If you’re a software developer who naturally leans towards being a generalist or ‘jack of all trades’, this may be a rare opportunity to leverage your talents to their absolute fullest. For the role, you’ll be tasked with delivering innovative solutions that not only delight internal customers but also improve the products we sell to our end customers. About The Team The Technology Innovation team is an internal incubator within Atlassian. The team researches emerging technologies (think VR, blockchain, AI and automation to name a few) to deliver new internal product ideas and solutions that help Atlassian achieve their goals. This is an exciting time to join the Team and help us scale what was just an idea in the recent past! Does this sound exciting to you? You might be the person we’re looking for! Key Responsibilities Define and drive the overall team’s strategic vision and architecture, such as incubation roadmap and technology selection Support business and technology innovation that drives the organization's top and bottom lines Evaluate a myriad of different technologies (SaaS, open source, custom builds, and hybrids of the preceding) against real world business problems faced by multiple teams Build MVP to demonstrate technology in action Determine how to best deploy and operationalize selected technologies at scale Work with cross-functional teams to deploy solutions and bring stakeholders up to speed Build out deployment pipelines (CI/CD) and integrations to SaaS platforms Regularly work with different technologies with which you may be completely unfamiliar with Participate in mock RFPs to evaluate new Atlassian products and features Develop solutions that extend Atlassian products through marketplace apps, forge plugins or via 2nd/3rd party integrations Required Qualifications 8+ years of software development experience Proficiency in Java, Python and SQL Strong microservice knowledge using Springboot (cloud stack), REST Standards Have expertise in large distributed systems, legacy experience is considered an asset Hands-on experience with public cloud offerings (e.g., AWS, GCS, Azure) Familiarity with the Atlassian Product portfolio Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written skills and the ability to interact with all level of stakeholders, support personnel, and clients Strong documentation, analytical and problem-solving skills CI/CD knowledge and able to configure the same A mindset for innovation and taking calculated risks Experience leading large-scale transformation projects and implementations Experience with designing and developing digital solutions architectures that support business requirements Knowledge of existing, new, and emerging technologies and being able to apply them to new business designs and business models It’s Awesome, But Not Required To Have Used Bamboo, Jira & Confluence A strong DevOps background Exposure to Docker and Kubernetes Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Principal Technical Program Manager - Disaster Recovery
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian's mission of "Unleash the potential of every team" is the guiding light behind everything we do. We have developed well-known products (Jira, Confluence, Trello etc …), that fit in the fabric of teamwork across different types of teams, and the processes to help every team succeed. Our Team Playbook includes some of the best practices to maximize the potential of every team and is used by our customers as well as those who have never used Atlassian products. We're growing our Engineering Program Management team within our Engineering org. The mission of our team is to work across Engineering to drive the execution of Cloud Engineering's technical strategy, with greater velocity, and more predictable outcomes for our customers. This team will work closely with the engineering leadership team to ensure that strategic technical initiatives are successful and standards are derived from those initiatives to help the company scale. The members of the organization will be key participants in influencing the technical strategy and aligning it with the business objectives and delivering outcomes towards those objectives and strategy. You will have the opportunity to shape a modern technical program management organization. The goal will be to steer the organization through growth and improve the velocity in the journey towards our long-term goals. It is easy to ensure alignment by applying brakes and slowing down and you will be expected to find ways to align while accelerating. The role offers a unique challenge of finding alignment by creating guardrails and removing barriers to make our teams go even faster. As a cloud service provider, we build resilience into our systems to ensure service and data availability for our customers in the event of failures in system components. However, even the best systems have to have a disaster recovery plan. This role will serve as a single-point technical owner for disaster recovery processes, tools and technology within the company. The role owns definition of disaster scenarios and corresponding recovery point objectives. The role collaborates with functions across the company to create reliable and cost-effective disaster recovery solutions for all of our cloud products. Successful candidates will have a solid track record of program, project and product management and will have demonstrated excellent leadership, along with superior organizational and communication skills in leading teams and programs to deliver successful outcomes. In addition, the right candidate will possess learning agility to learn and understand business strategy, product direction and technical architecture, so they can make decisions to accelerate initiatives at any level of depth. Minimum Qualifications BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience 5+ years of leadership experience on software teams as a development manager or TPM Excellent written and oral communication skills Experience product managing infrastructure products Experience with multi-tenant SaaS on public cloud using AWS Experience with business disaster or related business continuity governance Experience leading projects spanning multiple teams, covering all of the following - Developing company-level engineering roadmaps - Accountable for creating and driving company-wide disaster recovery metrics & standards - Building and maintaining disaster recovery operational processes - Making critical and timely decisions to keep programs on track - Tracking and managing enterprise risks - Communication to stakeholders Experience operating a large fleet of cloud resources Experience with agile software development processes Preferred Qualifications Ability to exercise technical judgment in solving software engineering challenges. Experience in software development in one or more general-purpose programming languages Experience with agile processes Experience building tools, dashboards and automation to increase transparency and reduce toil Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. About Atlassian The world’s best teams work better together with Atlassian. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team . We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. We're looking for a talented Privacy & Product Counsel to join our dynamic and collaborative legal team at Atlassian! You’ll be joining a growing team of legal professionals helping build products, tools, and programs that put fundamental rights first, build employee and customer trust, and lead our industry on accessibility, inclusion, privacy, and social impact. Like our customers, we use Atlassian products to collaborate asynchronously with global teams. We believe in open work, leading with kindness and empathy, and delivering thought leadership beyond what’s required for “minimum legal compliance”. It helps to bring a growth mindset, a desire to use and understand our products, intellectual curiosity, and a thirst for innovation! In This Role, You'll Get To Support our Accessibility, Research, and People Teams to help achieve Atlassian’s goal of $10 billion in annual revenue and 25,000 Atlassians over the coming years Partner with our Accessibility Team on initiatives to make the future of work inclusive and develop an industry-leading accessibility program at Atlassian, such as advising on building accessible websites and products Collaborate with our Research Team to build tools and processes that unlock valuable insights around what our customers need from our products Strengthen Atlassian’s trust story as an employer by up-leveling our workforce privacy program and supporting initiatives to build a diverse TEAM Creatively build upon and drive awareness around privacy and data protection issues, including developing and delivering training materials Engage with the legal community and partner with senior leadership to understand evolving issues, develop strategy, and help Atlassian provide industry-leading privacy, accessibility, and research programs for our customers and colleagues More About You You have a solid understanding of global laws and policy frameworks relating to data protection and Accessibility You’re passionate about inclusion, privacy, and data protection issues that our workforce and users care about You think creatively beyond the “legal” box to offer solutions, clearly articulating ethical, business-minded, and risk-based recommendations You take initiative to learn new laws, technologies, and business strategies You effectively navigate a decentralized and complex organization spread across the globe You build relationships which strengthen the connection between legal and partner teams On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Necessary qualifications to practice law in your local jurisdiction 3+ years practicing law Experience advising on accessibility regulations (e.g., ADA, DDA, US Section 508, EN 301 549) Knowledge of current trends in litigation pertaining to accessibility and hot topics (e.g., web overlays) Practical experience and deep understanding of applicable privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA/CPRA) Passion to understand our workforce, customers, products, culture, and business model A knack for distilling complex legal concepts into clear language that fits the audience Excellent judgment, intellectual curiosity, and a moral compass that takes your understanding, work product, and client relationships to the next level A proactive and curious mindset, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, and remote-friendly workplace CIPP certification Experience handling research and workforce privacy issues is a plus Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Privacy and Product Counsel - GTM & Trust
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. We're looking for a talented Privacy & Product Counsel: GTM Strategy and Customer Trust to join our dynamic and collaborative legal team at Atlassian! In this role you will have the opportunity to strategically guide Atlassian in protecting and strengthening its number one asset: Customer Trust - and on Day 1 - use your experience to have tangible impact on Atlassian’s enterprise cloud go-to-market strategy. In This Role, You'll Get To Become a member of our growing team of individuals supporting atlassian’s go-to-market and trust work within our department Design scalable processes for implementation Identify enablement opportunities to educate go-to-market and commercial teams, reducing escalations to Privacy Provide guidance on compliance with global privacy and data security laws, regulations and industry standards. We’re not looking for an academic analysis! Partner with the business (engineering, product, sales, etc.) on global privacy related initiatives Support efforts to build trustworthy, data privacy-conscious products our customers love Engage with the privacy legal community to understand evolving issues and to help Atlassian provide an industry-leading privacy program for our customers and stakeholders More About You You strive to be both a trusted business advisor as well as a privacy subject matter expert because of your strategic, practical approach No egos here! You take ownership, roll up your sleeves, and can get things done as part of a lean and growing Privacy team You're a fan of SaaS and cloud services and are aware of industry trends Bringing innovative technology products to the market excites you, and you can develop the technical fluency to confidently and effectively advocate for and explain Atlassian’s privacy positions and business value proposition to customers You’re keenly aware of product, privacy and data protection issues that our customers are likely focused on when considering or using our products - and are eager to develop customer enablement materials to make our customers' legal and compliance teams' jobs easier You bring empathy and understanding to your conversations with customers, seeking to find a path forward that balances company risk and customer needs You effectively navigate a decentralized and complex organization spread across the globe You invest in building relationships within the Privacy team, and are excited to contribute to a positive and inclusive team ethos You can ruthlessly prioritize based on business criticality, and communicate or set expectations with other stakeholders respectfully You are a good storyteller and coach, and effectively communicate with the business and customers to help them understand nuanced legal positions and recommended risk mitigation strategies On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Qualified to practice law in your local jurisdiction 5-7 + years practicing law Extensive enterprise and B2B SaaS and cloud services industry experience Passion to understand our customers, products, culture, and business model Deep knowledge of US and European data protection law, and a willingness to invest time in deepening your subject matter expertise in other markets Ability to quickly learn new business and technology concepts A growth mindset Availability and willingness to support customer-facing teams in APAC and the United States; ideally based in the West Coast Time Zone Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Your future team Atlassian is looking for Product Design Interns to join our growing Design teams in Australia, India and the US. Join Atlassian as an intern and spend your internship having an impact on how millions of users collaborate and use software. The most amazing thinkers—like NASA rocket scientists and Tesla engineers—are coming to us for solutions. We're in the business of developing software to help teams everywhere get amazing ideas on the ground and into the world. Sound like an exciting place to start your career? Here you'll be encouraged to use your imagination and try new things. You'll join a team that is smart and very direct. We challenge each other to improve our work, learn, and ask hard questions. We're dedicated to Agile methodology and are big believers in 'lean' (which means we don't do documentation for documentation's sake). We know the importance of validating assumptions about users and use several types of testing to figure out whether we're right (or wrong). Our bottom line is improving our user's experience—no matter what. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1/OPT, J-1/TN, or H-1B student graduates at this time. What you'll do Gain valuable exposure to the design and product development process. Be mentored by our experienced designers in shaping your internship outcomes. Experience Atlassian's culture through our many companywide and cross-regional programs. Your background Be able to commit to a full-time (40hrs / week) internship from May 2023 until August 2023 or June 2023 until September 2023 Be currently enrolled in a full-time Bachelors, Masters program and graduating between December 2023 and June 2024 Experience with user-focused design Demonstrate the ability to plan while juggling multiple simultaneous projects Experience collaborating with team members, like engineers and product managers, and other designers Please note: At this time, this role is only open to entry-level candidates with less than a year of professional experience (this does not include internships/co-ops) Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Product Designer, Confluence Content Engagement (West Coast Remote)
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Confluence is your remote-friendly team workspace where knowledge and collaboration meet. Create, collaborate, and organize all your work in one place. Confluence is built for teams that need a secure and reliable way to manage knowledge and collaborate on mission-critical projects. About The Role We are looking for a Product Designer to join the Confluence team, focusing on experiences across Confluence. This individual will work closely with our content creation team to design and build features that enhance customers ability to create, collaborate, and comment on pages. As a Product Designer on Confluence, you will be part of the content engagement team whose charter is to become the indispensable knowledge and collaborative workspace, for every team within an organization. In This Role, You'll Get To Work closely with designers, product managers, engineering, and other cross-functional partners to define product strategy and champion elegant user experiences in our product. Facilitate workshops with designers, engineers and product managers to establish project scope and explore a breadth of potential solutions Drive design thinking and lead design work across key Confluence experiences. Flex your storytelling and collaboration muscles, working as a part of a collaborative team Help your team plan, prepare and in some situations conduct exploratory user research Establish design principles that will serve as guardrails for end to end thinking Influence and shape the way our Confluence design team works and how we balance shipping with high-quality experiences. Engage with Atlassian's close-knit design community. Collaborate with both Confluence designers and platform designers to help improve your designs and also to socialize your work with other teams. Your Background 3-5 years of hands-on professional experience as a UX or Product Designer. A track record of delivering outcomes where you've contributed to the success of a product. Ability to build consensus with cross functional peers, key partners and executives across a business to influence a result. Achieved a proficiency in your craft, validated through conceptual thinking & modeling, user-centeredness and analysis, and an understanding of technical & product knowledge. Strong facilitation and collaboration abilities, a flexible and friendly approach to working with teams, and the attitude to always strive for the best outcomes. Strong executional skills and familiarity with tools such as Figma. The Ideal Candidate Will Bring A portfolio that demonstrates strong user experience and interaction design informed by empathy for the user. Demonstrated love of the open, iterative design process – constantly sketching, showing work in progress, validating with customers and data, iterating, shipping, learning, growing, and shipping customer value some more Facilitation and cross-functional collaboration skills: you can demonstrate the ability to work across multiple teams, solicit and synthesize feedback, and facilitate design discussions It's Great, But Not Required If You Have Have experience working on content creation tools and or applications Experience with SaaS, or complex enterprise applications. If you've used Confluence, Notion, Quip, Wordpress, Coda, in a professional setting. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Trello is used by 100 million people worldwide and is part of Atlassian’s growing suite of products made for everyone from small businesses to established enterprises. We’re building a new team focused on landing new users who want to collaborate in Trello. This team will play a critical role in delivering on our product strategy and company mission to unleash the potential of all teams. You will be given broad autonomy to work with your engineering and product counterparts in crafting new experiences and features aimed at growing the Trello fanbase. This is a great opportunity for designers who love to experiment and work collaboratively to find new opportunities for our customer base. In This Role, You'll Have The Opportunity To Design experiments and validate hypotheses related to teamwork in Trello Contribute to the creation of seamless end-to-end experiences that directly shape the future of Trello Collaborate with Product Management, Engineering, Content Design, Research, Data Science, Marketing, customer-facing teams, and other designers across Atlassian Be a true champion for our users while solving complex problems, with a focus on improving our experience quality On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 3+ years of product design experience Proficiency in designing with tools such as Figma & Mural A flexible and iterative approach to working with teams Excellent knowledge of design systems and modern visual design practices Experience conducting customer research and applying insights to your work The ability to make tradeoffs, solicit feedback, communicate design decisions, and facilitate design discussions More about our team The Trello Customer Experience team’s purpose is to weave the goals of our customers and our business into a seamless experience. We champion experiences that are built for scale while still being designed for humans and loved by teams of all shapes and sizes. We believe that Trello’s uniqueness is our greatest strength. Our Customer Experience team is made up of Content Designers, Product Designers, and User Researchers. More About Our Benefits Whether you work in an office or a distributed team, Atlassian is highly collaborative and yes, fun! To support you at work (and play) we offer some fantastic perks: ample time off to relax and recharge, flexible working options, five paid volunteer days a year for your favorite cause, an annual allowance to support your learning & growth, unique ShipIt days, a company-paid trip after five years and lots more. More about Atlassian Creating software that empowers everyone from small startups to the who’s who of tech is why we’re here. We build tools like Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello to help teams across the world become more forward-thinking, creative, and aligned—collaboration is the heart of every product we dream of at Atlassian. From Amsterdam and Austin to Sydney and San Francisco, we’re looking for people who want to write the future and who believe that we can accomplish so much more together than apart. At Atlassian, we’re committed to an environment where everyone has the autonomy and freedom to thrive, as well as the support of like-minded colleagues who are motivated by a common goal to: Unleash the potential of every team . Additional information We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians are the driver of our success. To make sure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experiences we never discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Learn more about Atlassian’s culture, interviewing flow, and hiring process by checking out our Candidate Resource Hub . Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Trello is used by 100 million people worldwide and is part of Atlassian’s growing suite of products made for everyone from small businesses to established enterprises. Today, most people know and love Trello for its fun and easy-to-use board experience. The team you’ll join is focused on scaling Trello into a tool that’s also known for helping multiple teams in large organizations collaborate better. You will work on critical projects that help shape the end-to-end experience for end users and administrators alike. As a Product Designer for Trello, you’ll have the opportunity to: Improve Trello’s enterprise offering, used and loved in large-scale organizations around the world; Partner closely with our growing design team to shape the way enterprise teams work in Trello; Design experiences that allow enterprise admins to seamlessly manage, collaborate, and adopt Trello across their organizations; Ship meaningful changes to millions of users across the globe; and Leave your mark on a well-loved product. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 3+ years of product design experience, ideally with a focus on enterprise products Proficiency in designing with tools such as Figma & Mural A flexible and friendly approach to working with teams Excellent knowledge of design systems and modern visual design practices Experience conducting customer research and applying insights to your work The ability to make tradeoffs, solicit feedback, communicate design decisions, and facilitate design discussions. Show us something! Along with your resume, send or point us to examples or a portfolio of your work. Ideally, send us work that shows us your experience with products that have shipped to real-world users. Don't forget to include a password if you have one. About The Team As a Product Designer, you’ll be closely partnered with a Product Manager, Engineering Manager, Content Designer, and Lead Product Designer to scope, plan, and execute on the team’s roadmap. In addition to working with your feature team, you’ll be part of the larger Trello Customer Experience team where you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate, solicit critique, and grow alongside other researchers, content designers, and product designers. As a design team, our purpose is to weave the goals of our customers and our business into a seamless Trello experience. We champion experiences that are built for scale while still being designed for humans and loved by teams of all shapes and sizes. We believe that Trello’s uniqueness is our greatest strength. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. We are looking for an enthusiastic product manager to join our Enterprise Agility team, and help us grow product capabilities of Jira Align, our flagship product. If you are passionate about helping companies manage their strategic investments and connect strategy to execution, we look forward to hearing from you. Your future team Our Enterprise Agility product team is comprised of people with backgrounds ranging from accounting to management consulting to customer support to art. We partner with design, engineering, data and research teams to help some of the largest customers of Atlassian gain clarity of insights and improve the efficiency of their strategic initiative investments. You will report to Head of Product, Enterprise Agility. What you'll do Lead the definition of product roadmap as an owner of a product area of our Enterprise Agility team Build capabilities that are loved by Atlassian customers Be a team player who enjoys working on a growing team of product managers, engineers and designers Identify new opportunities for improving the product experience Be a subject matter expert on the product capabilities you own Guide understanding and partnership between your Enterprise Agility team and other teams across Atlassian Work directly with design, engineering, research and marketing to ship high quality products Advocate for our customers and their strategic portfolio planning and value stream management needs Make a large impact across our product family and influence thousands of customers for decades to come Your background 2+ years of product experience with an understanding of cloud software Experience working on growing product teams delivering enterprise software capabilities Clarity of vision for your product area that provides the team with direction and inspiration You can convert opportunities into strategy and build cohesive plans that empower teams to deliver great products Technical know-how to partner with engineering on the roadmap you define You know how to tell a compelling story at the right level to inspire any audience You can encourage your teams to build better products through a constant effort to understand, question, and improve the experiences for our users and quality of our products Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Atlassian is looking for a Product Marketing Manager who understands the transformative role that agility plays in helping the world’s largest companies become more innovative, better places to work. We are looking for a Channel PMM with a penchant for scaling and enabling our channel through the creation of great enablement and marketing deliverables. Your role will be to develop and implement marketing tactics and content that increase awareness and adoption of Atlassian’s Enterprise Agility solutions. About You You have worked at B2B SaaS companies with a high-touch sales model focusing on Enterprise customers You’ve helped build and scale a channel with great marketing You understand the principles of agility-at-scale You’ve been responsible for creating, driving, and managing go-to-market strategies for critical areas of a business You’re collaborative, flexible and, most importantly, don’t get flustered in a fast-paced and often changing environment You love working with channel partners and helping them grow their business You love it when your work moves the needle, closes a deal, or makes an impact on a partner and their customer In This Role, You'll Get To Help support a channel GTM that engages Enterprise organizations with a value prop that has never been more relevant, enterprise agility Partner with design, creative campaigns, content marketing, and our channel teams to create campaigns and programs that support the expansion of the business for Jira Align Help craft the messaging and value pillars for why our enterprise agility solution is significant to our channel partners and their customers Collaborate with Channel Marketing and Channel Management to help identify, design, and implement new co-marketing tactics We'll Expect You To Have 3+ years of related channel marketing and product marketing-related experience The ability to create and tell a story that simplifies complex technology and inspires action Experience designing and building marketing deliverables for SaaS organizations A solid understanding of Channel Partner business models and what roles Partners can play to help solution, sell, and add services with software products Experience driving enablement for field teams Excellent communication, organizational, and interpersonal skills. The role requires a proven track record in messaging/positioning, creating great content and collateral, and engaging directly with Channel Partners to support their marketing efforts Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is looking for a Product Marketing Manager with a penchant for building, scaling, and enabling the channel. Your role will be developing marketing strategies, content, enablement, and programs that increase awareness and adoption of Atlassian’s IT service management (ITSM) solution, Jira Service Management. In this cross-functional role, you will work closely with our channel, product, sales, and marketing teams to deliver go-to-market strategies across our channel and ecosystem partners, such as Solution Partners, ISVs, third-party apps, and GSIs. In This Role, You'll Get To Define, build, and execute marketing, enablement, program, and services strategies across channel, in collaboration with cross-functional team members. Equip partners with messaging, tools, and training to accelerate the enterprise sales process, across pre-sales, technical sales, and technical delivery. Develop and drive creative, yet measurable, co-marketing opportunities, such as thought leadership, product content, case studies, and campaigns, across a variety of channel and ecosystem partners. Be an evangelist for Jira Service Management by delivering trainings, presentations, and webinars both from Atlassian and in concert with partners. Build and nurture relationships with key partners to influence their marketing direction and grow mindshare with their customer-facing teams. Gather industry, market, product, and customer insights to inform our product roadmap, marketing positioning, and campaign development. Who You Are 3-5 years of related channel and product marketing experience in B2B enterprise software. You have a strong technical acumen and can quickly translate complex concepts into easily digestible messages. Passion and subject matter expertise in IT Operations, ITSM, and/or DevOps is recommended. You have experience with driving enablement and co-marketing with partners to reach decision-makers in large-scale enterprises. You’re a compelling writer and presenter and love to tell both written and verbal stories. You’re an effective influencer and enjoy collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive your ideas to execution. You can navigate ambiguity and proactively seek creative approaches for experimentation and optimization. More About Our Team You’ll be joining a team driving traction into the IT market. The IT Product Marketing team is growing rapidly, so you’ll have tremendous opportunity to help us build our team culture, formulate strategies, build programs from scratch, influence product roadmap, and be instrumental in driving growth for the company. Product Marketing at Atlassian is responsible for creating and executing the GTM strategy for all products across the Atlassian product portfolio by supporting our flywheel model and our approach to enterprise sales. We run our organization like a well-oiled agile team, where the top priority items are easily identifiable and everyone on the team rallies around those deliverables, and each other, on a regular basis. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian Advisory Services delivers practical solutions guidance to our largest customers, to help them plan and achieve transformational outcomes faster, resulting in exceptional value to their business from Atlassian's products. In this role as Services Solutions Consultant you will connect with the customer's key business and technical decision-makers and understand what outcomes they are looking to achieve with their investment in Atlassian's suite of products. You will shape a solutions sales motion jointly with Atlassian's enterprise teams & our Solutions Partners, to tailor a prescriptive package of services that is inclusive of Atlassian's enterprise services offerings and the Partner's services capabilities - as a complete outcome-focused solution offering. Internally at Atlassian you will partner with the delivery team leads from Enterprise Advocacy, Technical Account Management, Training, and Practice Development, and your partnership will extend externally to the services sales teams within Atlassian's Solutions Partner ecosystem. You will engage customers early in the services funnel to nurture their solution need, and then work collaboratively with each of these teams to shape a customer solution proposal. You will also work with Atlassian's internal sales teams to align dependencies between the software and services sales pipeline for the region, and understand at anytime which opportunities are jointly in flight, and coordinate customer engagement in those opportunities to unlock customer uptake of Atlassian's enterprise services. More About You It would be great if you also had some of the following: 1+ years of experience with Atlassian products Basic understanding of the use of software development, project management collaboration and code quality software 1+ years of experience with Salesforce 2+ years of experience with Agile development, real-time and distributed team collaboration, IT service management, DevOps and automation, and/or continuous integration More About Our Team The Atlassian Advisory Services organization is a globally distributed team of Atlassian solutions advisors who are passionate about creating customer success. Solutions Engineers partners with the sales teams to provide technical solutions guidance to the customer throughout the sales cycle. TAMs are the post-sales advisory service to ensure that Atlassian's largest customers are able to execute at scale with our products. The Practice Development team works with both our Cloud & Server product teams, along with external platform partners, to shape consulting delivery guidance and playbooks for our solutions partners. Atlassian University delivers training & certification offerings to help our champions build their career and expertise on Atlassian products, and Sales Enablement extends that education to our sales and solutions partner teams. You'll report into a Manager of the Professional Services Sales team. We are big on distributed remote collaboration and are passionate about our customer-first culture. Working in this team at Atlassian, you'll have a direct impact on millions of users, fast! You won't get frustrated with bureaucracy or slow decision-making, because we encourage innovative thinking. We don't just want to know your opinions, we want to see your ideas in action. We hire great people and then trust them to be great. Up to 20% travel may be required for this role. Pursuant to Atlassian policy, individuals must be fully vaccinated and submit proof of their vaccinated status to assume this role, subject to legal exemptions. Candidates must provide proof of their vaccinated status within 30 days of their start date. Please reach out to your recruiter if you have questions about this requirement or if you'd like to submit a request for an exemption prior to the start of your employment. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team . We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Cloud Migrations is Atlassian's top goal. We are committed to helping our valuable customers complete the migrations of the Atlassian products from on-premise environment to Atlassian Cloud. These are highly complex projects that need thorough discovery, planning, preparation, testing before taking up the production migrations. We have a team of Cloud Migrations Managers(CMM) and Migrations Support Engineers (MSE) helping our enterprise customers learn about migration options and optimally plan and execute on migrating their Atlassian software instance from their on-premises environment to the Atlassian cloud. The Program Manager, Cloud Migrations Management is a post sales role within the Customer Support Services (CSS) team, whose core function is to ensure successful completion of highly complex/escalated large scale Server to Cloud migrations. This role collaborates actively with Cloud Migrations Managers, Migration Support Engineers, Escalation Managers, Business Lead within Customer Support Services and also with other cross functional teams (Product, Engineering, SRE, Pre-Sales, Customer Success). They coordinate proactive and reactive escalation efforts, maintain team morale and manage resources while maintaining oversight and accountability across the entire migrations journeys. The Program Manager, Cloud Migrations Management is supplemental to core Migrations support roles such as Cloud Migration Manager (CMM), Migrations Support Engineer (MSE), Escalation Manager, Technical Account Manager (TAM), Customer Success Manager (CSM), Solutions Engineer (SE). Responsibilities Responsible for planning and coordinating activities outside of BAU of CMM or TAM scope Proactively monitor large/complex migrations and performs health checks to ensure risk is being mitigated where necessary Responsible for communicating updates/asks and escalations to Atlassian Executive Sponsors, Customer Support, Customer Success leadership and coordinate with Mission Control Program Manager to documentation and updates. Responsible for effectively overseeing escalation management engagement (across apps, cloud scale/performance, migration tooling and migration strategy) Ensure the closure and follow through on HOT incidents Responsible for driving core Migrations account team as well as coordinating with Product, Platform and Migrations leadership to prevent blockers and escalations by removing risks, clear blockers and share updates and learning across the highest levels of the organization with the goal to improve repeatability/standardisation. Establish continuous process improvement cycles where the process, performance, activities, roles and responsibilities, policies, procedures and supporting technology is reviewed and enhanced where applicable. Own end to end coordination of cloud architecture, cloud performance and scale blockers Own end to end coordination of migration efforts and blockers (logistics, consulting, tech skills and escalation leadership) Provide inputs/learnings and experiences (product, tooling, processes, partners etc) help catalog them to create relevant play books or enhance existing plays with the goal to help future migrations planning/predictability Coordinate with key roles like Business Lead, Escalation Manager, Content Manager, CSM, TAM, Infra, Services teams to gather/share critical information. Serve as the voice of the customer internally and drive insights that will craft product strategy and improve our customer support processes On The First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 10+ years experience in a strategic customer-facing role within either customer support, customer success, solution engineering, a migration-specific department, or other related function; 4+ years of Project management experience Proven strategic account management skills Ability to build partnership and influence cross functional senior leaders to drive immediate change as well as longer term road map changes. Is an expert in SaaS, understands the cloud architecture as a whole Ability to coach/mentor Strong communication skills as well as a natural propensity for public speaking and experience with leading C-level conversations; Ability to ask compelling/ leading questions, uncover common customer themes, and lead technical planning and project planning; Escalation management and Escalation avoidance Ability to build presentations, write content, and present to large audiences; Broad experience working with Enterprise level customers, comfort in navigating a large organization Empathy for customer anxiety and experience in helping customers deal with change management within their organization; Ability to prioritize quickly and optimize processes and tools to reduce inefficiencies; It's Phenomenal, But Not Required If You Have Atlassian product knowledge or experience in building and supporting migrations related projects in the past; Technical ability to navigate and solution for complex discussions on various deployment/migration options across self-hosted, cloud, and hybrid deployment options; Ability to establish a vision and guide other Atlassian teams (solution marketing, product). Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. We're looking for a talented Program Manager to join our dynamic and collaborative employment law team at Atlassian! In this position, reporting to the Head of Global Employment Law, you will have an opportunity to level up the employment law team and help build and operationalize global programs impacting Atlassian’s workforce. Successful candidates will have a solid track record of program and project management and will have demonstrated leadership skills and ability to effectively influence, along with superior organizational and communication skills. In This Role, You’ll Get To Build the employment law team’s foundational systems and processes that will enable the team to effectively support our business partners and Atlassian’s exponential growth. This includes setting up standardized processes using Atlassian’s tools, creating automated workflows, and building documentation management systems. Partner closely with teams across the business to identify global initiatives the employment law team will prioritize. These programs may include those related to, among others, TEAM Anywhere (distributed work), employment law compliance, and mergers and acquisitions. Develop and execute program/project plans, which can include goal setting, use case development, stakeholder engagement, roles and responsibilities (RACI), risks, milestones, and resource tracking Set up, develop the agenda for, and run project team meetings Establish reasonable, and manage, project timelines Keep the project on track Identify project gaps and blockers and take action to resolve them effectively Identify, build relationships with, communicate with, connect, and influence stakeholders to facilitate timely and effective progress of project Ensure the project’s goals are attained or reprioritized if necessary Conduct retrospectives that assess and document learnings, analysis, and feedback from the project team More About You Ability to handle an entire business problem and build solutions Experience leading and delivering projects spanning multiple teams Ability to connect with people all over the globe at multiple levels of seniority across legal, people, and business teams Experience being accountable for managing multiple tasks and schedules simultaneously Proactive approach to identifying and addressing risks associated with the program Ability to make critical and timely decisions to keep a project on track Learning agility Wisdom to know when to run with something on your own and when to ask for help On Your First Day, We’ll Expect You to Have: 5+ years of proven experience as a program manager Self-starter with strong work ethic and ability to produce high quality work quickly and efficiently in a fast-paced work environment Ability to manage and handle sensitive and confidential information with the highest levels of integrity, ethical standards, discretion, and sound judgment Excellent interpersonal and oral/written communications skills, with a demonstrated record of cross-functional collaboration, being a team player, and forming strong working relationships with stakeholders Detail oriented and highly organized Extras You Might Bring With You Program management experience with people- or legal- related programs Experience with employment laws across the globe Experience with Atlassian products Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. We're looking for a talented Program Manager to join our dynamic and collaborative employment law team at Atlassian! In this position, reporting to the Head of Global Employment Law, you will have an opportunity to level up the employment law team and help build and operationalize global programs impacting Atlassian’s workforce. Successful candidates will have a solid track record of program and project management and will have demonstrated leadership skills and ability to effectively influence, along with superior organizational and communication skills. In This Role, You’ll Get To Build the employment law team’s foundational systems and processes that will enable the team to effectively support our business partners and Atlassian’s exponential growth. This includes setting up standardized processes using Atlassian’s tools, creating automated workflows, and building documentation management systems. Partner closely with teams across the business to identify global initiatives the employment law team will prioritize. These programs may include those related to, among others, TEAM Anywhere (distributed work), employment law compliance, and mergers and acquisitions. Develop and execute program/project plans, which can include goal setting, use case development, stakeholder engagement, roles and responsibilities (RACI), risks, milestones, and resource tracking Set up, develop the agenda for, and run project team meetings Establish reasonable, and manage, project timelines Keep the project on track Identify project gaps and blockers and take action to resolve them effectively Identify, build relationships with, communicate with, connect, and influence stakeholders to facilitate timely and effective progress of project Ensure the project’s goals are attained or reprioritized if necessary Conduct retrospectives that assess and document learnings, analysis, and feedback from the project team More About You Ability to handle an entire business problem and build solutions Experience leading and delivering projects spanning multiple teams Ability to connect with people all over the globe at multiple levels of seniority across legal, people, and business teams Experience being accountable for managing multiple tasks and schedules simultaneously Proactive approach to identifying and addressing risks associated with the program Ability to make critical and timely decisions to keep a project on track Learning agility Wisdom to know when to run with something on your own and when to ask for help On Your First Day, We’ll Expect You to Have: 5+ years of proven experience as a program manager Self-starter with strong work ethic and ability to produce high quality work quickly and efficiently in a fast-paced work environment Ability to manage and handle sensitive and confidential information with the highest levels of integrity, ethical standards, discretion, and sound judgment Excellent interpersonal and oral/written communications skills, with a demonstrated record of cross-functional collaboration, being a team player, and forming strong working relationships with stakeholders Detail oriented and highly organized Extras You Might Bring With You Program management experience with people- or legal- related programs Experience with employment laws across the globe Experience with Atlassian products Our Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Shifting our on-premises customers to Cloud is one of Atlassian's top priority goals. Massive company initiatives like MPT, Cloud Shift have been founded to ensure the customer experience and ROI in Cloud is better than Server. In order to continue scaling our business to take on more of our top-tier, enterprise-level customers, Atlassian is now in need of a leader dedicated to the success and scale of the enterprise-level customer migration journey. This person will be responsible for developing the direction and roadmap of this cohort's journey to their successful migration to Cloud. As an Enterprise Business Lead/Operations PgM for Atlassian's Cloud Migrations team, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring deep learning and scale of enterprise-level customer needs, where the gaps are in our current process offerings, and create a best-in-class migrations experience. You will be responsible for driving strategic programs and projects cross-functionally across the whole enterprise funnel from sales to product (GTM, CSS, CSI, etc.) working closely with other program managers and team leaders globally to scale best practices from innovation to adoption and champion continuous improvement. This role will be accountable for defining and driving clean project execution against a plan you collaboratively design to deliver measurable outcomes for the customer and Atlassian teams. You will partner closely with executive stakeholders to set quarterly delivery initiatives that support the mission while maintaining funnel oversight to manage risks and influencing product improvements. Additionally, you will lead discovery with cross-functional teams to identify and resource surfaced insights as well as radiate customer behavior themes and patterns that will be leveraged for actioning larger improvement initiatives across maturing solution models and customer cohorts. Scope Own program for enterprise funnel. Deeply understand end-to-end journey for high-touch, enterprise-level customers. Committed dedication to keeping CSS process improvements top of mind. ex. enterprise funnel health, Cloud Migrations (CMM/MSE) team projects, pre-sales and post-migration hypercare handovers, etc. Share business insights, program learnings, and funnel trends from customers, blocker programs, ENT-VOC, etc. to prioritize with product Own oversight of enterprise-level blockers list, driving strategic programs/initiatives aimed at reducing/removing top blockers/friction areas for enterprise migrators, and providing recommendations to leaders across the organization for addressing high-impact opportunities. Partner with OET to communicate themes, improve processes, and enhance overall journey for enterprise customers. (Example to engage OET: "we have X issue- OET help us solve this") Document and own large scale updates for BAU programs such as executive sponsors, guardrails, sales hand over, SWAT hand over to ensure program maintenance What you'll do Focus on Customer Experience: Create a best-in-class enterprise/high-touch migration experience by defining key journey touch points, needed tools, plays and processes, content and communication strategies needed to support this customer tier. Work with the other program managers and leadership to map ways of working globally with an eye towards customer migration goals, minimizing time to migrate, and achieving overall success metrics. Program Development and Execution: Work with leadership and the Cloud Migrations team to understand opportunities for improvement and program focus. Then develop a program plan that defines the problem statement, stakeholders, options for success, and risk register. Execute against the plan while updating stakeholders and reporting. Program Analysis and Refinement: Directly manage and prioritize several strategic program initiatives (ex: Executive Sponsors, Health Checks, Mission Director priorities) aimed at reducing/removing top blockers or friction areas for enterprise customers migrating to cloud to highlight to executive sponsors. Develop and maintain best practices and rituals for analyzing the whole migrations funnel including internal process to customer feedback (ENT-VOC). Process at Scale: Scale program learnings to empower and set expectations with Sales/Support teams via Cloud Migration Playbook, SOPs, and other hosted learning sessions. Identify and implement way to contribute, improve, automate where possible, and create consistency across multiple processes so they can be easily maintained at a larger scale.. Establish continuous process improvement cycles where the process, performance, activities, roles and responsibilities, policies, procedures and supporting technology is reviewed and enhanced where applicable. Program Communication Plans: With a global team, it is crucial to create and implement multi-channel communication plans to inform all stakeholders of the progress and deliverables of the Programs you are running. This will include understanding the audience, creating communication calendars, and writing / coordinating to create communication content. You will be responsible for communicating updates/asks to Atlassian Executive Sponsors and CSS migrations leadership teams. Business Insights and Solutions: Reflect on the previous work and interactions with the teams to help identify opportunities for business impact seen both within the Cloud Migrations team and throughout Atlassian. Then create demand for possible solutions through these insights to help create a backlog of programs for the teams you support. Stakeholder Management: Collaborate with Product, Engineering, Design, Marketing, Sales, Operations, and Support at senior levels within Atlassian to identify, design, and implement programs necessary to achieve or exceed company objectives. Gainleadership and stakeholder buy-in at the beginning of a program and help maintain it throughout the lifecycle of the program. Global Influence and Accountability: Ability to influence all the way up to the executive sponsor level to engage them with updates, themes, and how they can support in a digestible format. Ensure that work teams are considering their counterparts across the globe. Create processes and ceremonies that will allow for contribution and communication across time zones. Develop consistency across teams and regions for alignment to goals, processes, and team ceremonies within Atlassian at large. Cross-Functional Collaboration and Coordination: Work with Atlassian teams across organizations to share, learn, and create efficiencies. Drive consistent best practices for knowledge management, content creation, and communication specifically within internal channels. Meeting Planning for Migrations and Cross-Functional Programs: Manage the week-to-week planning rigor to help teams keep their eye on the quarterly OKR goals, driving the cadence of planning, delivery, iteration, and measurement. Tooling Implementation and Reporting: Determine how and what tools can help teams be successful in tracking success metrics, executing work, and reporting outward. We utilize Atlassian products where possible and you will need to understand Jira Administration, Advanced roadmaps, Confluence, and Atlas. We will be focusing on automation in tooling to help us scale, create reporting dashboards, and establish feedback loop mechanisms. Your background 3-5 years of project and/or program management experience Hands-on experience with Jira and Confluence to produce program roadmaps, communication plans, team enablement, and cross-functional processes Experience working with enterprise service delivery and customer tea

Atlassian is growing faster than ever and has an opportunity for a collaborative Program Specialist, Global Operations and Technology with our Talent Acquisition Enablement team. As a Program Specialist, Global Operations & Technology, you will report to the Head of TA Operations and Technology and be a part of the Global TA Enablement team. You will help build and improve operational processes and capabilities to support the complex operational needs of our fast-growing recruiting team. In This Role, You'll Get To Manage programs of medium to large cross-organizational scope (multiple teams, multiple process areas). Identify dependencies and resolve gaps/risks by aligning stakeholders and leading change across the organization. Track, measure, and report on success metrics for the program. Understand the details of the program's health including major risks and decisions that must be made. Know the difference between success and failure - this role does not "run a process" but is in control of the program. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 5+ years of experience in TA / Recruiting Operations with relevant experience leading process improvement/projects in this domain. Domain experience within Talent Acquisition, HR, and recruiting operations. Lead and own operational activities pertaining to the tools and tech deployed within the process area and lead with documentation, communication, and training support. Proven knowledge of bulk hiring processes and process improvement efforts. Support process build and system enablement in this program. Top 3 Priorities You Will Accomplish In 6-12 Months Improve process transformation throughout the candidate lifecycle. Support process efficiency programs to ensure data and reporting accuracy. Promote infrastructure build for all identified priorities in the fiscal year. Main Partners For This Role Global Talent Acquisition teams People Technology Financial Planning and Analysis Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Your future team Atlassian is searching for a Research Manager to join our growing team of research experts. You will join a, collaborative group that is helping Atlassian achieve our mission to unleash the potential of teams all over the world. You are a lead researcher or research manager. Here, you'll manage a team of accomplished researchers. All while leading a team of researchers, demonstrating accountability for their craft quality with an emphasis on growing the capability of the team and encouraging demand for research and researchers. What you'll do As a Research Manager at Atlassian, we're searching for someone to help us identify and understand the questions we need to answer to move strategy and execution forward in an important area of the platform, our buyer experience. You will shape research direction in partnership with our platform teams, and grow the capability of our researchers. Your research craft guidance will inform our platform experiences and strategy. You will collaborate with important partners across product management, design, analytics, data science, marketing, and engineering to influence experience design and direction. You will grow the desire for research in the space and help drive strategy. Your background 5+ years hands-on experience designing and conducting user research that has had an impact. We expect to hear stories of how you and your research teams have influenced product roadmaps and informed design decisions. Experience with qualitative and quantitative research techniques (remote and in-person), and knowledge of when, why and how to apply them. We value your ability to be creative when thinking about the research problem you're trying to solve, and your ability to bring your team along on the journey of your discoveries. Influence and inspire change. You know how to advocate for research and researchers; you rely on qualitative and quantitative data to create ways of promoting your team's insights so they resonate and are impactful across diverse audiences. Experience collaborating with leaders to advocate for customer-centric and evidence-based decisions. Experience mentoring researchers and developing the skills of other researchers It Would Be Nice If You Had Experience growing researchers and research teams, guiding their craft and career development. Experience with high quality mixed-methods (qual and quant) research Experience with creative approaches to researching complex user experience challenges and communicate ideas through storytelling Experience managing researchers. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Are you energized by solving security challenges? We're looking for folks to help us in four important areas: Build and run new monitoring and analytics systems to detect compromises. Write automation to find and exploit vulnerabilities in our products and marketplace apps. Research and suggest product features to harden our software against common vulnerabilities. Architect and secure hardware, networks and corporate infrastructure. As a graduate on our security team, you'll watch over our Atlassian services which host tens of thousands of customers. You'll report to, and learn from, some of the best security engineers in the business. Not eligible for Visa sponsorship. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1 student graduates at this time. Please note: At this time, this role is only open to entry level candidates with less than a year of professional experience (this does not include internships/co-ops). More About You On your first day, we'll expect you to have: Bachelors degree or higher in Computer Science or a related technical field and graduating by June 2023 Familiarity with Java, Python, JavaScript, or other related object-oriented programming languages Knowledge of data structures, in particular how they are implemented and how to apply them meet security challenges Familiarity with the application of common design patterns Demonstrated interest in the security field through academic coursework, previous work or internship experience, or personal projects Comfortable writing code to accomplish goals and does not depend solely on third-party products Coursework in Cyber Security and other related Security fields It's Great, But Not Required, If You Have A history of collaborating with colleagues to build technical solutions to hard problems - - Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Join Atlassian as an intern and spend your summer with us having an impact on how millions of users collaborate with our software. The most amazing thinkers like NASA rocket scientists and Tesla engineers are coming to us for solutions. We're in the business of developing software to help teams everywhere get amazing ideas off the ground and into the world. Here you'll be encouraged to use your imagination and try new things. You'll be guided (as we are) by our core values, and will be supported by some of the best minds in tech. We want you to have everything you need to do amazing work from the get-go. Write automation to find and exploit vulnerabilities in our products and marketplace apps. Research and suggest product features to harden our software against common vulnerabilities. Architect and secure hardware, networks and corporate infrastructure. As an intern in our security team, you'll watch over our Atlassian services which host tens of thousands of customers. You'll report to, and learn from, some of the best security engineers in the business. Apply for our Security Intern program to start an exciting career! Not eligible for Visa sponsorship. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1 student graduates at this time. Your future team Atlassian is looking for an experienced analyst relations practitioner with an understanding of the industry analyst landscape and existing relationships with either IT, Software Development, or Collaboration analyst influencers. You will join the Atlassian analyst relations program to implement Atlassian's AR strategy and partner with product marketers and product managers across the business to build relationships, master reports and manage the AR program. As an important member of the Analyst Relations team you will help shape how we implement, measure and build a nimble, effective, and modern AR function that matches Atlassian unique business model. You'll be part of a global communications team, reporting to the Head of Analyst Relations and partnering with communications, marketing, product and corporate teams across the business. What you'll do Create, nurture, and manage positive relationships with industry analysts, serving as a key, centralized contact point and connector. Work with designated product marketing managers and product teams to implement an AR program that influences, educates, and secures endorsements from leading analysts in our most important markets. Develop and implement an analyst relations program to support communications and marketing initiatives with analyst research and industry validation including regular updates, analyst inquiry, research services, and field education programs. Act as an advisor on how the analyst firms can contribute to marketing campaigns and internal understanding of the markets and competitors. Your background Minimum of 7 years of experience in business-to-business analyst relations, for another Fortune 500 tech firm. Demonstrated ability to build and run analyst relations programs. Experience influencing important decision makers and analysts' research agenda. Solid experience with major and boutique analyst firms (Gartner, Forrester, IDC, 451 Research, etc.). An eye for simplifying sophisticated topics and technologies to their essence, and the curiosity and aim to discover share-worthy information. Experience collaborating with multiple teams and across global geographies with remote colleagues and partners. A love for collecting and sharing salient content from internal and external sources. An ability to prioritize high-profile projects and juggle urgent inbound requests with ease. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more.
