jobTitle: Senior Front End Software Engineer, Cloud Admin
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is looking for a senior frontend software engineer to join our Cloud Administration team. You’ll be joining a team focused on building features for our enterprise-scale customers to enable better governance, trust, and security. Our team has a direct impact on the growth of Atlassian and is the proud owner of the Atlassian Access product. We are enabling cross-product experiences, and are committed to removing all blockers for adoption of cloud for enterprise customers. More About You As a senior frontend software engineer on this team, you will work with a talented team of Product Managers, Designers, and Architects to build application-layer services encompassing frontend development, monitoring, scaling and optimizing to make the administration of Atlassian products simple at Enterprise scale. You will be empowered to drive innovation by coming up with new and exciting ideas to creatively solve issues, as well as actively looking for opportunities to improve the design, interface, and architecture of Atlassian's products on the cloud. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent 6+ years of experience designing and building a production-level large scale web application. Proven experience building responsive & intuitive front-end web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript (we use React, Redux, Webpack, GraphQL and more). Experienced building single-page applications in JavaScript/TypeScript Architect, design and Build complex user interfaces from the ground up using the latest web technologies – from gathering requirements, design, build, deploy and ownership. You will own the front-end development for one or more of our product / services. You are comfortable conducting code reviews and giving feedback to ensure high standards of code maintainability and extensibility Address complex problems at both an application and system level Experience building a service from the ground up is preferred – be product-focused, driving the design, development, and implementation in order to turn a user’s pain-points into simple and elegant solutions that are loved. Experience with AWS infrastructure and/or Microservices is preferred. It’s Great, But Not Required If You Have Hands-on experience building an Atlassian plugin of any size. Experience with Spring framework. Experience with Maven plugin development. Experience in TDD techniques & Continuous Integration. Familiarity with Agile software development methodologies. Address complex problems at both an application and system level Proven expertise in building high-available, resilient, scalable, low latency services in distributed architecture. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is on a mission to build and grow an Economy. Our organisation has a Demand team (as in Supply & Demand) responsible for all the surface areas where users discover and procure products & apps. Demand also includes all supporting systems that glue these systems together, such as marketing technology and experimentation systems. We are working to prove our Economy thesis that we could treat 1st, 2nd, and 3rd party products the same through a unified discovery/purchase experience. Think the iOS App Store or the Epic Games store. This means there are new systems we would need to build to make this a reality: like recommendation engines and streamlined data pipelines between otherwise isolated platforms. Atlassian is looking for a front-end architect passionate about building scalable frontends. This role drives the architecture of surfaces that power Atlassian's cross-product adoption growth and vendor marketplace offerings which are critical to Atlassian's growing business. You will own front-end architecture for www.atlassian.com , community.atlassian.com , marketplace.atlassian.com , and our distribution surfaces in core products like Jira and Confluence. If you live and breathe modern web apps, if you nerd out on delivering scalable architectures; enabling developers and content producers to move with speed; solving for SEO and user; and if you love coaching your peers, then we would love you to join the team. Your Background 15+ years of experience building software, with 5+ years in an architect role working across teams A genuine passion for collaboration and strong interpersonal skills supported by eloquently written communication A passion for performance and the ability to evangelize the benefits of performance to all business stakeholders Adept at working with remote teams (peers or customers) Demonstrated knowledge in designing and delivering scalable frontend architectures High competency in React (both large applications and reusable components) and server-side rendering (SSR) Experience with server-side CSS pre-processing platforms (LESS, SASS, etc.) Strong knowledge and experience in REST, GraphQL, and API best practices Expertise in JavaScript and typed variants (Flow / TypeScript) along with Node and related JS ecosystem tools Experience in operational requirements and common challenges of cloud-based systems Knowledge of CMSs and site-building platforms (e.g. Magnolia, Webflow) StrongObject Oriented and Component-Based design knowledge. Developing modern, reliable and performant frontend e-commerce web applications Understanding of front-end experimentation practices to drive product and performance optimizations Responsive design techniques Knowledge of accessibility standards Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is on a mission to build and grow an Economy. Our organisation has a Demand team (as in Supply & Demand) responsible for all the surface areas where users discover and procure products & apps. Demand also includes all supporting systems that glue these systems together, such as marketing technology and experimentation systems. We are working to prove our Economy thesis that we could treat 1st, 2nd, and 3rd party products the same through a unified discovery/purchase experience. Think the iOS App Store or the Epic Games store. This means there are new systems we would need to build to make this a reality: like recommendation engines and streamlined data pipelines between otherwise isolated platforms. Atlassian is looking for a front-end architect passionate about building scalable frontends. This role drives the architecture of surfaces that power Atlassian's cross-product adoption growth and vendor marketplace offerings which are critical to Atlassian's growing business. You will own front-end architecture for www.atlassian.com , community.atlassian.com , marketplace.atlassian.com , and our distribution surfaces in core products like Jira and Confluence. jobTitle: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, Bundler Team
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Our team is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help us build the future of our frontend developer platform. The problems we tackle are some of the most challenging and exciting in the industry, from scaling monorepo infrastructure to frontend performance to the future of bundling at scale. Your job will be to help the team solve these challenges and contribute to the future vision of our platform. You will be surrounded by a team of passionate problem solvers who are dedicated to creating world-class tooling. By joining the Frontend Bundler team, you will have an opportunity to solve complex problems in the bundler space. We work on making our next-gen bundler fast, scalable, reliable, and with industry-leading capabilities. As part of your role, you will work closely with engineers across the company to solve their problems and improve our platform. If you are passionate about developer infrastructure, asset bundling, frontend performance, and working on open source, this is the opportunity you've been waiting for! On Your First Day, We Expect You To Have Exposure to JavaScript build tooling with an interest in optimizing the development loop. A deep understanding of the JavaScript language and ecosystem. Bundler/Compiler Experience Passion for developer productivity and coding patterns at scale. Understanding of how to build performant, decoupled, testable, and maintainable code. Evidence of enjoying sharing knowledge, tips, and tricks and helping other developers. Great debugging skills and exposure to other languages like Rust are welcome. Required It's great – but not required – for you to have Experience measuring and implementing performance optimizations. Experience developing large-scale applications with NodeJS and React and Parcel. Operational experience – instrumenting code and monitoring the errors, metrics, and analytics of large-scale web applications. Experience with open-source projects, having contributed to or owned one. Some industry experience with public cloud offerings (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure). More About Our Team The Frontend Bundler team is part of the UI Platform organization. UI Platform delivers libraries, infrastructure, and tools that power the development of fast, scalable, and familiar frontend experiences across Atlassian. Our team works mainly on Parcel, which is part of our frontend platform internal offering. Our main mission is to build the next-gen bundler that will solve our complex needs. These include tools and infrastructure that make it easy for engineers to build fast, scalable, and reliable experiences. Our work enables different teams to deliver world-class experiences by providing best-in-class development-time and run-time infrastructure. We want to give engineers the tools they need to have a productive developer experience while being excited about their work. We come from multiple backgrounds and different degrees of professional experience. One thing we all share is a passion for building great solutions to complex problems. We care deeply about teamwork and collaboration, a balance between autonomy and responsibility, having open discussions, and of course, having fun. If this sounds like you, we would love to talk. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. jobTitle: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, Compass
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. We are searching for a Senior Full-Stack software engineer to join the Compass team in the US. We’re building a new product, Compass, that will be the mission control for engineering teams. This is a really exciting opportunity to have a huge impact on one of the big bets coming out of Atlassian’s Point A program (New Product Framework). This team is working on key parts of culture and insight within Compass. Where you’ll make an impact As part of the Compass Culture team, you will be responsible for leading and working on greenfield development efforts to enable customers to visualize and improve their engineering processes. The team is working on new features to score and suggest improvements to software components. You will build features to introspect components in new ways and generate insights for our customers. You will be working on complex Java-based code on the backend with UI components built with React and other Javascript technologies. Knowledge of Kotlin and Typescript will be very helpful. Experience with building and running services, also with experience with any of public cloud offerings (e.g., AWS, GAE, Azure) will be required. You will be working closely with a team that’s distributed throughout the US (PDT, MDT, CDT) and collaborates frequently with partner teams based in Sydney. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 5+ years of experience designing and building a production-level web application Experience with modern Javascript frameworks (e.g. React) Experience with modern web application frameworks, such as Spring boot Understanding of micro-services oriented architecture and extensible REST APIs Understanding of front-end architecture and data-driven development Experience with common data storage technologies, e.g. RDBMS, NoSQL or Graph DB Understanding of SaaS, PaaS, LaaS industry with hands-on experience with public cloud offerings (e.g., AWS, Azure) A strong team player mindset. Experience in mentoring developers (via tech design reviews & sparring, code reviews etc) and ability to effectively collaborate on ideas and designs with some of the best architects and developers in Atlassian Demonstrated excellence at solving problems iteratively and delivering software that can be responsive to customer feedback It's Great, But Not Required If You Have Experience with large scale single-page web applications Experience driving and delivering features/software modules from technical design to launch Practical knowledge of agile software development methodologies (e.g., XP, Scrum) Experience with continuous delivery and infrastructure as code Experience with some parts of our stack: Kotlin, Spring boot, GraphQL, Typescript and React Experience with large scale web applications Experience with data heavy applications Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, Data Engineering
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Are you passionate about building elegant systems that can power Atlassian products with modern big data technologies? We are looking for a Senior Fullstack Software Engineer to join our Data Engineering Team and build world-class data solutions to power Atlassian products and develop internal systems to help Atlassians make crucial business decisions. You will have ample opportunities to interact with business stakeholders and solve complex data problems. You will see first-hand how your work makes a difference to the users of Atlassian. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have MS/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related subject. 8+ years of experience in designing and building a production-level data or web application. Experience in building frontend and backend web applications from the ground up using modern technologies – from partnering with product management on requirement gathering and prioritization to designing, building, deployment and end-to-end ownership Experience architecting and building scalable data products Proven experience with Java, Spring, Hibernate, Rest APIs, AWS, Docker, SQL, Microservices Front-end development experience with expert knowledge of technologies like HTML, CSS, Javascript, AJAX, ReactJS, Angular, etc. Knowledge of continuous integration and deployment tools (e.g. Git, Maven, Gradle, Bamboo, Jenkins) Experience in mentoring and coaching teammates. Ability to collaborate effectively on ideas and designs with some of the best architects and developers at Atlassian. Good communication skills; an ability to explain and presentto both technical and business audiences. Quality-oriented mindsetand proven experience with testing practices and philosophy. Excellent troubleshooting, debugging, problem-solving, and analytical skills. Strong leadership skills to plan and work towards the team’s long term goals and roadmaps It's Great, But Not Required If You Have Experience working with data management and MarTech platforms Knowledge working on Amazon Web Services (in particular using S3, SQS, Kinesis, Glue, and the like) Proficient in SQL and prior knowledge about distributed compute (spark) Self-starter and possesses strong self-motivation. Proven ability to drive cross-team technical discussions and decision making. Experience working across partner engineering teams and managing relationships Key Responsibilities Design and develop APIs / SDKs to collect, clean and protect our customers data which forms the backbone for analytics, segmentation, targeting and a lot more. Unify customers’ touch points across all platforms / channels to create a single view fo the customer Mentor, coach, and guide other developers in the team via pair programming, tech design reviews, code reviews, brownbag sessions etc. Participate in all aspects of the project life-cycle, from ideation to specification to release. Partner with engineering teams to build user-friendly, scalable tools, and infrastructure to test and release software quickly. More about our team Data is a BIG deal at Atlassian. We ingest over 180 billion events each month into our analytics platform and we have dozens of teams across the company driving their decisions and guiding their operations based on the data and services we provide. It’s the data engineering teams job is to empower Atlassians to be increasingly data-driven and facilitate company growth. We do this by providing metrics and other data elements which are reliable and trustworthy, as well as services and data products to help democratize data and increase time to (reliable) insight. You’ll be joining a team with a brand new mission. There will be plenty of challenges and scope to grow. We value when people ask hard questions and challenge each other to constantly improve our work. We are independent but love highly collaborative team environments, so you'll get the opportunity to work with lots of other awesome people just like you. We're all about enabling teams to execute growth and customer retention strategies by providing the right data frameworks and tools. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer, Data Engineering
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Are you passionate about building elegant systems that can power Atlassian products with modern big data technologies? We are looking for a Senior Fullstack Software Engineer to join our Data Engineering Team and build world-class data solutions to power Atlassian products and develop internal systems to help Atlassians make crucial business decisions. You will have ample opportunities to interact with business stakeholders and solve complex data problems. You will see first-hand how your work makes a difference to the users of Atlassian. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have MS/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related subject. 8+ years of experience in designing and building a production-level data or web application. Experience in building frontend and backend web applications from the ground up using modern technologies – from partnering with product management on requirement gathering and prioritization to designing, building, deployment and end-to-end ownership Experience architecting and building scalable data products Proven experience with Java, Spring, Hibernate, Rest APIs, AWS, Docker, SQL, Microservices Front-end development experience with expert knowledge of technologies like HTML, CSS, Javascript, AJAX, ReactJS, Angular, etc. Knowledge of continuous integration and deployment tools (e.g. Git, Maven, Gradle, Bamboo, Jenkins) Experience in mentoring and coaching teammates. Ability to collaborate effectively on ideas and designs with some of the best architects and developers at Atlassian. Good communication skills; an ability to explain and presentto both technical and business audiences. Quality-oriented mindsetand proven experience with testing practices and philosophy. Excellent troubleshooting, debugging, problem-solving, and analytical skills. Strong leadership skills to plan and work towards the team’s long term goals and roadmaps It's Great, But Not Required If You Have Experience working with data management and MarTech platforms Knowledge working on Amazon Web Services (in particular using S3, SQS, Kinesis, Glue, and the like) Proficient in SQL and prior knowledge about distributed compute (spark) Self-starter and possesses strong self-motivation. Proven ability to drive cross-team technical discussions and decision making. Experience working across partner engineering teams and managing relationships Key Responsibilities Design and develop APIs / SDKs to collect, clean and protect our customers data which forms the backbone for analytics, segmentation, targeting and a lot more. Unify customers’ touch points across all platforms / channels to create a single view fo the customer Mentor, coach, and guide other developers in the team via pair programming, tech design reviews, code reviews, brownbag sessions etc. Participate in all aspects of the project life-cycle, from ideation to specification to release. Partner with engineering teams to build user-friendly, scalable tools, and infrastructure to test and release software quickly. More about our team Data is a BIG deal at Atlassian. We ingest over 180 billion events each month into our analytics platform and we have dozens of teams across the company driving their decisions and guiding their operations based on the data and services we provide. It’s the data engineering teams job is to empower Atlassians to be increasingly data-driven and facilitate company growth. We do this by providing metrics and other data elements which are reliable and trustworthy, as well as services and data products to help democratize data and increase time to (reliable) insight. You’ll be joining a team with a brand new mission. There will be plenty of challenges and scope to grow. We value when people ask hard questions and challenge each other to constantly improve our work. We are independent but love highly collaborative team environments, so you'll get the opportunity to work with lots of other awesome people just like you. We're all about enabling teams to execute growth and customer retention strategies by providing the right data frameworks and tools. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer to join our Technology Innovation team. This is a role for developers who have a thirst for trying out new technologies, programming languages, frameworks and applications and working on greenfield project to solve interesting problems. If you’re a software developer who naturally leans towards being a generalist or ‘jack of all trades’, this may be a rare opportunity to leverage your talents to their absolute fullest. For the role, you’ll be tasked with delivering innovative solutions that not only delight internal customers but also improve the products we sell to our end customers. About The Team The Technology Innovation team is an internal incubator within Atlassian. The team researches emerging technologies (think VR, blockchain, AI and automation to name a few) to deliver new internal product ideas and solutions that help Atlassian achieve their goals. This is an exciting time to join the Team and help us scale what was just an idea in the recent past! Does this sound exciting to you? You might be the person we’re looking for! the organization's top and bottom lines Evaluate a myriad of different technologies (SaaS, open source, custom builds, and hybrids of the preceding) against real world business problems faced by multiple teams Build MVP to demonstrate technology in action Determine how to best deploy and operationalize selected technologies at scale Work with cross-functional teams to deploy solutions and bring stakeholders up to speed Build out deployment pipelines (CI/CD) and integrations to SaaS platforms Regularly work with different technologies with which you may be completely unfamiliar with Participate in mock RFPs to evaluate new Atlassian products and features Develop solutions that extend Atlassian products through marketplace apps, forge plugins or via 2nd/3rd party integrations Required Qualifications 5+ years of software development experience Proficiency in Java, Python and SQL Strong microservice knowledge using Springboot (cloud stack), REST Standards Have expertise in large distributed systems, legacy experience is considered an asset Hands-on experience with public cloud offerings (e.g., AWS, GCS, Azure) Familiarity with the Atlassian Product portfolio Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written skills and the ability to interact with all level of stakeholders, support personnel, and clients Strong documentation, analytical and problem-solving skills CI/CD knowledge and able to configure the same A mindset for innovation and taking calculated risks Experience leading large-scale transformation projects and implementations Experience with designing and developing digital solutions architectures that support business requirements Knowledge of existing, new, and emerging technologies and being able to apply them to new business designs and business models It’s Awesome, But Not Required To Have Used Bamboo, Jira & Confluence A strong DevOps background Exposure to Docker and Kubernetes Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian's mission is to help "unleash the potential of every team" and this is the guiding light behind everything we do. We have developed well-known products (e.g. Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence, Trello) that fit in the fabric of teamwork across different types of teams and the processes to help every team succeed. The Confluence team is transforming how teams everywhere work by getting everyone on the same page. Confluence's success is instrumental for Atlassian to hit its business goals and OKRs and you will have a direct hand in this. As a Senior Group Program Manager for Confluence, you will be a thought partner for the Confluence leadership team and help direct strategic programs important to the success of the business. You will guide completion of cross-organization programs and alignment among leaders internal and external to Confluence. You will be a member of the Program Management leadership team and will report directly to Atlassian's Head of Program Management for Work Management for All. In This Role You'll Be Strategic partner: You'll be an important member of the Confluence leadership team, setting the tone and driving the leadership cadence. Craft expert and Change leader: You'll be a member of our program management leadership team, defining and leading transformation in how we work across Atlassian. You'll influence and contribute to the tools and structures at a company-wide level by applying industry-standard best practices. Delivery leader: You'll own strategic planning and high-quality delivery for the broad portfolio of business and technical outcomes. On your first day, we'd love for you to have: Experience running large-scale (company-wide) portfolios requiring collaboration across a broad set of partners and participants. Partnerships may include, legal, tax, finance, compliance, partnerships 10+ years of relevant professional experience in program management/product/software development; background in engineering or technical product management preferred; Platform as a Service experience a huge plus Experience leading a world-class team of highly engaged technical program managers that can scale through a period of continued high-growth A partnership mentality, promoting strategic partnerships between our organization, constituents and allies More About Our Team We are a team on a mission to ensure that R&D can successfully scale. Specifically, R&D Program Managers at Atlassian build trusted networks, seek clarity, and serve as the grease and the glue to ensure teams deliver complex cross-functional programs as seamlessly as single team projects. Our impact is amplified beyond delivery through our work to advance the program management craft. We band together to develop and apply practices, patterns (plays), and agile frameworks to build pathways for autonomous, empowered, and lasting teams for a Future Atlassian. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Do you live and breathe information security? Want to battle cyber criminals every day? Want to work on important problems, your way? Atlassian has an amazing opportunity for you! We're expanding our security incident response capability and looking for smart, analytical, people to help us build new incident response processes and procedures, and run incident response investigations. As an incident response analyst, you'll be responding to threats against our corporate environment and Atlassian cloud services, contributing to our incident response playbooks and knowledge base, and contributing to mission-critical projects. More than that, you'll be building new systems, developing automation, and crushing security problems you care about. We would love for you to have development experience, but more importantly, you must be bright, motivated, and love security. You should be comfortable writing code to get things done and not depend on third-party products to do your job. You must have a solid understanding of network, system, and application security and should be considered great in at least one by your peers. Your Day-to-day Will Include Usage of Splunk Running and managing security investigations Performing investigations on a wide variety of events from various sources to determine whether they pose a threat to Atlassian Developing technical solutions to help mitigate security incidents Advocating security and secure practices throughout Atlassian Conducting research to identify new attack vectors against Atlassian’s products and services Analyzing log data for signs of compromise Researching attacker tools and tactics On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 5+ years experience working in security Familiarity with security alerts from a variety of sources Relevant work experience in security and incident investigation Working knowledge of operating system internals Written code to complete security tasks Self-motivated and results-oriented Experience building and delivering projects from start to finish Passion for collaboration and strong interpersonal, analytical, and writing skills It's Great, But Not Required If You Have Fluency in any modern programming language (preferably Python or Go) Experience with AWS or similar cloud service platform Experience with malware analysis Experience with threat hunting and threat modeling Experience managing or participating in complex computer security incidents Contributions to the security community or open-source projects Data analytics experience Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Senior ITSM Solutions Architect, Channel Partners
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. At Atlassian, we are on a mission to help our customers compete and win in the modern, digital economy. We have built a multi-billion-dollar, fast-growing software business with over 200,000 paying customers and millions of users around the globe. Many of these organizations acquire Atlassian tools through our global network of partners, who deliver a diverse range of enterprise solutions - such as those powered by our Jira Service Management (JSM) product, where Atlassian and our partners are working to disrupt the current Service Management market space. Atlassian's growth in the service management market continues to accelerate with the rapid growth of Jira Service Management. Our channel partners play an essential role in this growth and the success of our customers. Atlassian is looking for a Solution Architect (SA) to help grow our channel partners focused on the service management market. Your pre-sales to post-sales consulting experience is crucial in enabling and supporting channel partners. You'll join a new team within Atlassian that's on a mission to develop an enterprise-focused ITSM channel program. You'll report into a Head of ITSM Global Partners Solution Acceleration. For this role, we want someone who is - part pre-sales solution engineer, part implementation consultant, and part enablement facilitator. The job is not just about the IT Service Management focus but also about how to increase the knowledge of our Partner's field teams and accelerate the partner selling motions while guiding them toward successful implementation practices that ensure customer success. You are an ITSM Architect, that is willing to put hands-on keyboard and architect from ref architecture to solutions You'll also work closely with the customer-facing ITSM SE team. Our team is experienced at uncovering customer business needs as they consider Jira Service Management for their solution needs. Your discovery-driven consultative approach helps unlock customer challenges and champion new ways of working that guide teams toward adopting improved support practices. You'll collaborate with the Channel business development and Partner managers, Marketing, Sales, and Technical Architects and play a key part in a global team dedicated to ensuring the success of new and existing partners in one of our fastest-growing segments. By partnering with other Atlassian Team members, you'll utilize your knowledge and experience as a solution consultant to help drive ITSM channel partner success. Up to 35% travel may be required for this role. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Job Description Atlassian is looking for a hands-on Senior Data Engineering Leader to join our Data Engineering and Applications team and build data products and applications that power critical business decisions across the organization and inform the product strategy. We are looking for a forward-thinking, structured problem solver, technical specialist, and talented leader passionate about building systems at scale. You will lead a world-class data engineering practice, shape up technical strategy and data architecture, and develop data products to enable reporting, analytics, data science, machine learning, and AI workloads. As the data domain specialist, you will partner with a cross-functional team of IT, data platform, product engineering, analytics teams, and data scientists to support various initiatives. Requirements may be vague, but the iterations will be rapid, and you must take thoughtful and calculated risks. You are interested in reporting platforms and data visualization. More About You You are passionate about technology and data and understand the power of data to influence the future of companies like Atlassian. You thrive on developing phenomenal data products using modern data architecture, engineering practices, and tools to process store, and expose governed and trusted datasets and metrics. You are well-versed in data-driven and data-informed product development and comfortable with the nuts and bolts of software engineering, data engineering, and basic data science. You have excellent business engagement skills and thrive on building strong partnerships and working relationships with business and analytics leaders at all levels. You have a strong sense of fiscal discipline, manage tight budgets, and drive cost efficiency. You are an experienced manager with a strong record of attracting and growing data talent through hiring, coaching, mentoring, and hands-on career development. You foster an inclusive environment where all points of view are welcomed and encouraged. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 12+ years of experience in building and managing data warehouse, data pipelines, and data products 8+ years of experience leading data engineering teams Strong business acumen with an understanding of business drivers and of how to drive value using data across the organization Demonstrated experience in developing strong business relationships and trust with senior business leaders across different functions. Prior experience partnering with Analytics and with Data Science teams 10+ Years of experience in delivering data and analytics solutions for various domains like Go To Market, Customer support, Finance, People, Commerce, and Engineering Experience with solution building and architecting with public cloud offerings such as Amazon Web Services, S3, EMR/Spark/Hive, Presto/Athena Proven experience building streaming and batch processing data pipelines Experience building pipelines to support Machine Learning workloads Experience with test automation, continuous delivery, ensuring high data quality across multiple datasets used for analytical purposes Experience in building anomaly detection checks and proactive monitoring of the quality of the data and KPI's at scale Solid understanding and experience building Microservices and RESTful APIs Experience with Tableau and other BI tools Proven experience hiring and mentoring high-caliber, data-focused engineers with diverse technical strengths and backgrounds. High-energy self-starter with a passion for data, enjoy working in a fast-paced environment. Exceptional communication skills and can translate technical concepts into easy-to-understand language for business partners. A graduate degree in Computer Science or a similar subject area It's Great But Not Required If You Have Experience working with Product Engineering teams Experience working with Data Governance teams implementing Data management practices Experience working for SAAS companies Experience with Machine Learning Committed code to open source projects Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Job Description Atlassian is revolutionizing the software development industry and helping teams all around the world like NASA, Tesla, Daimler, and Amadeus to advance humanity through the power of software & collaboration. We are continuing to build out our leadership team in the Americas. You will manage a team of Strategic Enterprise Advocates who engage our largest customers in an account based selling role. Our Strategic Enterprise Advocates build and implement a sales strategy to increase adoption of select products and services to their named customer base. This team assists customers with their cloud journey, being an advocate of the customer, providing market feedback to our product development teams and optimizing the customer experience. You will report to the Head of Strategic Enterprise Advocates. More About You Atlassian is passionate in welcoming new team members who are self-motivated, proactive, organized, and value centric. Additional attributes of our Direct Sales organization include: customer-focused, creative, thoughtful communicator, and analytical friendly. The Enterprise Advocacy team was established in 2014, with a global presence. We share a commitment to achieving our goals, and an ambition to make our team successful. However, above all we believe in the Atlassian values and want to use them as our compass in building a revolutionary sales model. We are looking forward to having you join the team! On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 10+ years experience in Sales; 4+ years of field sales leadership, with strategic account management experience Experience with achieving success in customer-first SaaS organizations You excel when engaging directly with enterprise customers with a consultative, relationship-oriented approach Motivated and inspired to coach and mentor selling professionals Experience using CRM, Pipeline Management, and Analytic tools You are someone who wants to challenge the traditional Sales Model and improve sales processes. You love working in an international environment, take the initiative to get stuff done, try new things and love sharing your findings with your team. More About Our Team The Enterprise Advocacy team was established to help support customers who are interested in scaling their investment in Atlassian. The team is comprised of Enterprise Advocates specializing in Atlassian's suite of Enterprise products and services. Those on the team have a collective experience in Sales and Management roles in both well-established Fortune 500 companies as well as startups. We share a drive to hit our numbers, but above all, we believe in the Atlassian values and want to use them as our compass in always refining and optimizing our non-traditional sales model, one that redefines how software is sold in the Enterprise! jobTitle: Senior Manager, Strategy & Business Operations, Monetization
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Job Description Atlassian is seeking a Senior Manager of Monetization Strategy and Business Operations to lead product, and global monetization initiatives inclusive of packaging, pricing, editioning, commercialization and long-term business strategy to power product revenue growth. This role will give you the ability to partner closely with the executive team and stakeholders across the organization to define critical strategy that will help set the long-term direction of the business. You are a good fit if you are strategic, a self-starter, driven, adaptable, highly organized, analytical, and have a strong eye for detail. You are a great fit if you have a deep understanding of SaaS business models and of Atlassian’s markets and product strategy. At Atlassian, the Strategy & Business Operations team is a high-impact and visible team that works closely with executive leaders across the company. You’ll own projects from inception to execution and delivery, ensuring that the packaging and pricing proposals you develop are positioned to drive future growth. In the process, you’ll get to work closely with a collaborative team that will help you develop professionally. In This Role, You'll Get To Identify monetization opportunities by having your pulse on the business and drive change by working closely with cross-functional partners across analytics, finance, product, marketing, and sales. Conduct product, customer, competitive, and financial research to develop insights and drive packaging and pricing recommendations. Formulate and present critical packaging and pricing recommendations to the executive team members in various forums. Transform findings into actionable recommendations, and work closely with cross-functional teams to execute on the recommendations. On Your First Day We'll Expect You To Have 8+ years of experience in strategy consulting, product strategy, and/or pricing and packaging Be comfortable with ambiguity, and able to both delve into the details and engage meaningfully on higher level strategy Bring an analytical rigor, drive to support decisions with data, and ability to make data digestible to diverse audiences Be a self-starter and be able to drive work from idea, to analysis, to recommendation and, at times, to implementation Demonstrate strong executive presence and exceptional verbal / written communication skills Have an understanding of SaaS business models and of enterprise sales Have strong proficiency in Excel, Gsheet (bonus points for experience using SQL) It's Great, But Not Required If You Have Experience in crafting and executing marketing and customer research via quantitative methods and experiments Experience in a product strategy or pricing and packaging role at a SaaS company and/or experience with pricing and packaging projects Advanced degree, such as an MBA The Strategy & Business Operations team is a talented and collaborative team with a unique mix of backgrounds from the technology, consulting and financial services industries. Our responsibilities include driving strategy and growth through monetization, pricing/packaging, and other go-to-market initiatives, as well as leading the ongoing business operations that support this growth. We encourage decision-making at every level and highly value an open-minded approach and organizational transparency. We embed work closely with leadership across multiple other functions including marketing, analytics, finance, sales, product, and more to support the company’s continued growth. You'll join a team that is not only intelligent, motivated, and passionate about Atlassian's products and customers, but also fun to work with. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. The Supportability and Insights team are a high impact and visible group that plays the important role of bringing our support teams together with product management and engineering. We bring support insights to product teams, improve supportability, drive down production friction, build and manage escalation channels, and ensure change is a positive experience for our customers. This Senior Manager role is a newly created role established to help the team scale with the growing needs of Atlassian. You will report to the existing Supportability and Insights Leader and manage a team of strategically focussed and experienced analysts. On Your First Day, We'll Expect That You have more than 5 years in a leadership role in a large software or Cloud services company You are experienced with data and data professionals and making data-driven decisions You are experienced working with, aligning with and presenting to executives across multiple departments in a large compan You have a working knowledge of how Customer Support and Product development teams work, and how they can best work together. Depth in coaching and leading successful product, support or analyst teams with a proven ability to foster a sense of team and mission and the ability to build trust, respect, and empathy In This Role You Will Be an exemplary people manager to the members of this team which includes unblocking and enabling, mentorship and career development Be the driver of several Customer Support key results to ensure the department delivers on their strategic objectives Partner with Supportability and Insights leaders to develop the long term strategic direction of the team Work across a wide product portfolio, be given broad problems with wide-ranging solutions and the opportunity to approach it with your team in whichever way has the biggest impact. Contribute to the long-term product strategy and work with stakeholders to define appropriate goals and OKRs to track progress More about our team We challenge each other constantly to improve our work and ask hard questions. Your future team Our Customer Analytics team is comprised of individuals with backgrounds in data science and analytics. We collect, organize and analyze data to help our business partners make informed decisions. We're looking for an Analytics & Data Science leader (Manager or Senior Manager) with business instincts, team development, creativity and analytics mastery. Someone who is passionate about applying these skills to lead multiple analytics teams, guide smarter product decisions, and delight our customers. This is a role that will stretch you, accelerate your learning curve and give you the chance to really leave your mark in the history of Atlassian. What you'll do Collaborate with Atlassian's product leaders (responsible for www.atlassian.com , support.atlassian.com & community.atlassian.com ) to provide data-driven viewpoints on strategic decisions, identify high impact opportunities for analysis and align priorities with the company strategy and product roadmap Lead a team of data scientists and plan roadmaps by collaborating with product partners, customer research, data engineers, machine learning engineers and other data scientists Design targeted explorations of our big data, to understand trends, find opportunities, and make recommendations to improve user journeys and customer value Accelerate web experimentation through best practices, tooling and clear recommendations Be part of building an outstanding analytics culture at Atlassian. Leading by example, through education and creation of self-service tools, to make a lasting change in how your partners use data to make decisions Your background 3+ years leading analytics or data science teams Experience applying your analytics to projects which have had a positive impact to company level business and product decisions A very high bar for output quality; with experience coaching teams to balance thoughtfulness, perfection and speed Craft compelling insights, explaining data science concepts to diverse audiences, and building decision confidence by sharing expertise of facts and uncertainties Familiarity partnering with multiple departments. For example: Product Management, Engineering, Design, Finance, Customer Research and Data Engineering teams Experience encouraging teamwork in a "work from anywhere" environment Previous experience in data manipulation and statistical programming languages (e.g. SQL, R, Python), and knowledge of cloud data environments (e.g. AWS) Varied experience applying a range of data science techniques (eg: exploratory data analysis, experiment design, propensity modeling or attribution) An Agile development mentality, appreciating the benefit of constant iteration and improvement Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. The Atlassian Marketplace is one of the largest B2B app stores globally and has exceeded $2B in lifetime sales since launching in 2012. As a Sr Business Process Analyst you will help support the growth and continued expansion of our Marketplace Partners Ecosystem by enhancing workflow and systems related to strategic planning, partner app plan development and launch process, pipeline and forecasting of partner app development and accelerating the migration to Cloud. You will assess adoption of programs and initiatives, identify risks and recommend improvements. There will be opportunities to enhance automation and integration between Atlassian systems and explore AI capabilities to uncover app recommendations and next best actions to improve upsell and cross-sell opportunities. You will work closely with Developer Experience to improve the on-ramp and ease of launching new apps, as well as the Technical Partner Managers (TPMs) to refine the partner account planning process and develop a forecasting model for Marketplace R&D and cloud migration. You will be within the global Marketplace Partnerships organization reporting to the Operations leader, and will be highly cross-functional with teams across Atlassian's global footprint, including: Developer Experience, Marketing, Sales/Sales Strategy, Channels, Commerce, Engineering teams, Customer Experience (CX), and Analytics and Enablement. You will implement solutions composed of business processes, systems infrastructure and/or shared services execution. What you'll do Understand Atlassian's Developer Experience and Marketplace Programs, their requirements and benefits, and ensure support and adoption of those programs Support daily operations of our Marketplace program and tools, including support for internal and external stakeholders Review Developer Experience and Marketplace program key priorities, assess business impact of their projects and required investment, and prioritize implementation across programs/projects on an ongoing basis Contribute to the support and operationalization of the Developer Experience and Marketplace strategy through continual improvements to process, systems, and tools supporting our various channel routes to market Focus on recommending process improvement and efficiencies through process analysis. User experience, observations, industry trends, standard methodologies (Design Thinking, Six Sigma, Lean), leading-edge technology and process improvement ideas and deliver extraordinary partner and customer-focused solutions. Identify and execute on opportunities for process automation and optimization, with a focus on scalability and driving growth Collaborate with our Developer Experience and Marketplace program leadership team and product managers for roadmap planning and prioritization Collaborate with reporting and analytics teams to ensure we are tracking the right metrics for the business to measure/monitor the health and effectiveness of partners, programs, products and routes to market Your background Minimum 5 years of experience in Sales/Channel Operations or enterprise systems implementation project management within a SaaS company or in a consulting environment. Excellent business acumen. You are familiar with traditional product development and B2B sales environments. You engage confidently with the user community, ranging from people who execute processes daily to executive management. Able to identify assumptions made by business stakeholders about needs and solution approaches, then develop and execute methods to validate them. You have a natural talent for solution design. You strive to keep processes as simple as possible while delivering key business objectives. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work/influence across organizational and subject matter boundaries, especially between business and IT teams. You also are sufficiently versed in IT to negotiate scope and assess basic levels of efforts required for implementation. You revere Agile methodologies. We will conduct lots of experiments and count on you to fail fast, but succeed often. Experience rolling out programs within a sales organization, from project justification (ROI) to requirements gathering, solution design, cross-functional execution to launch and change management. You see opportunities for improvement everywhere around you and are ready to swim-lane them all out. Data-centric and analytical with fine attention to detail, but can also see the bigger picture Understanding of the channel sales process. Experience with channel distribution models. Understanding the Marketplace is a plus! Experience with Salesforce, Partner Communities, or other PRM solutions Bachelors Degree required Team player at heart An extreme sense of ownership and responsibility. You get $#!t done. Excellent communication skills. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Atlassian is one of the fastest-growing software companies in the world, with millions of users across our products (Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello, to name a few.) We're making significant investment in experience design, seeking to make Atlassian products crucial for all Teams. We're growing our global design organization and searching for passionate, hard working designers to help us. Are you a designer with a passion for crafting enterprise grade experiences? We are revolutionizing the software industry and helping teams collaborate and craft the magic in delivering their best work. Think NASA launching the Rover on Mars or Cochlear gifting children born deaf with the ability to hear, your work directly impacts the products they use to advance humanity. We are looking for a Senior Designer to join the Cloud Security team. This team is made up of seasoned experts who currently deliver value to all Atlassian Enterprise products - fun, talented, hardworking who all enjoy playing and working together to define the future of our enterprise platform. If you are dedicated to the user experience, love solving problems and thrive on variety, this is a great opportunity for you. As a Senior Designer for Cloud Security, you'll work with a small, cross-functional team of Designers, Engineers and Product Managers to innovate the way development teams build amazing software. If you want to make a meaningful impact on products that people rely on and use everyday, this is an outstanding opportunity. You'll work on compelling design initiatives and deliver cutting-edge developer tools. You will be involved in early stage research and ideation, implementation, and iteration. Ultimately you'll be responsible for crafting a powerful and intuitive user experience for Developers all around the globe. In This Role, You'll Have The Opportunity To Work on designing the core user experiences for Cloud Security, an integral part of our Enterprise platform. Facilitate workshops with designers, engineers, product managers and customers for potential solutions to the identified problems in the most effective way Design experiences that make complex tasks simple for our users Partner closely with other product teams, Product Designers, Product Managers, Engineering & Program Management Join a high-performing team at the forefront of empowering team collaboration On your first day, we'll expect you will be able to: 6+ years hands-on professional experience as a UX Designer or Product Designer Work across the entire end-to-end design process, from very early-stage research and ideation to iteration and implementation A passion for design thinking methods with a deep understanding and a high degree of empathy for the people who experience your work Anticipate design problems and decisions and recommends alternatives Show solid research knowledge, i.e. you can define what user research needs to be done (and you're excited to do some yourself) and use existing research findings in your work Be comfortable in facilitation, communication and collaboration abilities. Have a flexible and friendly approach to working with teams, and the attitude to always strive for the best outcomes Work alongside a fellow designer, product manager and engineers to optimize the experience for how customers interact with Jira experiences Bonus points for experience using Service Design as a means of improving end-to-end experiences More About Our Team Product Designers at Atlassian are responsible for the complete user experience, from early-stage research and ideation, through implementation and iteration based on key success metrics. We challenge each other constantly and ask hard questions. You can be assured that you will join a smart team passionate about creating the best user experience possible and committed to delivering what users need to feel connected with our products. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Trello is growing its Enterprise team in 2022, and we want you to help craft the future of this part of our product. Trello is used at scale in large organizations around the world: IBM, Bloomberg, John Deere, just to name a few. These teams have specific needs that come with the size of their organizations. The team you’ll join will be crafting new features that allow enterprise admins to have more control over how their teams access, collaborate, and adopt Trello across their organizations. Additionally, we are going to make it easier for growing teams to buy our enterprise features without the help of the Trello team, allowing them to scale seamlessly. The opportunity for design is to transform the Enterprise product experience, making it a delight to use at scale for large teams. As a designer for Trello Enterprise, you have the unique opportunity to leave your mark on our well-loved product. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 6+ years of hands-on professional experience as a UX Designer or Product Designer in increasingly senior roles, designing, and shipping products. Past experience working on enterprise products A demeanor of resiliency. You are able to hear user feedback (sometimes tough) and look for ways to tackle real-world problems. Your seniority is obvious when it comes to harnessing the energy of a large and highly skilled product team. This means strong facilitation and collaboration abilities, a flexible and friendly approach to working with teams, and the demeanor to lead teams toward the best design outcomes. You have experience working across product teams and managing and communicating with a diverse range of partners. You have incredible communication skills, in multiple settings: one on ones, group meetings, and written communication. You can translate highly technical content to non-technical people, and more importantly into our user’s language. You have robust experience with customer research and know when to apply the right methodology to the problem at hand. You've developed a deep understanding and a high degree of compassion for the people who experience your work. You are comfortable defining projects and measures of success, testing your assumptions and outcomes, and continuously incorporating feedback. You have the ability to apply your design skills in research, interaction design, and visual design to help craft and build new features. You balance data-informed insights alongside synthesizing customer research streams. Importantly, you have strong execution skills too, and are adept in modern tools such as Figma, Mural, and Keynote. You use prototyping frameworks in your workflow. The Corporate data engineering team manages multiple analytical data models, data pipelines, and Enterprise BI products for teams across Atlassian. We ingest data in Atlassian's data lake and build creative and reliable analytics data model that provides a unified way of analyzing our customers, our products, our operations and the interactions among them. We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to join the Data Engineering team with a specific focus on our People team. Reporting to the Group Product Manager, Data and Analytics - you'll have a huge opportunity to expand on existing offerings and create your very own. Join our efforts in unlocking the value of data through democratization at scale and build exceptional and trusted data products for the company. You will work to understand and explore the needs of business analysts, accountants, data scientists, and product teams. By then combining this understanding with knowledge of data engineering you can then define and implement a delivery roadmap. You will also dive in to Atlassian's data lake to use common services. You will lead projects in an agile way, work to transform ambiguous asks to structured requirements, and become a trusted partner with business teams. Partner and work closely with engineering team to translate product requirements into actionable deliverables. There is no shortage of new opportunities to leverage data and to integrate data or applications to enhance business value. You will partner with business stakeholders on crafting a roadmap that delivers value regularly. Lastly, proactively monitor industry, functional, and technology trends to guide business partners on emerging opportunities. What you'll do 5+ years of data product management experience, ideally at a high-growth company Experience partnering with business teams in setting the vision for data needs and translating it into a product roadmap Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, data pipeline design, experience in writing SQL. Extensive experience with querying and data visualization tools Experience with the People (HR) processes namely Recruiting, Employee Lifecycle, Compensation, Performance. Experience working with People (HR) technology stack (Ex: Workday, Lever, Qualtrics) Develop and defend strong points of view with data and analytics Outstanding track record of building relationships and influencing without authority at all levels of the organization. You'll make sure everyone is on the same page on Slack / Atlas / Jira or email! Your background Experience working with Finance technology stack(Ex: Netsuite, RevPro, Coupa) is a plus Prior experience working for a SaaS company Worked with structured, unstructured, and graph data BE/BS/BA with an emphasis in technology, IT, or operations; Graduate level qualification is ideal Strong technical background - you're a PM by trade, but love geeking out over phenomenal technical ideas from time to time Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Job Description Atlassian is looking for a highly collaborative, experienced product marketer to join our IT Product Marketing team and own our most strategic launches & go-to-market initiatives. You’ll drive awareness and demand for our IT Service Management (ITSM) solution, Jira Service Management , by developing the strategy and working cross-functionally across Atlassian to execute our biggest launches through a variety of channels . To be successful, you must be collaborative in nature and ready to partner with multiple teams across the business, including product, program, events, brand, sales, strategy & business operations, marketing analytics, PR, and more. What you'll do Lead go-to-market efforts and launches for our ITSM solution Work closely with our PMM team and cross-functional teams such as events, product, program management, brand & creative, sales, marketing analytics, PR, and more to drive GTM initiatives, launches, and annual customer events from the bottom up (examples include: High Velocity: ITSM World Tour event and acquisition announcements ) Raise awareness and demand for Atlassian's ITSM solution in the market, including with customers, partners, press, and industry analysts Define strategy of Atlassian's participation in third-party events (in-person and digital) in the ITSM space, including identifying speaking opportunities for subject matter experts in the organization Lead strategic product marketing projects as needed About You You have 6+ years of experience working very cross-functionally and influencing teams to bring complex, hairy launches to market You see the big picture across a large organization and have experience designing and rolling out GTM strategies from scratch - including events, web, email, enablement, events, content, lifecycle marketing, community, etc. You know how to prioritize work efficiently and anticipate blockers, knowing when to escalate if necessary You have a data-oriented mindset and are thinking about how outcomes tie to team and business goals You thrive in an ever-changing environment and embrace working on several different projects simultaneously You can vocalize when things are not going well - and recommend solutions You're a passionate, self-starter with a no-bullshit, can-do attitude You're a phenomenal communicator and writer B2B product marketing experience preferred Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. The Product Security team is responsible for making sure Atlassian products and services are safe. We are looking for a great Product Security Manager who thrives on managing a team of security engineers and working with development teams to secure their products. Your responsibilities will include managing and mentoring a team of security engineers, planning and executing security projects, consulting with product teams, reviewing platform and service designs, and finding ways to empower engineering teams to build secure products by default. You must have an interest in working with colleagues to understand our products and improve the existing security infrastructure. Most of the code we work with is in Java, Python, or Go. As part of the focus on learning at Atlassian, you'll be able to spend up to 20% of your time on independent research. More About Our Team We are a small focused group who is committed to protecting the security of our customers and of Atlassian itself. We work both independently and in collaboration with development teams as we assess and mitigate security issues in our products. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 3+ years working in security 3+ years managing a team A solid understanding of web application security Significant experience in cloud security architecture and infrastructure Experience coding in Java, Python, or Go, and at least one scripting language An ability to reason about security decisions Experience leading projects from start to finish An ability to communicate ideas clearly and effectively to engineers who know way more than you about their code It's Great, But Not Required, If You Have Security consulting experience Published contributions to the security community Presentation experience at industry events Experience working with compliance, privacy, IT, networking or related functions Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Senior Program Manager, Market Solutions (Agile / DevOps)
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Job Summary As a Senior Program Manager in Atlassian's Customer Success and Innovation (CSI) Strategy and Operations team, you will be responsible for driving strategic programs across our CSI team and Atlassian teams in service for one of our solution verticals. You'll help build a team of cross-functional subject matter experts (SME) who will execute on work ranging from short-term experiments to long-term initiatives to drive value delivery outcomes, as well as deepen our understanding of customer needs and behavior. The ultimate outcome of these programs is to further empower our teams to provide exceptional service with current and future customers. If you're someone who loves bringing order to chaos and building something new - this role is for you! While this role primarily serves CSI, building partnerships across the business with Product, Sales, and GTM roles serving our solution spaces (IT Service Management, Agile Dev Ops, or Work Management) will be paramount to completing the full customer journey view of how we help our customers for their service management needs. You are the customer champion to these broader teams; synthesizing and packaging business insights and bottlenecks in terms of quantifiable impact to the customer experience as product improvements, process changes, and more to better serve our customers at scale. What you'll do Establish structure and momentum from ambiguity. This is an exciting opportunity to create structure and momentum with a new team from the ground up. You'll organize experiments and larger programs to measure customer behaviors and outcomes, which may result in new service offerings in the service management portfolio. Lead cross-functional program work across globally distributed teams. As the connector to the globally-distributed team serving your program, you will empower your team do their best work via smoothing out collaboration across groups, identifying hot spots in team health, and advocating for your team's needs to leadership. Challenging decisions, questioning judgment, and voicing when exec/leader/team is wrong is strongly encouraged in this role. Drive visibility to the program and work. Your team will be doing incredible, impactful work for our customers engaged in service management - and communicating team focus, new deliverables, learnings, and wins to CSI upward and outward (and the broader business) will be key to creating broader collaboration opportunities, broaden your program network and influence, and bridge silos across the business. Develop a network of partnerships across Atlassian. You will foster collaboration and learning opportunities across Product, Sales, Marketing and Service Design to drive support for continuous improvements initiatives and mitigating risks and bottlenecks in service of the ITSM customer journey. Grow solution practices. As part of long-term ownership of your program, you will have a key stake in informing program direction with your core team and senior leadership via translating the learnings and insights from your team into actionable changes and business cases for the broader business to own and advocate for roadmap prioritization and. Building for scale and maturation, you will keep an eye on shepherding your program from "Form" (eg experimental) to "Norm" (operational) through introducing and streamlining cadences, work breakdown and planning, implementing measures of success and more. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 7+ years of project and program management experience with technical customer-facing teams at scale Experience in Customer Success Strategy, Programs, or Operations Demonstrated ability to plan and deliver work with agile frameworks Excellent written and verbal communication skills Advanced program management knowledge Experience with enterprise SaaS software professional services and delivery Hands-on experience with Jira and Confluence is a plus. Ability to travel 10% of the time for strategic offsites More About CSI Team It's all right there in the name when you join the Atlassian Customer Success and Innovation team you are at the heart of empowering our customers to do more with our products as they unleash the potential in their teams. You will contribute to customer success by tackling challenges head-on and providing unparalleled knowledge and best practices around our solutions. We are big on distributed collaboration and are passionate about our customer-first culture. Working in this team at Atlassian, you'll have a direct impact on some of our biggest accounts, fast. You won't get frustrated with bureaucracy or slow decision-making because we encourage innovative thinking. We don't just want to know your opinions; we want to see your ideas in action. We hire great people and then trust them to be great. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more.
