Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian's mission is to help "unleash the potential of every team" and this is the guiding light behind everything we do. We have developed well-known products (e.g. Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence, Trello) that fit in the fabric of teamwork across different types of teams and the processes to help every team succeed. Your future team The Work Management for All (WM4A) team is building and delivering powerful and unique products such as Confluence, Trello and other products to bring Atlassian products and ways of working to all knowledge workers. As a Senior Program Manager in WM4A, you will help drive strategic cross-functional program across WM4A and make it a reality. You will report to the Head of Program Management, WM4A but will work closely with leaders across Atlassian to deliver on the WM4A strategy. You have a solid balance of versatile program management leadership and technical capabilities. You will also align technical architecture with an understanding of the product strategy. This will allow the team to make decisions to accelerate programs at any level of depth. What you'll do Program management Work across R&D teams for a smooth execution of our strategy. Lead our teams to plan, set goals, execute, and learn Run complex, strategic projects (ranging from technical delivery and analytical deep dives to operational efficiencies) Design and take charge of meaningful dashboards and readouts for key executives Champion and cultivate cross-team relationships to organize and manage dependencies Coordinate work "on the team" such as team health exercises, decision-making plays, and org size/shape assessment. Lead strategic off-sites and associated planning rituals Your background 7+ years of relevant professional experience working with product, engineering, design and related functions Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business, Computer Science or related field (or equivalent experience) Have experience in diagnosing pain points for teams, moving them to 'good', and committing to ensuring they get to 'great' Experience working with remote, global, and cross-functional teams and matrix organizations, and an understanding of SaaS business models and enterprise sales Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. To help our teams work together effectively, this role requires you to be located in the Pacific Time Zone. Your future team Do you love research, working with people, and excel at applying insights to influence product design and strategy? Atlassian is looking for a Senior Research Manager for Data to join our growing team of research experts. Reporting to the Global Head of Research, you will work with a cross functional, collaborative group that is helping Atlassian achieve our mission to unleash the potential of teams all over the world. This is a unique role supporting several of the important products, services and teams who are responsible for defining and bringing to life Atlassian's data strategy. You'll grow and manage a team of researchers who will work with our data teams to provide better services and experiences for our customers through the use of data. This is an area we are investing in heavily and our Research team is at the heart of helping uncover what our teams need to help them work prioritize the impactful work and execute effectively. Our research team is a group of passionate mixed methods researchers, spread across the globe. We work together to continuously improve our craft as researchers and our ability to support Atlassian to build better experiences for our customers and users. Experience helping shape strategy and priorities for senior leadership teams at a program level. Experience hiring and managing researchers, research managers and research teams, guiding their craft, management capabilities and career development. 5+ years of hands-on experience designing and conducting high-quality user research (qualitative and quantitative) that has had an impact. Examples of research communication that influences and inspires change. You know how to advocate for research and researchers; you rely on qualitative and quantitative data to create effective ways of reinforcing your team's insights so they resonate and are impactful across diverse audiences, you work in an open and collaborative way. It would be nice if you had, but we appreciate you popping your hat in the ring: Experience doing or managing research in a highly technical domain, especially in data, data engineering, machine learning, ad technology or other data intensive domains OR a technical or data background. Postgraduate qualifications are a bonus, particularly in the areas of psychology, anthropology, sociology, human factors or a related subject area. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Your future team At Atlassian, we are on a mission to reinvent B2B selling. We know that classic high-pressure B2B sales tactics don't work anymore. We have built a billion dollar, fast-growing business without any of those tactics, based on high-quality products, free trials and an intense focus on customer satisfaction. Those happy Customers convert to paying Customers, creating a prolific "Flywheel" that has delivered 200,000+ customers to date. We believe that there is an opportunity to more pro-actively engage with our customers through "Smart Touch" - specific, value-added outbound engagements that will lead to higher conversions and incremental bookings throughout the Customer lifecycle. We also continuously add new products to our portfolio, either organically or through acquisition and make frequent changes to our products and packaging that affect the Field Operations organization (Inside Sales, Strategic Sales, Channels, Customer Service, Sales Consultants,...). We're hiring a Senior Sales Operations Tech Program Manager, reporting to the manager of our Sales Ops PMO. This role is a senior-level individual contributor, with experience driving complex Sales Technology projects. At Atlassian, you will work closely with Sales, Marketing and IT leadership to understand strategy, collect and prioritize demand, and help manage our integrated project roadmap. You will play an important in our Quarterly Planning process, help to lead delivery of initiatives on our joint GTM Roadmap, and manage the relationship between our Sales Ops and IT Sales departments. Key skills include things like project plan administration, supporting requirements gathering and resource, risk and change management. You will be wearing multiple hats as you manage programs through their lifecycle, and the hats may change from project to project - flexibility and adaptability are key in this fast paced environment. What you'll do Lead our project pipeline and Quarterly Planning processes across our Field sales teams, including Direct Sales, Renewals, Channel, and our Advocate teams. Ensure alignment of department projects, and investments to the quarterly and yearly OKRs. Provide support for staffing requirements and highlight and reduce resource contention across the portfolio. Liaise with IT Program Management to coordinate the IT and Business roadmaps, and ensure alignment of priorities and timelines. Provide day-to-day support for the management of projects within our portfolio. These may be Enterprise-wide transformation programs impacting the whole company, or tactical initiatives that require your skillset to get them done. Activities will include the creation/management of program charters, staffing plans, project plans, risk & issue management, communications plans, RACIs, and project governance, including status meetings and steering committees. Work closely with your IT PM counterparts to ensure we are managing projects holistically across business & IT work streams, to eliminate blind spots and roadblocks. Drive alignment across the Field organization and other departments through clear communication and change management practices. Ensure stakeholders are properly engaged at the right stages in the project lifecycle. Manage cross-functional and cross-geo collaboration - our teams span the globe, and so do our projects. Your background Minimum 4 years in Consulting and/or Business Operations, ideally within a high-growth technology company. Minimum 5 years of experience in a Program Management or Senior Project Management role, with experience leading Enterprise-level projects. Deep understanding of change management processes and best practices, including external and internal audiences. Proficiency in the Atlassian project management & collaboration stack, and comfortable leveraging technology to bridge the geo divide. Experience as a ScrumMaster and leveraging Agile practices with Business team. Working with a variety of SDLC methodologies, and the ability to determine the best fit for your projects. Excellent business acumen. You have a solid understanding of B2B sales GTM strategies and operations, and have something to contribute in our roadmap planning discussions with executive leadership and key stakeholders. Metrics-driven. You use data to frame, inform and guide the prioritization and decision making process, to manage the health of your programs through delivery, and to assess the success and impact once you are done. This may include ROI analysis, capacity planning and budgeting, TCO analysis, revenue modeling and more. An ability to think strategically but dive into details when needed. Atlassian is a dynamic, fast-paced company, so adaptability and flexibility are a must. Strong influencing skills. As an individual contributor, you will rely on lots of other people to help define the plan and get it executed. Excellent communication skills and executive presence. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Behind every great human achievement, there is a team. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, our products help teams all over the planet advance humanity through the power of software. Atlassian’s mission is to help unleash the potential of every team. The Atlassian Trust Team's mission is to build trust in every team. We endeavor to lead our peers in cloud and product security, meet all customer requirements for cloud security and privacy, and exceed requirements for industry standards and certifications. A core part of our strategy is to design a trusted development process, production environment and platform that make it easy for Atlassian’s own engineering teams to build trust into all of our cloud products. We are looking for an Sr. Architect that can help us build this trusted platform for all of our cloud products, while working in concert with the broader Trust Organization and all of Atlassian engineering. About The Role The Senior Architect for Trust and Security is responsible for developing a principled and actionable vision for security, compliance, and trust efforts at Atlassian. They will work with a global team of over 100 security professionals to drive standards and architectural patterns that enhance security, privacy, and trust capabilities and reduce duplication of effort across all of Atlassian’s cloud products. As a senior technical leader, you would be asked to: Represent security, privacy, and anti-abuse perspectives among architects, product managers, and designers. Resolve ambiguity regarding emerging security needs outside the scope of existing teams, capabilities, and programs. Anticipate emerging opportunities and needs. Clarify context and roadmap; route them to a team or program - or propose creating one. Coordinate planning and requirements gathering when they pertain to multiple organizations, security teams, or programs. Act as the highest level for technical escalation for internal, customer, partner or vendor security questions. Publish, speak, or otherwise represent the Atlassian security organization publicly, and via internal conferences and knowledge sharing. Some examples of platform architecture whose technical evolution you may help drive in your first year: Access management – creation of a centralized secret management system and integration of that system throughout our cloud infrastructure. Communication Security - unified strategy for VPC and environment segmentation cross our AWS infrastructure. Data Security - data classification and unification of classification into Continuous Control Monitoring and our Policy as Code effort. Operations - instrumentation of deployment pipeline to enable integration with production environment including asset attribution and security monitoring. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Extensive experience as a platform architect within an enterprise SaaS company with a global engineering organization and customer base. Expertise in SaaS architecture on AWS or other public cloudsDeep technical knowledge in Security, Privacy, Compliance requirements. Experience with product and platform strategy in order to help prioritize projects, look for partnership opportunities and identify missing capabilities. Experience in making platform capabilities easy to discover and adopt for internal and external developers. Deep experience communicating complex technical topics to teams and individuals outside of security with varying levels of technical expertise. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. The Customer Success Innovation (CSI) Services Engineering Team oversees the design, development, and launch of Customer Success, Support & Services commercial offerings that provide expert guidance, design, and problem resolution to help customers get the most business value from their Atlassian technology. As a Customer Support Offerings Manager in our Services Engineering team, you will steward Atlassian's support offer lifecycle from concept to delivery. You will develop market and customer analysis to inform an innovation process with the customer support teams, in service of developing new or improved customer support offerings. In this highly visible role, your job is to lead the day-to-day definition, operationalization, and commercialization of Atlassian's customer support packages. What You'll Do Lead the support product development roadmap, including managing and grooming the backlog, building the development process, and communicating roadmap changes to partners Analyze market and customer research to shape the development of support proposals Identify offers to be packaged and priced, balancing customer success with revenue growth Drive offering development programs with a cross-functional group of SMEs and team members from concept, to test, and from beta through to launch in market Create enablement and commercialization assets to support offerings, including sell sheets, slides, and guides Develop pricing and packaging recommendations for our offerings with a clear understanding of scope, delivery operations, and revenue impact Gather feedback from customers and cross-functional teams to measure the efficacy of the launched offers, and improve as needed Manage the implementation of support SKUs across pricing, legal, and operations teams Maintain operational and technical aspects of the support portfolio, including iterations on pricing, delivery, and terms and conditions Your Background 7+ years experience in a professional services, customer success or customer support role at a SaaS company, with dedicated experience building support or services offerings Experience leading Go-to-market activities to launch customer support or professional service offerings Experience building and supporting service offerings for the fortune 500 and broader enterprise use cases Hands-on skills with business and financial modeling including margin models, utilization, and revenue forecast Strong market analysis skills with a deep commitment to customer outcomes Demonstrable track record with end-to-end product management in the customer support, professional services, or related SaaS space Continuous partnership, engagement, and alignment with field and BU partners to establish sustainable, trusted relationships Experience with agile product management through the full lifecycle: strategy, development, launch, and optimization Experience collaborating with product management and customer support and customer success leaders on technical design and proposing simple solutions to complex problems Experience launching and learning from V1 offerings Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Senior Site Reliability Engineer, Enterprise Agility
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Love staying ahead of the cloud growth curve and experimenting with new software and environments? Get on board as an Atlassian Senior Site Reliability Engineer. As an Engineer in the Enterprise Agility Site Reliability Engineering team, you'll build solutions to enhance availability, performance and stability for the hundreds of Atlassian enterprise customers in the Cloud as well as automating away repetitive work. You will help secure the cloud architecture with penetration testing, vulnerability resolution and compliance audit responses. You'll be working on non-production and production environments, monitoring, data collection and configuration management, as well as disaster recovery planning, capacity engineering, reliability improvement initiatives, and platform automation. You'll also respond to pings, pages and alerts to investigate issues in our products that you can really sink your teeth into. The best person for this role is someone that has a collaborative spirit - in our world, it's not about being a hero and having all the answers, it's about sometimes saying "I don't know" and working on finding solutions rather than starting with an assumption. The team needs someone who can ask questions, learn from others and turn chaos into order. This role would be a great fit for someone with creative and innovative problem solving skills and a willingness to take responsibility for the code you write all the way to production. You will develop and implement solutions that operate at scale - seeing your own technology efforts directly improve the reliability of our products. Our teams are empowered and expected to improve our products to truly deliver a reliable experience to customers. You will own development efforts in each and every sprint from planning to delivery to realize this goal and collaborate with different team to review code. One thing we promise: You'll never be bored. On Your First Day, You Will Have Experience In Required understanding of Windows systems Network security, encryption technology, and roles permission mgmg Previous experience in compliance industries SOC2, ISO27k, HIPAA Software development in Python or Powershell Hands on experience with cloud infrastructure AWS/Azure - minimum of 3 years Experience monitoring distributed systems application architecture with tools like Splunk/SignalFX Experience using Configuration Management tools like Terraform, Cloud Formation Template Serious troubleshooting skills across different levels of the stack: Network, IAM roles, EC2, RDS, DynamoDB Exposure to and maintenance of configuration management and orchestration tools at scale Experience troubleshooting deployment/Orchestration Tools (Octopus Deploy, Jenkins) We'd Be Super Excited If You Have Software development expertise in Golang or Java Understanding of terminology like incident, problem, SLO, MTBF Build systems (bitbucket, bamboo) More About Our Team Atlassian Site Reliability Engineering is a rapidly growing group within the organization. We are in the process of building our teams, tools and systems as part of Atlassian's mission to build the best SaaS services in the world. This is a truly exciting team to join - we are currently or are planning to be involved with every technical team across Atlassian. We enable Atlassian to go fast by providing real time feedback on production systems. We work side by side with the product family and platform developers to maintain and improve services and performance. We live the company values with a strong customer focus and possess a healthy sense of urgency. We are a heavily data driven team, utilizing a variety of data collection, enrichment, analytics and visualizations to learn about our complex systems. We also live the 'Play, as a team' value by having a strong focus on sharing learning experiences from the front line with the development teams. So, the options for people in the team are vast. If you like mastering a domain and going deep, we need you. If you can juggle three tasks and coordinate multiple people in the heat of an incident, we need you. If you love the benefits of process and methodical improvement, you will love it here. If you want to keep your head down, headphones on and bash out code to support the team, we have a spot for you too. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian helps teams everywhere change the world. Our products are revolutionising the software industry and helping teams collaborate and craft the magic that delivers their best work. Think NASA launching the Rover on Mars or Cochlear gifting those born deaf with the ability to hear, your work directly impacts the products they use to advance humanity. We are looking for an experienced Software Engineer who is passionate about building scalable cloud services to join our growing Enterprise SRE team. You'll be joining a brand new mission critical team focused on delivering our flagship products (Jira, JSM, Confluence) to Enterprise customers, tackling issues and escalations at the highest customer/user scale. You’ll design and implement infrastructure solutions for scalability, reliability, high availability, performance, security, software maintainability, and operational excellence. You’ll also support services before they go live through activities such as system design consulting, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning, and launch reviews. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Hands-on experience with public cloud offerings (AWS components like EC2, CloudFormation, RDS, S3, DynamoDB, SQS, Kinesis - or equivalents, e.g. in GCP / Azure) Strong backend engineering experience in at least one modern object-oriented programming language (e.g., Python, C#, Java, Kotlin etc.) Experience building web-services and clients. Engagement to debug, optimise code, and automate routine tasks. Strong organisational and interpersonal skills, with experience developing and instilling a culture of operational maturity. It's Great If You Have Experience with Database administration; Managing RDS/Postgres infrastructure will be highly valued. Experience in microservice architecture. Experience in Site Reliability Engineering and/or operating large scale systems. Experience building monitoring into your code, tweaking dashboards, defining alerts, writing runbooks. jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Atlassian is looking for a passionate software engineer to join our Developer Productivity Services team. You'll be working to design and develop code quality infrastructure and tools that will help us to deliver awesome products such as Jira, Trello, and Confluence! Dedicated to elevating developer productivity, the DPS team is part of the Development Tooling team with members in the U.S., and Sydney. We love the technology, and we love working with each other! We follow an agile process and leverage the latest technologies from open source and the industry. Key Responsibilities Comfortable owning the infrastructure and pragmatically solving problems dealing with complex systems. Working with developers to support the latest features that we have in development, such as test analytics, dependency management, and code quality analytics. On your first day, we’d love you to have: 5+ years experience in a similar build engineering or tools development role Strong coding skills: Node.js , Python, Go, or Java Proficiency with containerization and cloud technologies: Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, AWS Successful track record of shipping production quality APIs and/or microservices Strong interpersonal skills and an interest in working collaboratively with team members all over the world Passion about developer happiness Good written and verbal communication skills You have experience making progress through product experimentation You value progress over perfection and have a track record of shipping value to customers. It's Great, But Not Required If You Have Knowledge of: Renovate, npm, pip, maven, Gradle Experience with build and dependency tools Experience with infrastructure management tools such as Terraform or Ansible Experience working with agile software development methodologies Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Are you interested in helping to improve the working lives of people at the largest enterprise companies around the world, while solving problems with proven market demand? Responsibilities Enterprise Agility is looking for an experienced Senior Software Engineer (preferably a Full Stack Engineer with a strong backend focus) located in the US to join our team of trailblazers. This is a great opportunity to contribute to a greenfield development effort right at the starting gate! You’ll be an integral part of building a new Enterprise Agility application, which will likely involve: Collaborating with product and design to chart a path for our customers. Designing and building application APIs and business logic, and also contributing to user experience development. Implementing data ingestion pipelines and integrations with Atlassian products and third party applications. Building reports based on financial and investment data with our Analytics and Visualization Platform. Maintaining operational excellence via CICD pipelines and production alerting and monitoring schemes. Mentoring new engineers and teammates. Required Qualifications You have 7+ years of experience in software development and a proven track record of delivering customer value. You have experience building a service from the ground up – from requirements gathering, designing, implementation, deployment, and ownership. You’re an expert on modern backend technologies (particularly Java w/ Spring Boot or Kotlin, REST, GraphQL, and SQL) as well as cloud technologies (especially AWS, but also Azure or GCP). You’ve worked with modern micro-service architectures and are comfortable with Docker/Kubernetes. You have experience building integrations and data synchronizations with event pub/sub models. You’re comfortable working with ambiguous requirements and quick iterations. You know a lot, but you’re ready to learn even more. You’re a collaboration champion, an experienced team leader, and a great communicator. Experience with DDD/CQRS is a plus! More About Our Team Our application acts as the strategy hub for executive teams leading agile software companies to supercharge investment decisions and empower every team with the context needed to drive real impact. By leveraging the Atlassian Platform and tightly integrating with other Atlassian products, we bring together team, project, and program-level data to allow informed decision-making about investments and strategy. You’ll be working with a team of 9 other engineers, and be part of a growing organization within Atlassian focused on empowering Agile and delivering value to enterprise customers. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. If you are passionate about software and finding solutions to problems through agility, we want to talk with you! You will be a key contributor to the Jira Align Engineering Team, which strives to simplify software at scale by bringing business and software development organizations together in one intuitive platform. In this role, you will be a Senior Software Engineer working with the Jira Align Integrations team on core connectors and API strategy. Leveraging your back-end and SaaS engineering knowledge, you will work in the integrations group of teams taking existing integrations to the next level in areas of quality, and scalability to support millions of users. As a Senior Software Engineer on the Jira Align team, you will be counted on to provide guidance and mentorship with hands-on development of internal development, automation, and continuous integration processes. You will have a lot of autonomy and the opportunity to be involved in many different aspects of Jira Align. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 7+ years of professional experience in a software development team Strong fundamental software development skills Strong proficiency in web-based applications and architecture Experience building and integrating REST APIs Experience building distributed systems for a SaaS product Strong proficiency in building new and evolving existing scalable backends for SaaS-based product Fluency in the Microsoft tech stack / languages (.Net, C#, scripting languages, etc.) with the ability to review code & provide feedback, etc. Experience working with Amazon Web Services Experience on MSSQL database performance optimizations Good written and verbal communication skills Security driven mindset for feature and defect delivery You have experience making progress through product experimentation. You value progress over perfection and have a track record of shipping value to customers. You Will Have The Opportunity To Resolve complex customer issues involving code error diagnosis, debugging, validation, and root cause analysis. Mentor more junior engineers Apply architectural standards to projects Contribute to code reviews Begin writing useful technical documentation It's Great, But Not Required, If You Have Automated deployment and release management tools (ex. Octopus) Browser/JavaScript fundamentals Scripting languages HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery (React is a plus) More About Our Team You’ll be joining a team that is passionate about building great software and quickly iterating on ideas and work to provide customers with continuously improving experience. This team is focused on building features for enterprise-scale customers with improved performance, scalability and security in mind. Our team has a direct impact on the growth of Atlassian. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Job Description We are hiring for multiple Senior level Support Engineering roles to work on our Cloud products and you will report to a Cloud Support Manager. These roles are focused on providing advanced support and product expertise to our largest customer accounts and working with global Atlassian team members. You will join a growing team of specialists focused on improving our support capabilities, capacity, and the quality of the customer support experience. Hours: 10a-7p CST. More About You You will be important for providing a quality experience, bringing new and improved support methodologies to Atlassian, and building a wide and loyal customer base to the Atlassian products and brand. You will perform triage, root cause analysis, debugging, and solving across one-to-many Atlassian products. As part of the team, you will receive onboarding training to make you a specialist in one or more of our products, system technologies, and network technologies. You will lead customer-facing calls communicating progress updates, action plans, and resolution details. You will be part of a team ensuring we have customers for life. Are you passionate about collaborating with knowledgeable teams and about providing high-quality service to the world's largest customers? If so, this role could be perfect for you. Apply and become part of our global team of engineers practicing a follow-the-sun methodology with our other offices around the world to provide the best support possible for our high-priority customers. On your first day, for all of our senior level support roles, we'll expect you to have: 4+ years of experience in support, software services, or system administration for a large end-user community Demonstrate customer empathy Strong troubleshooting methodology Understanding of networks and technologies, including proxies, load balancers, LDAP, Active Directory, SSL, etc. Experience with SQL databases Experience troubleshooting API's Troubleshooting experience of SSL/TLS Experience troubleshooting Java applications Experience with Browser DevTools, HAR files, JavaScript, and Console errors Experience working with enterprise customers is a plus Be able to work the hours of 10-7 CST More About Our Team The team is filled with customer-focused individuals that champion and support industry-leading products used by a growing list of 85K customers globally. We challenge one another every day and hold ourselves accountable for our work, and our customer's overall success. We all enjoy the interactions with customers, problem-solving, digging into complex issues, and advocating for for customers within Atlassian. We wake up every morning asking ourselves how we can improve the customer's experience, the quality of our product, the quality of our support system, or our individual weaknesses. We are not scared of challenges, nor do we back down or get deterred by tough problems. We are at our best when problems seem the hardest, pushing to identify root causes and solutions. We feel that through our roles we can positively help millions of end-users and their experience with Atlassian products. We are open, filled with varied backgrounds and talents, respectful, focused, located around the globe, and all about providing legendary service to our customers. To learn more about working with the Support Team at Atlassian, check out our Support page! For a breakdown of our Enterprise Services and Support groups, here's more information! You understand software development models (Agile, V-model, Waterfall) and methodologies (DevOps, RAD, Scrum, TDD, FDD) You have experience with Version Control Systems such as git, Mercurial, and SVN You have experience with software development practices such as continuous integration and delivery You have advanced relational database experience with most common RDBMS (Postgres, Oracle, mySQL). Operating systems (e.g: Linux, OSX, Windows) Scripting languages (Bash/sh) REST APIs Networking (protocols, proxies, firewalls, authentication and authorization) LDAP Additional Qualifications Experience using or administrating Atlassian Developer Tools (Bitbucket, Bamboo, Fisheye, Crucible) or similar tools (Gitlab, Jenkins) Proficient in cloud and virtualization tech (AWS, Azure, Docker, VMWare) Windows system administration Enterprise LAN/WAN network architectures Data center environments with high availability capabilities Object relational mapping technologies such as Hibernate, Active Objects JVM analysis using thread dumps, heap dumps, and garbage collector logs Debug software using an IDE Use network sniffers to perform advanced network troubleshooting B.S. in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering Daily Expectations Global technical escalation management Work with customers in a written and verbal capacity to resolve application issues, using code error diagnosis, debugging, validation, and root cause analysis Create knowledge-base articles and documentation Perform case reviews to identify trends and improvement areas Monitor queue health to prioritize active tickets and projects Build internal relationships with our development and product management teams to advocate for our customers Mentor your team in becoming experienced support engineers across the Atlassian stack About The Team The team is filled with customer-focused individuals that champion and support industry-leading products used by 50,000+ customers globally. We're looking for an engineer who can analyse and help improve our services and processes to get us to an even higher level of availability, scalability, and reliability. Experience building web-services and clients using REST/GraphQL Experience using container systems like Docker and/or Platform as a Service. Strong organizational and interpersonal skills, with experience developing and instilling a culture of operational maturity. It's Great If You Have Experience with one or more Languages: Java, Kotlin, Python. Experience with Database administration, managing Aurora/Postgres infrastructure will be highly valued Experience in microservice architecture. Experience in Site Reliability Engineering and/or operating large scale systems. jobTitle: Site Reliability Engineering Intern, 2023 Summer U.S.
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. You'll work on our production systems which serve millions of customers worldwide. If they fail, you'll have the skills to deal with pings, pages, queries and problems. We want you to investigate and really sink your teeth into why something didn't work out the way it should. From gaining deep technical knowledge to working on automation, monitoring and virtualized delivery systems, your opportunities for work and play at Atlassian are endless. We guarantee you'll never be bored. Some of the technologies you'll get to work with are Apache, Nginx, Bash, Linux, Envoy, PostgreSQL, AWS, virtualization technologies, observability tools, configuration management, Python, Java, Go, and yes, Atlassian product. Apply for our intern program and start an awesome career! More About Our Team Atlassian Site Reliability is a necessary part of Atlassian's mission to build the best SaaS services in the world. We are at the core of learning for our company, helping Atlassian go fast by providing real time feedback on production systems. We work side by side with the product family and platform developers to maintain services and performance. We are a data-driven team, using a variety of data collection, enrichment, analytics and visualizations to learn about how complex systems operate. Not eligible for Visa sponsorship. Unfortunately, we do not offer U.S. work visa sponsorship to F-1 student graduates at this time. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To be currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and returning to the program after the completion of the internship and graduating by June 2024 Have experience programming in Go, Java, Ruby or Python To be a collaborator with team members near and far Have an interest into industry trends (technology, methods and tooling) Have experience with scripting - we don't want you doing repetitive work! Love to solve complicated problems Are able to commit to a 12 week full-time (40 hours / week) internship during Summer 2023 Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Please note: At this time, this role is only open to entry level candidates with less than a year of professional experience (this does not include internships/co-ops) What you'll do On day one, you will be a valued part of our development team, trusted to make changes to code that directly improve our products, while gaining deep technical knowledge in full life-cycle product development. You'll dream up and code new features that can be shipped straight into our products, all the while being trained by our amazing team. Your background Bachelor's or Masters in Computer Science / Software Engineering or a related technical field and are graduating by June 2023. 1+ years of experience with Java, Python, C, C++, or other related object-oriented programming languages Desire to collaborate with colleagues to build technical solutions to hard problems More About Our Team You'll join a team that is smart and very direct. We challenge each other to improve our work, learn, and ask hard questions. We're dedicated to Agile methodology and are big believers in 'lean' (which means we don't do documentation for documentation's sake). We know the importance of validating assumptions about users and use several types of testing to figure out whether we're right (or wrong). Our bottom line is improving our user's experience—no matter what. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian is looking for an expert Solutions Architect to join their IT Applications (Finance Technology) team. The team is tasked with optimizing the systems and processes that drive Atlassian from Payroll, Procure to Pay, Quote to cash, Talent Management and Recruiting. In this role, you will establish a winning partnership with internal Architecture, Delivery and Finance Accounting teams in providing creative solutions to meet the business capabilities. You will be involved in various aspects of identifying, designing and adopting industry leading best practices in such a way that such solutions are built to scale with our growing business. Responsibilities We love solution specialists who are appreciative, analytical problem solvers with appetite and passion to build the best-in-class, future proof design and deployments. Your colleagues would describe you as a credible partner who can take the most gnarly challenges on hand and arrive at a systematic way of solving for it by meeting both technical architectural standards as well as business requirements. You constantly assessing system functionality vs. evolving business capability needs and requirements; is a good liaison with business partners, finance and other cross-functional stakeholders to ensure future-proof process design, data integrity and security standards. More about you On you first day, we'd love for you to : Own and recommend Technology Strategy & Architecture for enterprise level initiatives for the Finance Business Capabilities and Applications Portfolio. Have strong problem solving abilities given various constraints around process and systems. Have experience building conceptual and logical architectures and procure required artifacts and documentation of such systems/landscapes, process design documents. Bring experience with governance of initiatives that align with the overall enterprise architecture guidelines and principles. Have 2+ years of experience at a Solution architect or lead technical architect capacity in an Agile/ Hybrid development environment for transformational programs in the Quote to Cash, Commerce Finance Integration areas Have strong stakeholder management skills and is able to connect with leadership as well as operational user communities. Have 7+ years of overall work experience in an IT e-Commerce/Finance focused environment, and 4+ years in the Finance Invoice to Cash domain. 2+ years in the ERP Architecture and Compliance/Security Standards focused role . Have led the technology architecture and design strategy for at least one full lifecycle of several cross-functional modules towards an ERP/Finance Systems Implementation - preferably Cloud/Hosted model. Develop solutions and processes that support a rapidly scaling global footprint. Translate business requirements into solutions with the BSA’s and assist in the creation of the delivery roadmap, estimates. Complete change impact assessments across functions and be able to connect the dots from front office- back office Having a core financials transformation experience as a plus Be adept in the evolving technology landscape and an innovative approach to solving some of the gnarly gaps prevailing in the Commerce - Finance Systems integration zone. Partner with broader Enterprise Architecture teams towards building a robust IT Platform for Finance , Vendor evaluation/heat maps and long term IT investment strategy. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Atlassian's Channel community is growing and we are looking for amazing TEAM members to help us evolve and scale our Specializations Partner program to the next level. You will be a necessary part of the Global Channel Team, leading the Specializations Partner Program for Atlassian. As the team lead, you will develop the direction and roadmap for specialization programs at Atlassian along with creating and managing programs and project-based programs for Partners (Solution Partners, Integrators, Aggregators, & Resellers) in the Americas, EMEA and Asia Pacific regions. These programs help our ecosystems of Partners differentiate themselves with solution competencies across Atlassian's 3 major markets - Agile and DevOps, IT Service Management, and Work Management for All. You are an experienced business leader with industry expertise driving solution partner programs. You will help in the evolution and launch of new specializations, define roadmap plans, and deliver programs that motivate and excite our Solution Partners. The Specializations Partner Programs Team Lead is responsible for the design and effectiveness of the Atlassian Specialization Programs (frameworks, capacity planning and processes for their programs). You will build a specializations program that has Channel Partners investing in practice development and delivering customer success with Atlassian products and solutions. Responsibilities Directly manage a team of specializations partner program managers and project teams. Optimize the specialization programs to motivate partners to invest in building an Atlassian solution practice and accelerate growth. Lead teams in forecasting program resources and return on investments made within the channel. Create end-to-end go to market requirements to promote Partner success in selling and implementing Atlassian products and solutions. Establish and define plans and key results that support Atlassian's Channel strategy and company mission. Collaborate with Marketing, Sales, Channel Managers, Operations, Finance, Revenue, and technical teams at senior levels within the company to identify, design, and implement programs necessary to allow channel partners to exceed our goals. On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have 10+ years of related channel programs or channel marketing experience. BA/BS degree in Marketing, Business, Finance or equivalent experience. An understanding of Channel Partner business models and what roles Partners can play to help solution, sell, and add services with software and SaaS products. Proven leadership in a global software or cloud organization. The ability to design and execute a portfolio of balanced programs for external Channel Partners using requirements and rewards to bring a motivational behavior with care for Atlassian's Channel strategy. Excellent communication, organizational, financial/analytical and interpersonal skills working with executive leadership internally and with channel partners. We are looking for a track record in messaging/positioning, program management, and broad execution capabilities. A requirement is to motivate, leverage, and manage our teams on a project basis to accomplish the program strategy. Experience driving business plans, financial models, and data & analytics to justify programs and roadmap. A desire to communicate through dashboards, reports, and charts to communicate and inform your team on progress of projects. Experience leading channel programs and teams, but also are open to learning how to be successful in Atlassian's unique business model. It's Great, But Not Required, If You Have A Master's Degree in Business or Marketing Channel marketing and partner/sales operations experience This position is within the Global Channels organization reporting to the Head of Global Partner Programs Strategy and will work with teams across Atlassian. The channel team is a fun and high-energy group tasked to build programs to attract go-to-market with partners (Solution Partners, Integrators, Aggregators, Services Partners, Technology Partners & Resellers) representing the Americas, EMEA, and APAC. Working with over 700 global channel partners we must ensure our programs support a variety of businesses. We are an important part of Atlassian's broader field operations group, which has a unique approach to delivering value to our customers. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. jobTitle: Sr. Channel Business Development Manager, ITSM
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. Your future team At Atlassian, we are on a mission to help our customers compete and win in the modern, digital economy. We have built a multi-billion-dollar, fast-growing software business with over 200,000 paying customers, and millions of users around the globe. Many of these organizations acquire Atlassian tools through our global network of partners, who provide a diverse range of enterprise solutions - such as those powered by our Jira Service Management (JSM) product, where Atlassian and our partners are working to improve the current Service Management (ITSM & ESM) market space. We are seeking a highly experienced senior strategic channel leader for a key role within our IT service management channel team. This individual will drive the regional partner growth strategy, go-to-market and channel development. By taking a macro view of the region you will establish a plan to drive partner growth, and and drive expansion of the partner community. You will play a key part in a global team dedicated to ensuring the success of partners both new and existing in one of our fastest growing segments. What You'll Do Contribute the regional strategy for growing Atlassian's Jira Service Management eco-system. Be the face of our fast-growing Jira Service Management product, consulting our partners' senior leadership on achieving revenue success Working with our recruitment team, identify target Service Management partners to selectively grow our eco-system Manage partner co-marketing efforts, training, and ensuring partners are working with our sales teams Collaborate with a regional channel team to ensure successful outcomes for your region Contribute globally to help Introduce new ideas for both recruitment and partner success Assess channel coverage, partner capacity and recruitment requirements - across a range of different partnership models within your region Responsibility for channel demand generation programs Partner with Enterprise Sales on optimizing the co-selling motion and building a pipeline Align with team members in the channel organization to achieve results Collaborate across Atlassian to build and deliver a coordinated enablement model Your Background You have 6+ years of experience in the Service Management industry and complimentary experience working with Partners. Deep industry knowledge of leading competitors and clear view of the industry dynamics Complete understanding of what it takes for a partner to be successful in delivering services Experience working with channel program teams, channel marketing and sales teams You will focus and guide channel programs, but also keep an eye on the business as a whole You bring a record of exceeding performance metrics - both sales and non-revenue targets Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. Many of these organizations acquire Atlassian tools through our global network of partners, who provide a diverse range of enterprise solutions - such as those powered by our Jira Service Management (JSM) product, where Atlassian and our partners are working to improve the current Service Management (ITSM & ESM) market space. We are seeking a highly experienced senior strategic channel leader for a key role within our IT service management channel team. This individual will drive the regional partner growth strategy, go-to-market and channel development. By taking a macro view of the region you will establish a plan to drive partner growth, and and drive expansion of the partner community. You will play a key part in a global team dedicated to ensuring the success of partners both new and existing in one of our fastest growing segments. What You'll Do Contribute the regional strategy for growing Atlassian's Jira Service Management eco-system. Be the face of our fast-growing Jira Service Management product, consulting our partners' senior leadership on achieving revenue success Working with our recruitment team, identify target Service Management partners to selectively grow our eco-system Manage partner co-marketing efforts, training, and ensuring partners are working with our sales teams Collaborate with a regional channel team to ensure successful outcomes for your region Contribute globally to help Introduce new ideas for both recruitment and partner success Assess channel coverage, partner capacity and recruitment requirements - across a range of different partnership models within your region Responsibility for channel demand generation programs Partner with Enterprise Sales on optimizing the co-selling motion and building a pipeline Align with team members in the channel organization to achieve results Collaborate across Atlassian to build and deliver a coordinated enablement model Your Background You have 6+ years of experience in the Service Management industry and complimentary experience working with Partners. Deep industry knowledge of leading competitors and clear view of the industry dynamics Complete understanding of what it takes for a partner to be successful in delivering services Experience working with channel program teams, channel marketing and sales teams You will focus and guide channel programs, but also keep an eye on the business as a whole You bring a record of exceeding performance metrics - both sales and non-revenue targets Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team . We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. To learn more about our culture and hiring process, explore our Candidate Resource Hub .

Atlassian is seeking a dynamic Sr. Financial Analyst to help shape and drive forward the vision of one of the fastest growing companies in the market. In this position, you'll oversee the operational plan for the CTO & Trust organization, partner directly with our leadership team to analyze performance metrics and business scenarios to drive strategic decisions. This role will report to the R&D Strategy, Operation and CTO Finance Lead. You will play a key role in the budgeting/forecasting process, business performance reporting, monthly close process, purchase requisitions reviews, headcount change management, infrastructure forecasting, licensing optimisations and modelling, operational improvements, and you will be able to provide support on key projects being undertaken in the finance R&D strategy team to help drive improvements and efficiencies through the R&D organisation. Besides working with the R&D organization and the FP&A team, you will also work closely with the broader finance team including Accounting, Procurement, Talent Acquisition and Human Resources. In This Role, You'll Get To Partner with the CTO and Trust organization to develop forecasts and ensure the group delivers within their budgets that are set Build deep business partner relationships across the organization to drive cost savings and efficiency improvements Prepare monthly and quarterly management reporting – analyzing financial results, distilling/synthesizing key trends, and communicating business insights to the leadership team Lead and align team members across the R&D organization, to prepare financial analysis, decision support analysis, financial modeling and provide ad-hoc analytical support Facilitate finance optimization efforts and help us build a world-class FP&A organization by developing, standardizing, maintaining and driving continuous improvement of all planning and forecast process Help drive efficiencies in the R&D organisation by providing support on the key projects that are being undertaken within the Finance R&D Strategy team On Your First Day, We'll Expect You To Have Experience partnering with R&D teams and senior executives to influence strategic decisions, set budgets, prioritize spend and report/present on financial metrics Strong analytical and interpersonal skills to clearly articulate key business and financial impacts/implications Positive attitude, high attention to details, collaborative and comfort in working in a matrix organization Ability take charge and drive results independently, while remaining team oriented Ability to prioritize objectives in a fast-paced environment to ensure key deliverables are met in a timely manner Minimum 3+ years of Finance or Accounting work experience required Strong technical fundamentals such as spreadsheets (e.g., Google Sheets, MS Excel) and exposure to tools such as Anaplan, Tableau, Workday, and Coupa are a plus Experience in Technology or Software / SaaS industry and working in R&D/Operation function is a plus but not required Experience with cloud provider spend such as AWS a plus but not required More About Our Team Atlassian has a business model, with a focus on growth and profitability, that is rare among its growth technology peers. We also have an analytics DNA that runs deep through the company's core. FP&A is a highly visible team in the organization at the intersection of both these focus areas. The FP&A team is a hardworking and collaborative team with a unique mix of technology industry, consulting and financial services background. Our responsibilities include facilitating planning, providing insight into business performance, supporting strategic decision making and helping predict the future of the business. We encourage decision-making at every level and highly value an open-minded approach and organizational openness. We work closely with leaders across all areas of the business to support Atlassian's continued growth. You'll join an outstanding team that is passionate about Atlassian, its products, and its customers. jobTitle: Sr Partner Solutions Strategist - ITSM, AMERICAS
jobDescription: Working at Atlassian Atlassian can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity. Assuming you have eligible working rights and a sufficient time zone overlap with your team, you can choose to work remotely or return to an office as they reopen (unless it’s necessary for your role to be performed in the office). Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. At Atlassian, we are on a mission to help our customers compete and win in the modern, digital economy. We have built a multi-billion-dollar, fast-growing software business with over 200,000 paying customers, and millions of users around the globe. Many of these organisations acquire Atlassian tools through our global network of partners, who deliver a diverse range of enterprise solutions - such as those powered by our Jira Service Management (JSM) product, where Atlassian and our partners are working to disrupt the current Service Management market space. We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Partner Solutions Strategist for a key role within our Partner Solutions Acceleration team. This individual will drive our Service Management Partner Solutions strategy, capability and channel development. By taking a macro view, you will establish a plan to drive partner capability, and drive expansion of the partner community. You will collaborate with the Channel business development and Partner managers, Marketing, Sales, Technical Architects and play a key part in a global team dedicated to ensuring the success of partners both new and existing in one of our fastest growing segments. There is simply not a more exciting and impactful service management practice building opportunity anywhere. Is this the opportunity for you? In This Role, You’ll Get To Establish a regional capability and enablement strategy in collaboration with Regional Solution Strategists, Customer Advisory, Channel, Programs Sales and Marketing team to grow and accelerate our Service Management partner eco-system. Provide leadership, guidance and work collaboratively with Atlassian partners to create packaged implementation ITSM services, solutions and GTM strategy based on JSM. Conduct JSM capability and enablement workshops with partners. Lead EMEA channel efforts focused on Service Management Solution market success. Assess channel coverage, partner capacity and recruitment requirements for Service Management Partner eco-system across a range of different partnership models. Team with Enterprise Sales on educating them on partner capabilities and optimizing the co-selling motion. Align and collaborate with counterparts in the Customer Success, Channel and Sales organization to drive results. Collaborate across Atlassian to build and deliver a coordinated capability model. More About You You will have 8+ years of product, consulting and sales experience within the ITSM, Digital Transformation and other enterprise solutions. A history of working effectively in matrix organization where internal/external bridge-building and partnering is an essential quality. Good to have experience working with Partners. Excellent business insight with outcome driven approach! Understanding of how to position and sell value, calculate return on investment, and consultative selling. Mastered executive communication, but also feel comfortable conducting workshops and working with technology teams. While highly proficient and confident, you remain coachable and strive to be the very best. Your ego is fully in-check. You will focus and drive service management channel and thought leadership initiatives, but also keep an eye on the business as a whole. You bring a proven record of meeting or exceeding performance metrics - both sales as well as non-revenue targets. An extreme sense of responsibility and accountability. We have ambitious goals and need you to execute relentlessly to “get stuff done”. About The Team The Partner Solutions Acceleration Team is part of the Customer Success & Innovation (CSI) team with the objective of accelerating Channel by enabling and collaborating with partners to build, market, sell and implement our market leading Scaled agile and Devops, workplace management and ITSM solutions. This is a specialist team with deep industry and technology solutions expertise, and are responsible for Channel driven specialist business. We are doubling down on building out this high-impact team as a compliment to our Channel Organisation - all in synergy with our uniquely-powerful, low-friction flywheel that adds thousands of new customers per quarter! Above all, we believe in the Atlassian values and use them as our compass in constantly refining and enabling our Channel model, one that is redefining how channel can help and accelerate our customers adoption through solutions based approach using our software. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. About Atlassian The world’s best teams work better together with Atlassian. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team . We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status. Interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a distributed-first company. At Atlassian, we are on a mission to help our customers compete and win in the modern, digital economy. We have built a multi-billion-dollar, fast-growing software business with over 200,000 paying customers, and millions of users around the globe. Many of these organisations acquire Atlassian tools through our global network of partners, who deliver a diverse range of enterprise solutions - such as those powered by our Jira Service Management (JSM) product, where Atlassian and our partners are working to disrupt the current Service Management market space. We are seeking a highly experienced Senior Partner Solutions Strategist for a key role within our Partner Solutions Acceleration team. This individual will drive our Service Management Partner Solutions strategy, capability and channel development. By taking a macro view, you will establish a plan to drive partner capability, and drive expansion of the partner community. You will collaborate with the Channel business development and Partner managers, Marketing, Sales, Technical Architects and play a key part in a global team dedicated to ensuring the success of partners both new and existing in one of our fastest growing segments. There is simply not a more exciting and impactful service management practice building opportunity anywhere. Is this the opportunity for you? In This Role, You’ll Get To Establish a regional capability and enablement strategy in collaboration with Regional Solution Strategists, Customer Advisory, Channel, Programs Sales and Marketing team to grow and accelerate our Service Management partner eco-system. Provide leadership, guidance and work collaboratively with Atlassian partners to create packaged implementation ITSM services, solutions and GTM strategy based on JSM. Conduct JSM capability and enablement workshops with partners. Lead EMEA channel efforts focused on Service Management Solution market success. Assess channel coverage, partner capacity and recruitment requirements for Service Management Partner eco-system across a range of different partnership models. Team with Enterprise Sales on educating them on partner capabilities and optimizing the co-selling motion. Align and collaborate with counterparts in the Customer Success, Channel and Sales organization to drive results. Collaborate across Atlassian to build and deliver a coordinated capability model. More About You You will have 8+ years of product, consulting and sales experience within the ITSM, Digital Transformation and other enterprise solutions. A history of working effectively in matrix organization where internal/external bridge-building and partnering is an essential quality. Good to have experience working with Partners. Excellent business insight with outcome driven approach! Understanding of how to position and sell value, calculate return on investment, and consultative selling. Mastered executive communication, but also feel comfortable conducting workshops and working with technology teams. While highly proficient and confident, you remain coachable and strive to be the very best. Your ego is fully in-check. You will focus and drive service management channel and thought leadership initiatives, but also keep an eye on the business as a whole. You bring a proven record of meeting or exceeding performance metrics - both sales as well as non-revenue targets. An extreme sense of responsibility and accountability. We have ambitious goals and need you to execute relentlessly to “get stuff done”. About The Team The Partner Solutions Acceleration Team is part of the Customer Success & Innovation (CSI) team with the objective of accelerating Channel by enabling and collaborating with partners to build, market, sell and implement our market leading Scaled agile and Devops, workplace management and ITSM solutions. This is a specialist team with deep industry and technology solutions expertise, and are responsible for Channel driven specialist business. We are doubling down on building out this high-impact team as a compliment to our Channel Organisation - all in synergy with our uniquely-powerful, low-friction flywheel that adds thousands of new customers per quarter! Above all, we believe in the Atlassian values and use them as our compass in constantly refining and enabling our Channel model, one that is redefining how channel can help and accelerate our customers adoption through solutions based approach using our software. Our Perks & Benefits To support you at work and play, our perks and benefits include ample time off, an annual education budget, paid volunteer days, and so much more. About Atlassian The world’s best teams work better together with Atlassian. From medicine and space travel, to disaster response and pizza deliveries, Atlassian software products help teams all over the planet. At Atlassian, we're motivated by a common goal: to unleash the potential of every team . We believe that the unique contributions of all Atlassians create our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience, we never discriminate based on race, religion, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, or marital, veteran, or disability status.
